1.1: అల్లాహ్ పరమ దయాశీలుడు, అనంత కరుణామయుడు అయిన అల్లాహ్ నామంతో
1.2: సమస్త ప్రశంసలు అల్లాహ్‌కే చెందును, ఆయనే లోకాలన్నింటికి ప్రభువు
1.5: మేము నిన్నే ఆరాధిస్తాము మరియు నిన్నే సహాయం కోసం అడుగుతాము
1.7: వారి మార్గాన్ని వారిపై నీవు అనుగ్రహించావు, వారిపై నీ కోపం వచ్చిన వారి మార్గం కాదు మరియు దారిమళ్లిన వారి మార్గం కాదు

2.2: ఇది ఆ గ్రంథం, దీనిలో ఎటువంటి సందేహం లేదు, నీతిమంతులకు మార్గదర్శకం
2.3: వారు అగోచరానికి విశ్వసిస్తారు మరియు నమాజ్ స్థాపించుతారు మరియు మేము వారికి అందించిన దానిలో నుండి వ్యయం చేస్తారు
2.4: మరియు నీపై అవతరింపజేయబడిన దానిని మరియు నీకు ముందు అవతరింపజేయబడిన దానిని వారు విశ్వసిస్తారు మరియు పరలోకంపై వారు నిశ్చయం కలిగి ఉన్నారు
2.5: వారు వారి ప్రభువు నుండి మార్గదర్శనంపై ఉన్నారు మరియు వారే విజయవంతులు
2.6: నిశ్చయంగా కుఫ్ర్ చేసే వారికి, నీవు వారిని హెచ్చరించినా లేదా హెచ్చరించకపోయినా సమానం, వారు విశ్వసించరు
2.7: అల్లాహ్ వారి హృదయాలపై మరియు వారి వినికిడిపై ముద్ర వేసాడు మరియు వారి కళ్ళపై తెర ఉంది మరియు వారికి గొప్ప శిక్ష ఉంది

3.2: అల్లాహ్ - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.
3.3: He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the గ్రంథం in సత్యం, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.
3.5: Indeed, from అల్లాహ్ nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.
3.6: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
3.8: [Who say], "Our ప్రభువు, let not our హృదయాలు deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself దయ. Indeed, You are the Bestower.
3.9: Our ప్రభువు, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no సందేహం. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not fail in His promise."
3.10: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - never will their wealth or their children avail them against అల్లాహ్ at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.
3.11: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so అల్లాహ్ seized them for their sins. And అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty.
3.13: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and another of disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But అల్లాహ్ supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.
3.14: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but అల్లాహ్ has with Him the best return.
3.15: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear అల్లాహ్ will be gardens in the presence of their ప్రభువు beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of [His] servants -
3.16: Those who say, "Our ప్రభువు, indeed we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the శిక్ష of the Fire,"
3.17: The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of అల్లాహ్], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.
3.18: అల్లాహ్ witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
3.19: Indeed, the religion in the sight of అల్లాహ్ is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disవిశ్వసిస్తారుs in the verses of అల్లాహ్, then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is swift in [taking] account.
3.20: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to అల్లాహ్ [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of [His] servants.
3.22: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.
3.23: Do you not consider, [O Muhammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Scripture of అల్లాహ్ that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.
3.24: That is because they say, "Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days," and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.
3.25: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no సందేహం? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
3.26: Say, "O అల్లాహ్, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.
3.27: You cause the night to enter the day, and You cause the day to enter the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give provision to whom You will without account."
3.28: Let not విశ్వసిస్తారుrs take disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs as allies rather than విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. And whoever [of you] does that has nothing with అల్లాహ్, except when taking precaution against them in prudence. And అల్లాహ్ warns you of Himself, and to అల్లాహ్ is the [final] destination.
3.29: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, అల్లాహ్ knows it. And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
3.30: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And అల్లాహ్ warns you of Himself, and అల్లాహ్ is Kind to [His] servants."
3.31: Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love అల్లాహ్, then follow me, [so] అల్లాహ్ will love you and forgive you your sins. And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful."
3.32: Say, "Obey అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not like the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.33: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -
3.34: Descendants, some of them from others. And అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
3.35: [Mention, O Muhammad], when the wife of 'Imran said, "My ప్రభువు, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."
3.37: So her ప్రభువు accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the నమాజ్ chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ provides for whom He wills without account."
3.38: At that, Zechariah called upon his ప్రభువు, saying, "My ప్రభువు, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."
3.40: He said, "My ప్రభువు, how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?" The angel said, "Such is అల్లాహ్; He does what He wills."
3.41: He said, "My ప్రభువు, make for me a sign." He Said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your ప్రభువు much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."
3.42: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed అల్లాహ్ has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.
3.43: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your ప్రభువు and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in నమాజ్]."
3.44: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.
3.45: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed అల్లాహ్ gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to అల్లాహ్].
3.47: She said, "My ప్రభువు, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is అల్లాహ్; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
3.48: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel
3.49: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your ప్రభువు in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of అల్లాహ్. And I cure the blind and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of అల్లాహ్. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.50: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your ప్రభువు, so fear అల్లాహ్ and obey me.
3.52: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] అల్లాహ్?" The disciples said, "We are supporters for అల్లాహ్. We have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].
3.53: Our ప్రభువు, we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in what You revealed and have followed the messenger Jesus, so register us among the witnesses [to సత్యం]."
3.54: And the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs planned, but అల్లాహ్ planned. And అల్లాహ్ is the best of planners.
3.55: [Mention] when అల్లాహ్ said, "O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు and make those who follow you [in submission to అల్లాహ్ alone] superior to those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.
3.56: And as for those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, I will punish them with a severe శిక్ష in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers."
3.58: This is what We recite to you, [O Muhammad], of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message.
3.59: Indeed, the example of Jesus to అల్లాహ్ is like that of Adam. He created Him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.
3.60: The సత్యం is from your ప్రభువు, so do not be among the సందేహంers.
3.61: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of అల్లాహ్ upon the liars [among us]."
3.62: Indeed, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except అల్లాహ్. And indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
3.63: But if they turn away, then indeed - అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of the corrupters.
3.64: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except అల్లాహ్ and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of అల్లాహ్." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
3.65: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?
3.66: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And అల్లాహ్ knows, while you know not.
3.67: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was one inclining toward సత్యం, a Muslim [submitting to అల్లాహ్]. And he was not of the polytheists.
3.68: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to అల్లాహ్] and this prophet, and those who విశ్వసిస్తారు [in his message]. And అల్లాహ్ is the ally of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.69: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
3.71: O People of the Scripture, why do you confuse the సత్యం with falsehood and conceal the సత్యం while you know [it]?
3.73: And do not trust except those who follow your religion." Say, "Indeed, the [true] మార్గదర్శనం is the మార్గదర్శనం of అల్లాహ్. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your ప్రభువు?" Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of అల్లాహ్ - He grants it to whom He wills. And అల్లాహ్ is all-Encompassing and Wise."
3.74: He selects for His దయ whom He wills. And అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.
3.75: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a [single] silver coin, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, "There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned." And they speak unసత్యం about అల్లాహ్ while they know [it].
3.76: But yes, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears అల్లాహ్ - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves those who fear Him.
3.77: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of అల్లాహ్ and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and అల్లాహ్ will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful శిక్ష.
3.78: And indeed, there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "This is from అల్లాహ్," but it is not from అల్లాహ్. And they speak unసత్యం about అల్లాహ్ while they know.
3.79: It is not for a human [prophet] that అల్లాహ్ should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, "Be servants to me rather than అల్లాహ్," but [instead, he would say], "Be pious scholars of the ప్రభువు because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied."
3.80: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?
3.82: And whoever turned away after that - they were the defiantly disobedient.
3.83: So is it other than the religion of అల్లాహ్ they desire, while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth, willingly or by compulsion, and to Him they will be returned?
3.84: Say, "We have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their ప్రభువు. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."
3.85: And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
3.86: How shall అల్లాహ్ guide a people who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them? And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people.
3.87: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of అల్లాహ్ and the angels and the people, all together,
3.88: Abiding eternally therein. The శిక్ష will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
3.89: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
3.90: Indeed, those who reject the message after their belief and then increase in disbelief - never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted, and they are the ones astray.
3.91: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు and die while they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs - never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful శిక్ష, and they will have no helpers.
3.92: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of అల్లాహ్] from that which you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of it.
3.93: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, [O Muhammad], "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be సత్యంful."
3.94: And whoever invents about అల్లాహ్ unసత్యం after that - then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.
3.95: Say, "అల్లాహ్ has told the సత్యం. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward సత్యం; and he was not of the polytheists."
3.96: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah - blessed and a మార్గదర్శనం for the worlds.
3.97: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to అల్లాహ్ from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disవిశ్వసిస్తారుs - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is free from need of the worlds.
3.99: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of అల్లాహ్ those who విశ్వసిస్తారు, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the సత్యం]? And అల్లాహ్ is not unaware of what you do."
3.100: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.102: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear అల్లాహ్ as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].
3.103: And hold firmly to the rope of అల్లాహ్ all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your హృదయాలు together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does అల్లాహ్ make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
3.104: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the విజయంful.
3.105: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great శిక్ష.
3.106: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], "Did you disవిశ్వసిస్తారు after your belief? Then taste the శిక్ష for what you used to reject."
3.107: But as for those whose faces will turn white, [they will be] within the దయ of అల్లాహ్. They will abide therein eternally.
3.108: These are the verses of అల్లాహ్. We recite them to you, [O Muhammad], in సత్యం; and అల్లాహ్ wants no injustice to the worlds.
3.109: To అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to అల్లాహ్ will [all] matters be returned.
3.111: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs; then they will not be aided.
3.112: They have been put under humiliation [by అల్లాహ్] wherever they are overtaken, except for a covenant from అల్లాహ్ and a rope from the Muslims. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from అల్లాహ్ and have been put under destitution. That is because they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in the verses of అల్లాహ్ and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
3.113: They are not [all] the same; among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of అల్లాహ్ during periods of the night and prostrating [in నమాజ్].
3.116: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - never will their wealth or their children avail them against అల్లాహ్ at all, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
3.117: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it. And అల్లాహ్ has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.
3.118: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason.
3.120: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear అల్లాహ్, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is encompassing of what they do.
3.121: And [remember] when you, [O Muhammad], left your family in the morning to post the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs at their stations for the battle [of Uhud] - and అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing -
3.122: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but అల్లాహ్ was their ally; and upon అల్లాహ్ the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs should rely.
3.123: And already had అల్లాహ్ given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were few in number. Then fear అల్లాహ్; perhaps you will be grateful.
3.124: [Remember] when you said to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, "Is it not sufficient for you that your ప్రభువు should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?
3.125: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of అల్లాహ్ and the enemy come upon you [attacking] in rage, your ప్రభువు will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]
3.126: And అల్లాహ్ made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your హృదయాలు thereby. And victory is not except from అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise -
3.127: That He might cut down a section of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.
3.128: Not for you, [O Muhammad, but for అల్లాహ్], is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them, for indeed, they are wrongdoers.
3.129: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
3.130: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear అల్లాహ్ that you may be విజయంful.
3.131: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.132: And obey అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger that you may obtain దయ.
3.134: Who spend [in the cause of అల్లాహ్] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and అల్లాహ్ loves the doers of good;
3.135: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression], remember అల్లాహ్ and seek forgiveness for their sins - and who can forgive sins except అల్లాహ్? - and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.
3.137: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you, so proceed throughout the earth and observe how was the end of those who denied.
3.138: This [Qur'an] is a clear statement to [all] the people and a మార్గదర్శనం and instruction for those conscious of అల్లాహ్.
3.139: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.140: If a wound should touch you - there has already touched the [opposing] people a wound similar to it. And these days [of varying conditions] We alternate among the people so that అల్లాహ్ may make evident those who విశ్వసిస్తారు and [may] take to Himself from among you martyrs - and అల్లాహ్ does not like the wrongdoers -
3.141: And that అల్లాహ్ may purify the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs [through trials] and destroy the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.143: And you had certainly wished for martyrdom before you encountered it, and you have [now] seen it [before you] while you were looking on.
3.144: Muhammad is not but a messenger. [Other] messengers have passed on before him. So if he was to die or be killed, would you turn back on your heels [to unbelief]? And he who turns back on his heels will never harm అల్లాహ్ at all; but అల్లాహ్ will reward the grateful.
3.145: And it is not [possible] for one to die except by permission of అల్లాహ్ at a decree determined. And whoever desires the reward of this world - We will give him thereof; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter - We will give him thereof. And we will reward the grateful.
3.146: And how many a prophet [fought and] with him fought many religious scholars. But they never lost assurance due to what afflicted them in the cause of అల్లాహ్, nor did they weaken or submit. And అల్లాహ్ loves the steadfast.
3.147: And their words were not but that they said, "Our ప్రభువు, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."
3.148: So అల్లాహ్ gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And అల్లాహ్ loves the doers of good.
3.149: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, if you obey those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will [then] become losers.
3.150: But అల్లాహ్ is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.
3.151: We will cast terror into the హృదయాలు of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు for what they have associated with అల్లాహ్ of which He had not sent down [any] authority. And their refuge will be the Fire, and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.
3.152: And అల్లాహ్ had certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing the enemy by His permission until [the time] when you lost courage and fell to disputing about the order [given by the Prophet] and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love. Among you are some who desire this world, and among you are some who desire the Hereafter. Then he turned you back from them [defeated] that He might test you. And He has already forgiven you, and అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of bounty for the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.153: [Remember] when you [fled and] climbed [the mountain] without looking aside at anyone while the Messenger was calling you from behind. So అల్లాహ్ repaid you with distress upon distress so you would not grieve for that which had escaped you [of victory and spoils of war] or [for] that which had befallen you [of injury and death]. And అల్లాహ్ is [fully] Acquainted with what you do.
3.154: Then after distress, He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness, overcoming a faction of you, while another faction worried about themselves, thinking of అల్లాహ్ other than the సత్యం - the thought of ignorance, saying, "Is there anything for us [to have done] in this matter?" Say, "Indeed, the matter belongs completely to అల్లాహ్." They conceal within themselves what they will not reveal to you. They say, "If there was anything we could have done in the matter, some of us would not have been killed right here." Say, "Even if you had been inside your houses, those decreed to be killed would have come out to their death beds." [It was] so that అల్లాహ్ might test what is in your breasts and purify what is in your హృదయాలు. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of that within the breasts.
3.155: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day the two armies met, it was Satan who caused them to slip because of some [blame] they had earned. But అల్లాహ్ has already forgiven them. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Forbearing.
3.156: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not be like those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and said about their brothers when they traveled through the land or went out to fight, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or have been killed," so అల్లాహ్ makes that [misconception] a regret within their హృదయాలు. And it is అల్లాహ్ who gives life and causes death, and అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of what you do.
3.157: And if you are killed in the cause of అల్లాహ్ or die - then forgiveness from అల్లాహ్ and దయ are better than whatever they accumulate [in this world].
3.158: And whether you die or are killed, unto అల్లాహ్ you will be gathered.
3.159: So by దయ from అల్లాహ్, [O Muhammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves those who rely [upon Him].
3.160: If అల్లాహ్ should aid you, no one can overcome you; but if He should forsake you, who is there that can aid you after Him? And upon అల్లాహ్ let the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs rely.
3.161: It is not [attributable] to any prophet that he would act unfaithfully [in regard to war booty]. And whoever betrays, [taking unlawfully], will come with what he took on the Day of Resurrection. Then will every soul be [fully] compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
3.163: They are [varying] degrees in the sight of అల్లాహ్, and అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of whatever they do.
3.164: Certainly did అల్లాహ్ confer [great] favor upon the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the గ్రంథం and wisdom, although they had been before in manifest error.
3.165: Why [is it that] when a [single] disaster struck you [on the day of Uhud], although you had struck [the enemy in the battle of Badr] with one twice as great, you said, "From where is this?" Say, "It is from yourselves." Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
3.166: And what struck you on the day the two armies met was by permission of అల్లాహ్ that He might make evident the [true] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.167: And that He might make evident those who are hypocrites. For it was said to them, "Come, fight in the way of అల్లాహ్ or [at least] defend." They said, "If we had known [there would be] fighting, we would have followed you." They were nearer to disbelief that day than to faith, saying with their mouths what was not in their హృదయాలు. And అల్లాహ్ is most Knowing of what they conceal -
3.168: Those who said about their brothers while sitting [at home], "If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed." Say, "Then prevent death from yourselves, if you should be సత్యంful."
3.169: And never think of those who have been killed in the cause of అల్లాహ్ as dead. Rather, they are alive with their ప్రభువు, receiving provision,
3.170: Rejoicing in what అల్లాహ్ has bestowed upon them of His bounty, and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them who have not yet joined them - that there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
3.171: They receive good tidings of favor from అల్లాహ్ and bounty and [of the fact] that అల్లాహ్ does not allow the reward of విశ్వసిస్తారుrs to be lost -
3.172: Those [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] who responded to అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them and feared అల్లాహ్ is a great reward -
3.173: Those to whom hypocrites said, "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." But it [merely] increased them in faith, and they said, "Sufficient for us is అల్లాహ్, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs."
3.174: So they returned with favor from అల్లాహ్ and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of అల్లాహ్, and అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.
3.175: That is only Satan who frightens [you] of his supporters. So fear them not, but fear Me, if you are [indeed] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
3.176: And do not be grieved, [O Muhammad], by those who hasten into disbelief. Indeed, they will never harm అల్లాహ్ at all. అల్లాహ్ intends that He should give them no share in the Hereafter, and for them is a great శిక్ష.
3.177: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief [in exchange] for faith - never will they harm అల్లాహ్ at all, and for them is a painful శిక్ష.
3.178: And let not those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is better for them. We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating శిక్ష.
3.180: And let not those who [greedily] withhold what అల్లాహ్ has given them of His bounty ever think that it is better for them. Rather, it is worse for them. Their necks will be encircled by what they withheld on the Day of Resurrection. And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. And అల్లాహ్, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.
3.181: అల్లాహ్ has certainly heard the statement of those [Jews] who said, "Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is poor, while we are rich." We will record what they said and their killing of the prophets without right and will say, "Taste the శిక్ష of the Burning Fire.
3.182: That is for what your hands have put forth and because అల్లాహ్ is not ever unjust to [His] servants."
3.183: [They are] those who said, "Indeed, అల్లాహ్ has taken our promise not to విశ్వసిస్తారు any messenger until he brings us an offering which fire [from heaven] will consume." Say, "There have already come to you messengers before me with clear proofs and [even] that of which you speak. So why did you kill them, if you should be సత్యంful?"
3.184: Then if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so were messengers denied before you, who brought clear proofs and written ordinances and the enlightening Scripture.
3.186: You will surely be tested in your possessions and in yourselves. And you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you and from those who associate others with అల్లాహ్ much abuse. But if you are patient and fear అల్లాహ్ - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of determination.
3.187: And [mention, O Muhammad], when అల్లాహ్ took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], "You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it." But they threw it away behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. And wretched is that which they purchased.
3.188: And never think that those who rejoice in what they have perpetrated and like to be praised for what they did not do - never think them [to be] in safety from the శిక్ష, and for them is a painful శిక్ష.
3.189: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
3.190: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the night and the day are signs for those of understanding.
3.191: Who remember అల్లాహ్ while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying], "Our ప్రభువు, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the శిక్ష of the Fire.
3.192: Our ప్రభువు, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
3.194: Our ప్రభువు, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise."
3.195: And their ప్రభువు responded to them, "Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another. So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed - I will surely remove from them their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from అల్లాహ్, and అల్లాహ్ has with Him the best reward."
3.196: Be not deceived by the [uninhibited] movement of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs throughout the land.
3.200: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear అల్లాహ్ that you may be విజయంful.

4.1: O mankind, fear your ప్రభువు, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear అల్లాహ్, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, over you, an Observer.
4.2: And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.
4.3: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].
4.4: And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.
4.5: And do not give the weak-minded your property, which అల్లాహ్ has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
4.6: And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Accountant.
4.7: For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.
4.8: And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
4.9: And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear అల్లాహ్ and speak words of appropriate justice.
4.10: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.
4.11: అల్లాహ్ instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.12: And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from అల్లాహ్, and అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Forbearing.
4.14: And whoever disobeys అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating శిక్ష.
4.15: Those who commit unlawful sexual intercourse of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or అల్లాహ్ ordains for them [another] way.
4.16: And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
4.17: The repentance accepted by అల్లాహ్ is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon after. It is those to whom అల్లాహ్ will turn in forgiveness, and అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.18: But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "Indeed, I have repented now," or of those who die while they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs. For them We have prepared a painful శిక్ష.
4.19: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and అల్లాహ్ makes therein much good.
4.20: But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?
4.21: And how could you take it while you have gone in unto each other and they have taken from you a solemn covenant?
4.22: And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married, except what has already occurred. Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to అల్లాహ్] and was evil as a way.
4.23: Prohibited to you [for marriage] are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters, your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your [milk] mothers who nursed you, your sisters through nursing, your wives' mothers, and your step-daughters under your guardianship [born] of your wives unto whom you have gone in. But if you have not gone in unto them, there is no sin upon you. And [also prohibited are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins, and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously, except for what has already occurred. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
4.24: And [also prohibited to you are all] married women except those your right hands possess. [This is] the decree of అల్లాహ్ upon you. And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these, [provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse. So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them, give them their due compensation as an obligation. And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.25: And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women, then [he may marry] from those whom your right hands possess of believing slave girls. And అల్లాహ్ is most knowing about your faith. You [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] are of one another. So marry them with the permission of their people and give them their due compensation according to what is acceptable. [They should be] chaste, neither [of] those who commit unlawful intercourse randomly nor those who take [secret] lovers. But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery, then for them is half the శిక్ష for free [unmarried] women. This [allowance] is for him among you who fears sin, but to be patient is better for you. And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
4.26: అల్లాహ్ wants to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful] and guide you to the [good] practices of those before you and to accept your repentance. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
4.27: అల్లాహ్ wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great deviation.
4.28: And అల్లాహ్ wants to lighten for you [your difficulties]; and mankind was created weak.
4.29: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is to you ever Merciful.
4.30: And whoever does that in aggression and injustice - then We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for అల్లాహ్, is [always] easy.
4.32: And do not wish for that by which అల్లాహ్ has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask అల్లాహ్ of his bounty. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, of all things, Knowing.
4.33: And for all, We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. And to those whom your oaths have bound [to you] - give them their share. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, over all things, a Witness.
4.35: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, అల్లాహ్ will cause it between them. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].
4.36: Worship అల్లాహ్ and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler, and those whom your right hands possess. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful.
4.37: Who are stingy and enjoin upon [other] people stinginess and conceal what అల్లాహ్ has given them of His bounty - and We have prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs a humiliating శిక్ష -
4.38: And [also] those who spend of their wealth to be seen by the people and విశ్వసిస్తారు not in అల్లాహ్ nor in the Last Day. And he to whom Satan is a companion - then evil is he as a companion.
4.39: And what [harm would come] upon them if they విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and the Last Day and spent out of what అల్లాహ్ provided for them? And అల్లాహ్ is ever, about them, Knowing.
4.40: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.
4.41: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness and we bring you, [O Muhammad] against these [people] as a witness?
4.42: That Day, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and disobeyed the Messenger will wish they could be covered by the earth. And they will not conceal from అల్లాహ్ a [single] statement.
4.43: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not approach నమాజ్ while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janabah, except those passing through [a place of నమాజ్], until you have washed [your whole body]. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and find no water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
4.44: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, purchasing error [in exchange for it] and wishing you would lose the way?
4.45: And అల్లాహ్ is most knowing of your enemies; and sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as an ally, and sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as a helper.
4.46: Among the Jews are those who distort words from their [proper] usages and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Ra'ina," twisting their tongues and defaming the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But అల్లాహ్ has cursed them for their disbelief, so they విశ్వసిస్తారు not, except for a few.
4.48: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with అల్లాహ్ has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.
4.49: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure? Rather, అల్లాహ్ purifies whom He wills, and injustice is not done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
4.50: Look how they invent about అల్లాహ్ unసత్యం, and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.
4.52: Those are the ones whom అల్లాహ్ has cursed; and he whom అల్లాహ్ curses - never will you find for him a helper.
4.53: Or have they a share of dominion? Then [if that were so], they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
4.54: Or do they envy people for what అల్లాహ్ has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.
4.58: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people to judge with justice. Excellent is that which అల్లాహ్ instructs you. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Hearing and Seeing.
4.60: Have you not seen those who claim to have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.
4.61: And when it is said to them, "Come to what అల్లాహ్ has revealed and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
4.62: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth and then they come to you swearing by అల్లాహ్, "We intended nothing but good conduct and accommodation."
4.63: Those are the ones of whom అల్లాహ్ knows what is in their హృదయాలు, so turn away from them but admonish them and speak to them a far-reaching word.
4.64: And We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by permission of అల్లాహ్. And if, when they wronged themselves, they had come to you, [O Muhammad], and asked forgiveness of అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found అల్లాహ్ Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
4.65: But no, by your ప్రభువు, they will not [truly] విశ్వసిస్తారు until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission.
4.66: And if We had decreed upon them, "Kill yourselves" or "Leave your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].
4.67: And then We would have given them from Us a great reward.
4.70: That is the bounty from అల్లాహ్, and sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Knower.
4.71: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, take your precaution and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.
4.72: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind; and if disaster strikes you, he says, "అల్లాహ్ has favored me in that I was not present with them."
4.73: But if bounty comes to you from అల్లాహ్, he will surely say, as if there had never been between you and him any affection. "Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have attained a great attainment."
4.74: So let those fight in the cause of అల్లాహ్ who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And he who fights in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.
4.75: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, "Our ప్రభువు, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?"
4.76: Those who విశ్వసిస్తారు fight in the cause of అల్లాహ్, and those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు fight in the cause of Taghut. So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.
4.77: Have you not seen those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish నమాజ్ and give zakah"? But then when fighting was ordained for them, at once a party of them feared men as they fear అల్లాహ్ or with [even] greater fear. They said, "Our ప్రభువు, why have You decreed upon us fighting? If only You had postponed [it for] us for a short time." Say, The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is better for he who fears అల్లాహ్. And injustice will not be done to you, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed]."
4.78: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you should be within towers of lofty construction. But if good comes to them, they say, "This is from అల్లాహ్ "; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you." Say, "All [things] are from అల్లాహ్." So what is [the matter] with those people that they can hardly understand any statement?
4.79: What comes to you of good is from అల్లాహ్, but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself. And We have sent you, [O Muhammad], to the people as a messenger, and sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Witness.
4.80: He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed అల్లాహ్; but those who turn away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
4.81: And they say, "[We pledge] obedience." But when they leave you, a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say. But అల్లాహ్ records what they plan by night. So leave them alone and rely upon అల్లాహ్. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Disposer of affairs.
4.82: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an? If it had been from [any] other than అల్లాహ్, they would have found within it much contradiction.
4.83: And when there comes to them information about [public] security or fear, they spread it around. But if they had referred it back to the Messenger or to those of authority among them, then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And if not for the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you and His దయ, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.
4.85: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a reward therefrom; and whoever intercedes for an evil cause will have a burden therefrom. And ever is అల్లాహ్, over all things, a Keeper.
4.86: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever, over all things, an Accountant.
4.87: అల్లాహ్ - there is no deity except Him. He will surely assemble you for [account on] the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no సందేహం. And who is more సత్యంful than అల్లాహ్ in statement.
4.88: What is [the matter] with you [that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites, while అల్లాహ్ has made them fall back [into error and disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom అల్లాహ్ has sent astray? And he whom అల్లాహ్ sends astray - never will you find for him a way [of మార్గదర్శనం].
4.89: They wish you would disవిశ్వసిస్తారు as they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of అల్లాహ్. But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.
4.90: Except for those who take refuge with a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty or those who come to you, their హృదయాలు strained at [the prospect of] fighting you or fighting their own people. And if అల్లాహ్ had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. So if they remove themselves from you and do not fight you and offer you peace, then అల్లాహ్ has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.
4.91: You will find others who wish to obtain security from you and [to] obtain security from their people. Every time they are returned to [the influence of] disbelief, they fall back into it. So if they do not withdraw from you or offer you peace or restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you overtake them. And those - We have made for you against them a clear authorization.
4.92: And never is it for a విశ్వసిస్తారుr to kill a విశ్వసిస్తారుr except by mistake. And whoever kills a విశ్వసిస్తారుr by mistake - then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment presented to the deceased's family [is required] unless they give [up their right as] charity. But if the deceased was from a people at war with you and he was a విశ్వసిస్తారుr - then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty - then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] - then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively, [seeking] acceptance of repentance from అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.94: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of అల్లాహ్, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace "You are not a విశ్వసిస్తారుr," aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with అల్లాహ్ are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then అల్లాహ్ conferred His favor upon you, so investigate. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
4.95: Not equal are those విశ్వసిస్తారుrs remaining [at home] - other than the disabled - and the mujahideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of అల్లాహ్ with their wealth and their lives. అల్లాహ్ has preferred the mujahideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain [behind], by degrees. And to both అల్లాహ్ has promised the best [reward]. But అల్లాహ్ has preferred the mujahideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward -
4.96: Degrees [of high position] from Him and forgiveness and దయ. And అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
4.98: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way -
4.99: For those it is expected that అల్లాహ్ will pardon them, and అల్లాహ్ is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
4.100: And whoever emigrates for the cause of అల్లాహ్ will find on the earth many [alternative] locations and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already become incumbent upon అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
4.101: And when you travel throughout the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the నమాజ్, [especially] if you fear that those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs are ever to you a clear enemy.
4.102: And when you are among them and lead them in నమాజ్, let a group of them stand [in నమాజ్] with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them be [in position] behind you and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed and let them pray with you, taking precaution and carrying their arms. Those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు wish that you would neglect your weapons and your baggage so they could come down upon you in one [single] attack. But there is no blame upon you, if you are troubled by rain or are ill, for putting down your arms, but take precaution. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ has prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs a humiliating శిక్ష.
4.103: And when you have completed the నమాజ్, remember అల్లాహ్ standing, sitting, or [lying] on your sides. But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] నమాజ్. Indeed, నమాజ్ has been decreed upon the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs a decree of specified times.
4.104: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are suffering, but you expect from అల్లాహ్ that which they expect not. And అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.105: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the గ్రంథం in సత్యం so you may judge between the people by that which అల్లాహ్ has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.
4.106: And seek forgiveness of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
4.107: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves not one who is a habitually sinful deceiver.
4.108: They conceal [their evil intentions and deeds] from the people, but they cannot conceal [them] from అల్లాహ్, and He is with them [in His knowledge] when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech. And ever is అల్లాహ్, of what they do, encompassing.
4.109: Here you are - those who argue on their behalf in [this] worldly life - but who will argue with అల్లాహ్ for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will [then] be their representative?
4.110: And whoever does a wrong or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of అల్లాహ్ will find అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.
4.111: And whoever commits a sin only earns it against himself. And అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
4.112: But whoever earns an offense or a sin and then blames it on an innocent [person] has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin.
4.113: And if it was not for the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you, [O Muhammad], and His దయ, a group of them would have determined to mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they will not harm you at all. And అల్లాహ్ has revealed to you the గ్రంథం and wisdom and has taught you that which you did not know. And ever has the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you been great.
4.114: No good is there in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking means to the approval of అల్లాహ్ - then We are going to give him a great reward.
4.116: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with అల్లాహ్ has certainly gone far astray.
4.117: They call upon instead of Him none but female [deities], and they [actually] call upon none but a rebellious Satan.
4.118: Whom అల్లాహ్ has cursed. For he had said, "I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.
4.119: And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of అల్లాహ్." And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of అల్లాహ్ has certainly sustained a clear loss.
4.120: Satan promises them and arouses desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
4.125: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to అల్లాహ్ while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward సత్యం? And అల్లాహ్ took Abraham as an intimate friend.
4.126: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is అల్లాహ్, of all things, encompassing.
4.127: And they request from you, [O Muhammad], a [legal] ruling concerning women. Say, "అల్లాహ్ gives you a ruling about them and [about] what has been recited to you in the గ్రంథం concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice." And whatever you do of good - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing of it.
4.128: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them - and settlement is best. And present in [human] souls is stinginess. But if you do good and fear అల్లాహ్ - then indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
4.129: And you will never be able to be equal [in feeling] between wives, even if you should strive [to do so]. So do not incline completely [toward one] and leave another hanging. And if you amend [your affairs] and fear అల్లాహ్ - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
4.130: But if they separate [by divorce], అల్లాహ్ will enrich each [of them] from His abundance. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Encompassing and Wise.
4.131: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves to fear అల్లాహ్. But if you disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - then to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Free of need and Praiseworthy.
4.132: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Disposer of affairs.
4.133: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And ever is అల్లాహ్ competent to do that.
4.134: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with అల్లాహ్ is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Hearing and Seeing.
4.135: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for అల్లాహ్, even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, అల్లాహ్ is more worthy of both. So follow not [personal] inclination, lest you not be just. And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it], then indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
4.137: Indeed, those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd then disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, then విశ్వసిస్తారుd, then disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, and then increased in disbelief - never will అల్లాహ్ forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.
4.138: Give tidings to the hypocrites that there is for them a painful శిక్ష -
4.139: Those who take disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs as allies instead of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. Do they seek with them honor [through power]? But indeed, honor belongs to అల్లాహ్ entirely.
4.141: Those who wait [and watch] you. Then if you gain a victory from అల్లాహ్, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs have a విజయం, they say [to them], "Did we not gain the advantage over you, but we protected you from the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs?" అల్లాహ్ will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection, and never will అల్లాహ్ give the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs over the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs a way [to overcome them].
4.142: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive అల్లాహ్, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for నమాజ్, they stand lazily, showing [themselves to] the people and not remembering అల్లాహ్ except a little,
4.143: Wavering between them, [belonging] neither to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs nor to the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs. And whoever అల్లాహ్ leaves astray - never will you find for him a way.
4.144: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not take the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs as allies instead of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. Do you wish to give అల్లాహ్ against yourselves a clear case?
4.145: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper -
4.146: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to అల్లాహ్, and are sincere in their religion for అల్లాహ్, for those will be with the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. And అల్లాహ్ is going to give the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs a great reward.
4.147: What would అల్లాహ్ do with your శిక్ష if you are grateful and విశ్వసిస్తారు? And ever is అల్లాహ్ Appreciative and Knowing.
4.148: అల్లాహ్ does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Hearing and Knowing.
4.149: If [instead] you show [some] good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Pardoning and Competent.
4.151: Those are the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs, truly. And We have prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs a humiliating శిక్ష.
4.153: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us అల్లాహ్ outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.
4.154: And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly", and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath", and We took from them a solemn covenant.
4.155: And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of అల్లాహ్ and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our హృదయాలు are wrapped". Rather, అల్లాహ్ has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they విశ్వసిస్తారు not, except for a few.
4.156: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander,
4.157: And [for] their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of అల్లాహ్." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in సందేహం about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain.
4.158: Rather, అల్లాహ్ raised him to Himself. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Exalted in Might and Wise.
4.160: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of అల్లాహ్ many [people],
4.161: And [for] their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs among them a painful శిక్ష.
4.163: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
4.164: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And అల్లాహ్ spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
4.165: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against అల్లాహ్ after the messengers. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Exalted in Might and Wise.
4.166: But అల్లాహ్ bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Witness.
4.167: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు and avert [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్ have certainly gone far astray.
4.168: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will అల్లాహ్ forgive them, nor will He guide them to a మార్గం.
4.170: O Mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the సత్యం from your ప్రభువు, so విశ్వసిస్తారు; it is better for you. But if you disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - then indeed, to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Knowing and Wise.
4.172: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of అల్లాహ్, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
4.174: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your ప్రభువు, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
4.176: They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "అల్లాహ్ gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]." If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child. But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. అల్లాహ్ makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things.

5.1: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fulfill [all] contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - hunting not being permitted while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ ordains what He intends.
5.3: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than అల్లాహ్, and [those animals] killed by strangling or by a violent blow or by a head-long fall or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you [are able to] slaughter [before its death], and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and [prohibited is] that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు have despaired of [defeating] your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
5.4: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what has been made lawful for them. Say, "Lawful for you are [all] good foods and [game caught by] what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as అల్లాహ్ has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of అల్లాహ్ upon it, and fear అల్లాహ్." Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is swift in account.
5.5: This day [all] good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And [lawful in marriage are] chaste women from among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
5.6: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you rise to [perform] నమాజ్, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. అల్లాహ్ does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
5.7: And remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey"; and fear అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of that within the breasts.
5.11: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you when a people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear అల్లాహ్. And upon అల్లాహ్ let the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs rely.
5.13: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their హృదయాలు hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook [their misdeeds]. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves the doers of good.
5.14: And from those who say, "We are Christians" We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We caused among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And అల్లాహ్ is going to inform them about what they used to do.
5.15: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture and overlooking much. There has come to you from అల్లాహ్ a light and a clear గ్రంథం.
5.17: They have certainly disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd who say that అల్లాహ్ is Christ, the son of Mary. Say, "Then who could prevent అల్లాహ్ at all if He had intended to destroy Christ, the son of Mary, or his mother or everyone on the earth?" And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. He creates what He wills, and అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
5.18: But the Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of అల్లాహ్ and His beloved." Say, "Then why does He punish you for your sins?" Rather, you are human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination.
5.19: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger to make clear to you [the religion] after a period [of suspension] of messengers, lest you say, "There came not to us any bringer of good tidings or a warner." But there has come to you a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
5.20: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds.
5.21: O my people, enter the Holy Land which అల్లాహ్ has assigned to you and do not turn back [from fighting in అల్లాహ్ 's cause] and [thus] become losers."
5.22: They said, "O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it; but if they leave it, then we will enter."
5.23: Said two men from those who feared [to disobey] upon whom అల్లాహ్ had bestowed favor, "Enter upon them through the gate, for when you have entered it, you will be predominant. And upon అల్లాహ్ rely, if you should be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
5.24: They said, "O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your ప్రభువు, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here."
5.25: [Moses] said, "My ప్రభువు, indeed I do not possess except myself and my brother, so part us from the defiantly disobedient people."
5.26: [అల్లాహ్] said, "Then indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years [in which] they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people."
5.28: If you should raise your hand against me to kill me - I shall not raise my hand against you to kill you. Indeed, I fear అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
5.29: Indeed I want you to obtain [thereby] my sin and your sin so you will be among the companions of the Fire. And that is the recompense of wrongdoers."
5.30: And his soul permitted to him the murder of his brother, so he killed him and became among the losers.
5.31: Then అల్లాహ్ sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, "O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the body of my brother?" And he became of the regretful.
5.32: Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. And our messengers had certainly come to them with clear proofs. Then indeed many of them, [even] after that, throughout the land, were transgressors.
5.33: Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great శిక్ష,
5.34: Except for those who return [repenting] before you apprehend them. And know that అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
5.35: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear అల్లాహ్ and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed.
5.36: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - if they should have all that is in the earth and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the శిక్ష of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful శిక్ష
5.37: They will wish to get out of the Fire, but never are they to emerge therefrom, and for them is an enduring శిక్ష.
