5.38: [As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands in recompense for what they committed as a deterrent [శిక్ష] from అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
5.39: But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, indeed, అల్లాహ్ will turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
5.40: Do you not know that to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
5.41: O Messenger, let them not grieve you who hasten into disbelief of those who say, "We విశ్వసిస్తారు" with their mouths, but their హృదయాలు విశ్వసిస్తారు not, and from among the Jews. [They are] avid listeners to falsehood, listening to another people who have not come to you. They distort words beyond their [proper] usages, saying "If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware." But he for whom అల్లాహ్ intends fitnah - never will you possess [power to do] for him a thing against అల్లాహ్. Those are the ones for whom అల్లాహ్ does not intend to purify their హృదయాలు. For them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the Hereafter is a great శిక్ష.
5.42: [They are] avid listeners to falsehood, devourers of [what is] unlawful. So if they come to you, [O Muhammad], judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them - never will they harm you at all. And if you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves those who act justly.
5.43: But how is it that they come to you for judgement while they have the Torah, in which is the judgement of అల్లాహ్? Then they turn away, [even] after that; but those are not [in fact] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
5.44: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was మార్గదర్శనం and light. The prophets who submitted [to అల్లాహ్] judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of అల్లాహ్, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed - then it is those who are the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
5.45: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever gives [up his right as] charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
5.47: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
5.48: And We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the గ్రంథం in సత్యం, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the సత్యం. To each of you We prescribed a law and a method. Had అల్లాహ్ willed, He would have made you one nation [united in religion], but [He intended] to test you in what He has given you; so race to [all that is] good. To అల్లాహ్ is your return all together, and He will [then] inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.
5.49: And judge, [O Muhammad], between them by what అల్లాహ్ has revealed and do not follow their inclinations and beware of them, lest they tempt you away from some of what అల్లాహ్ has revealed to you. And if they turn away - then know that అల్లాహ్ only intends to afflict them with some of their [own] sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient.
5.50: Then is it the judgement of [the time of] ignorance they desire? But who is better than అల్లాహ్ in judgement for a people who are certain [in faith].
5.51: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ guides not the wrongdoing people.
5.52: So you see those in whose హృదయాలు is disease hastening into [association with] them, saying, "We are afraid a misfortune may strike us." But perhaps అల్లాహ్ will bring conquest or a decision from Him, and they will become, over what they have been concealing within themselves, regretful.
5.53: And those who విశ్వసిస్తారు will say, "Are these the ones who swore by అల్లాహ్ their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?" Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
5.54: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, whoever of you should revert from his religion - అల్లాహ్ will bring forth [in place of them] a people He will love and who will love Him [who are] humble toward the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, powerful against the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs; they strive in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of అల్లాహ్; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And అల్లాహ్ is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
5.55: Your ally is none but అల్లాహ్ and [therefore] His Messenger and those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd - those who establish నమాజ్ and give zakah, and they bow [in worship].
5.56: And whoever is an ally of అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd - indeed, the party of అల్లాహ్ - they will be the predominant.
5.57: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, take not those who have taken your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you nor the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs as allies. And fear అల్లాహ్, if you should [truly] be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
5.58: And when you call to నమాజ్, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not use reason.
5.59: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except [for the fact] that we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and what was revealed to us and what was revealed before and because most of you are defiantly disobedient?"
5.60: Say, "Shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that as penalty from అల్లాహ్? [It is that of] those whom అల్లాహ్ has cursed and with whom He became angry and made of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are worse in position and further astray from the sound way."
5.61: And when they come to you, they say, "We విశ్వసిస్తారు." But they have entered with disbelief [in their హృదయాలు], and they have certainly left with it. And అల్లాహ్ is most knowing of what they were concealing.
5.62: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and the devouring of [what is] unlawful. How wretched is what they have been doing.
5.63: Why do the rabbis and religious scholars not forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? How wretched is what they have been practicing.
5.64: And the Jews say, "The hand of అల్లాహ్ is chained." Chained are their hands, and cursed are they for what they say. Rather, both His hands are extended; He spends however He wills. And that which has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war [against you], అల్లాహ్ extinguished it. And they strive throughout the land [causing] corruption, and అల్లాహ్ does not like corrupters.
5.65: And if only the People of the Scripture had విశ్వసిస్తారుd and feared అల్లాహ్, We would have removed from them their misdeeds and admitted them to Gardens of Pleasure.
5.66: And if only they upheld [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their ప్రభువు, they would have consumed [provision] from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them are a moderate community, but many of them - evil is that which they do.
5.67: O Messenger, announce that which has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And అల్లాహ్ will protect you from the people. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide the disbelieving people.
5.68: Say, "O People of the Scripture, you are [standing] on nothing until you uphold [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు." And that which has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people.
5.70: We had already taken the covenant of the Children of Israel and had sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party [of messengers] they denied, and another party they killed.
5.71: And they thought there would be no [resulting] శిక్ష, so they became blind and deaf. Then అల్లాహ్ turned to them in forgiveness; then [again] many of them became blind and deaf. And అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of what they do.
5.73: They have certainly disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd who say, "అల్లాహ్ is the third of three." And there is no god except one అల్లాహ్. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs among them a painful శిక్ష.
5.74: So will they not repent to అల్లాహ్ and seek His forgiveness? And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
5.75: The Messiah, son of Mary, was not but a messenger; [other] messengers have passed on before him. And his mother was a supporter of సత్యం. They both used to eat food. Look how We make clear to them the signs; then look how they are deluded.
5.76: Say, "Do you worship besides అల్లాహ్ that which holds for you no [power of] harm or benefit while it is అల్లాహ్ who is the Hearing, the Knowing?"
5.77: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion beyond the సత్యం and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and misled many and have strayed from the soundness of the way."
5.78: Cursed were those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and of Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
5.79: They used not to prevent one another from wrongdoing that they did. How wretched was that which they were doing.
5.80: You see many of them becoming allies of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd. How wretched is that which they have put forth for themselves in that అల్లాహ్ has become angry with them, and in the శిక్ష they will abide eternally.
5.81: And if they had విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and the Prophet and in what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies; but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
5.82: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs [to be] the Jews and those who associate others with అల్లాహ్; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs those who say, "We are Christians." That is because among them are priests and monks and because they are not arrogant.
5.83: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the సత్యం. They say, "Our ప్రభువు, we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, so register us among the witnesses.
5.87: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not prohibit the good things which అల్లాహ్ has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not like transgressors.
5.88: And eat of what అల్లాహ్ has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear అల్లాహ్, in whom you are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
5.89: అల్లాహ్ will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your [own] families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find [or afford it] - then a fast of three days [is required]. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does అల్లాహ్ make clear to you His verses that you may be grateful.
5.90: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than అల్లాహ్], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be విజయంful.
5.91: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of అల్లాహ్ and from నమాజ్. So will you not desist?
5.92: And obey అల్లాహ్ and obey the Messenger and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.
5.94: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, అల్లాహ్ will surely test you through something of the game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that అల్లాహ్ may make evident those who fear Him unseen. And whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful శిక్ష.
5.95: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not kill game while you are in the state of ihram. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two just men among you as an offering [to అల్లాహ్] delivered to the Ka'bah, or an expiation: the feeding of needy people or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his deed. అల్లాహ్ has pardoned what is past; but whoever returns [to violation], then అల్లాహ్ will take retribution from him. And అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
5.96: Lawful to you is game from the sea and its food as provision for you and the travelers, but forbidden to you is game from the land as long as you are in the state of ihram. And fear అల్లాహ్ to whom you will be gathered.
5.97: అల్లాహ్ has made the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, standing for the people and [has sanctified] the sacred months and the sacrificial animals and the garlands [by which they are identified]. That is so you may know that అల్లాహ్ knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth and that అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things.
5.98: Know that అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty and that అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
5.99: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification. And అల్లాహ్ knows whatever you reveal and whatever you conceal.
5.100: Say, "Not equal are the evil and the good, although the abundance of evil might impress you." So fear అల్లాహ్, O you of understanding, that you may be విజయంful.
5.101: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Qur'an is being revealed, they will be shown to you. అల్లాహ్ has pardoned that which is past; and అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Forbearing.
5.102: A people asked such [questions] before you; then they became thereby disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
5.104: And when it is said to them, "Come to what అల్లాహ్ has revealed and to the Messenger," they say, "Sufficient for us is that upon which we found our fathers." Even though their fathers knew nothing, nor were they guided?
5.105: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. To అల్లాహ్ is you return all together; then He will inform you of what you used to do.
5.106: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, testimony [should be taken] among you when death approaches one of you at the time of bequest - [that of] two just men from among you or two others from outside if you are traveling through the land and the disaster of death should strike you. Detain them after the నమాజ్ and let them both swear by అల్లాహ్ if you సందేహం [their testimony, saying], "We will not exchange our oath for a price, even if he should be a near relative, and we will not withhold the testimony of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, we would then be of the sinful."
5.107: But if it is found that those two were guilty of perjury, let two others stand in their place [who are] foremost [in claim] from those who have a lawful right. And let them swear by అల్లాహ్, "Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed. Indeed, we would then be of the wrongdoers."
5.108: That is more likely that they will give testimony according to its [true] objective, or [at least] they would fear that [other] oaths might be taken after their oaths. And fear అల్లాహ్ and listen; and అల్లాహ్ does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
5.109: [Be warned of] the Day when అల్లాహ్ will assemble the messengers and say, "What was the response you received?" They will say, "We have no knowledge. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen"
5.110: [The Day] when అల్లాహ్ will say, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity; and [remember] when I taught you writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you designed from clay [what was] like the form of a bird with My permission, then you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission; and you healed the blind and the leper with My permission; and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the Children of Israel from [killing] you when you came to them with clear proofs and those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among them said, "This is not but obvious magic."
5.112: [And remember] when the disciples said, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, can your ప్రభువు send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven? [Jesus] said," Fear అల్లాహ్, if you should be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
5.113: They said, "We wish to eat from it and let our హృదయాలు be reassured and know that you have been సత్యంful to us and be among its witnesses."
5.114: Said Jesus, the son of Mary, "O అల్లాహ్, our ప్రభువు, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us, and You are the best of providers."
5.115: అల్లాహ్ said, "Indeed, I will sent it down to you, but whoever disవిశ్వసిస్తారుs afterwards from among you - then indeed will I punish him with a శిక్ష by which I have not punished anyone among the worlds."
5.116: And [beware the Day] when అల్లాహ్ will say, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, did you say to the people, 'Take me and my mother as deities besides అల్లాహ్?'" He will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself, and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.
5.117: I said not to them except what You commanded me - to worship అల్లాహ్, my ప్రభువు and your ప్రభువు. And I was a witness over them as long as I was among them; but when You took me up, You were the Observer over them, and You are, over all things, Witness.
5.118: If You should punish them - indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them - indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
5.120: To అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them. And He is over all things competent.

6.1: [All] praise is [due] to అల్లాహ్, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు equate [others] with their ప్రభువు.
6.2: It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term and a specified time [known] to Him; then [still] you are in dispute.
6.3: And He is అల్లాహ్, [the only deity] in the heavens and the earth. He knows your secret and what you make public, and He knows that which you earn.
6.4: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their ప్రభువు except that they turn away therefrom.
6.5: For they had denied the సత్యం when it came to them, but there is going to reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.
6.6: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them which We had established upon the earth as We have not established you? And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers and made rivers flow beneath them; then We destroyed them for their sins and brought forth after them a generation of others.
6.7: And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muhammad], a written scripture on a page and they touched it with their hands, the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs would say, "This is not but obvious magic."
6.8: And they say, "Why was there not sent down to him an angel?" But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided; then they would not be reprieved.
6.9: And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.
6.10: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.
6.11: Say, "Travel through the land; then observe how was the end of the deniers."
6.12: Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?" Say, "To అల్లాహ్." He has decreed upon Himself దయ. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no సందేహం. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.13: And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
6.14: Say, "Is it other than అల్లాహ్ I should take as a protector, Creator of the heavens and the earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to అల్లాహ్] and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.' "
6.15: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my ప్రభువు, the శిక్ష of a tremendous Day."
6.16: He from whom it is averted that Day - [అల్లాహ్] has granted him దయ. And that is the clear attainment.
6.17: And if అల్లాహ్ should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
6.18: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted [with all].
6.19: Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?" Say, "అల్లాహ్ is witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with అల్లాహ్ there are other deities?" Say, "I will not testify [with you]." Say, "Indeed, He is but one అల్లాహ్, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."
6.20: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize it as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.21: And who is more unjust than one who invents about అల్లాహ్ a lie or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
6.22: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated others with అల్లాహ్, "Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim [with Him]?"
6.23: Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination except they will say, "By అల్లాహ్, our ప్రభువు, we were not those who associated."
6.24: See how they will lie about themselves. And lost from them will be what they used to invent.
6.26: And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.
6.27: If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our ప్రభువు and be among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
6.28: But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars.
6.29: And they say, "There is none but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected."
6.30: If you could but see when they will be made to stand before their ప్రభువు. He will say, "Is this not the సత్యం?" They will say, "Yes, by our ప్రభువు." He will [then] say, "So taste the శిక్ష because you used to disవిశ్వసిస్తారు."
6.31: Those will have lost who deny the meeting with అల్లాహ్, until when the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, "Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it," while they bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
6.32: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear అల్లాహ్, so will you not reason?
6.33: We know that you, [O Muhammad], are saddened by what they say. And indeed, they do not call you unసత్యంful, but it is the verses of అల్లాహ్ that the wrongdoers reject.
6.34: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of అల్లాహ్. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.
6.35: And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if అల్లాహ్ had willed, He would have united them upon మార్గదర్శనం. So never be of the ignorant.
6.36: Only those who hear will respond. But the dead - అల్లాహ్ will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
6.37: And they say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his ప్రభువు?" Say, "Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."
6.38: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their ప్రభువు they will be gathered.
6.40: Say, "Have you considered: if there came to you the శిక్ష of అల్లాహ్ or there came to you the Hour - is it other than అల్లాహ్ you would invoke, if you should be సత్యంful?"
6.41: No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke, and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed, and you would forget what you associate [with Him].
6.42: And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
6.43: Then why, when Our శిక్ష came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their హృదయాలు became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.
6.44: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.
6.45: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated. And praise to అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
6.46: Say, "Have you considered: if అల్లాహ్ should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your హృదయాలు, which deity other than అల్లాహ్ could bring them [back] to you?" Look how we diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
6.47: Say, "Have you considered: if the శిక్ష of అల్లాహ్ should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"
6.48: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever విశ్వసిస్తారుs and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
6.49: But those who deny Our verses - the శిక్ష will touch them for their defiant disobedience.
6.50: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of అల్లాహ్ or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me." Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?"
6.52: And do not send away those who call upon their ప్రభువు morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.
6.53: And thus We have tried some of them through others that the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs might say, "Is it these whom అల్లాహ్ has favored among us?" Is not అల్లాహ్ most knowing of those who are grateful?
6.55: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.
6.56: Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides అల్లాహ్." Say, "I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the [rightly] guided."
6.57: Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my ప్రభువు, and you have denied it. I do not have that for which you are impatient. The decision is only for అల్లాహ్. He relates the సత్యం, and He is the best of deciders."
6.58: Say, "If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but అల్లాహ్ is most knowing of the wrongdoers."
6.59: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.
6.60: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.
6.61: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].
6.62: Then they His servants are returned to అల్లాహ్, their true ప్రభువు. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of accountants.
6.63: Say, "Who rescues you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [aloud] and privately, 'If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful.' "
6.64: Say, "It is అల్లాహ్ who saves you from it and from every distress; then you [still] associate others with Him."
6.65: Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another." Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.
6.66: But your people have denied it while it is the సత్యం. Say, "I am not over you a manager."
6.67: For every happening is a finality; and you are going to know.
6.68: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
6.69: And those who fear అల్లాహ్ are not held accountable for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs at all, but [only for] a reminder - that perhaps they will fear Him.
6.70: And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion and whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind with the Qur'an, lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than అల్లాహ్ no protector and no intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful శిక్ష because they used to disవిశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.71: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of అల్లాహ్ that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after అల్లాహ్ has guided us? [We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to మార్గదర్శనం, [calling], 'Come to us.' " Say, "Indeed, the మార్గదర్శనం of అల్లాహ్ is the [only] మార్గదర్శనం; and we have been commanded to submit to the ప్రభువు of the worlds.
6.72: And to establish నమాజ్ and fear Him." And it is He to whom you will be gathered.
6.73: And it is He who created the heavens and earth in సత్యం. And the day He says, "Be," and it is, His word is the సత్యం. And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown. [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
6.74: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."
6.75: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith]
6.76: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that disappear."
6.77: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "Unless my ప్రభువు guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray."
6.78: And when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord; this is greater." But when it set, he said, "O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with అల్లాహ్.
6.79: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward సత్యం, and I am not of those who associate others with అల్లాహ్."
6.80: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me concerning అల్లాహ్ while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my ప్రభువు should will something. My ప్రభువు encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?
6.81: And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with అల్లాహ్ that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?
6.82: They who విశ్వసిస్తారు and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.
6.83: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is Wise and Knowing.
6.84: And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
6.86: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.
6.88: That is the మార్గదర్శనం of అల్లాహ్ by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with అల్లాహ్, then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.
6.89: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture and authority and prophethood. But if the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
6.90: Those are the ones whom అల్లాహ్ has guided, so from their మార్గదర్శనం take an example. Say, "I ask of you for this message no payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds."
6.91: And they did not appraise అల్లాహ్ with true appraisal when they said, "అల్లాహ్ did not reveal to a human being anything." Say, "Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as light and మార్గదర్శనం to the people? You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers." Say, "అల్లాహ్ [revealed it]." Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.
6.93: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about అల్లాహ్ or says, "It has been inspired to me," while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, "I will reveal [something] like what అల్లాహ్ revealed." And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], "Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the శిక్ష of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against అల్లాహ్ other than the సత్యం and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant."
6.94: [It will be said to them], "And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of అల్లాహ్]. It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim."
6.95: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is అల్లాహ్; so how are you deluded?
6.96: [He is] the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
6.97: And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.
6.98: And it is He who produced you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.
6.99: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.100: But they have attributed to అల్లాహ్ partners - the jinn, while He has created them - and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters. Exalted is He and high above what they describe
6.101: [He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He does not have a companion and He created all things? And He is, of all things, Knowing.
6.102: That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.
6.103: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
6.104: There has come to you enlightenment from your ప్రభువు. So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever is blind [does harm] against it. And [say], "I am not a guardian over you."
6.105: And thus do We diversify the verses so the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs will say, "You have studied," and so We may make the Qur'an clear for a people who know.
6.106: Follow, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with అల్లాహ్.
6.107: But if అల్లాహ్ had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a manager over them.
6.108: And do not insult those they invoke other than అల్లాహ్, lest they insult అల్లాహ్ in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their ప్రభువు is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
6.111: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message] and the dead spoke to them [of it] and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them, they would not విశ్వసిస్తారు unless అల్లాహ్ should will. But most of them, [of that], are ignorant.
6.112: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your ప్రభువు had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
6.114: [Say], "Then is it other than అల్లాహ్ I should seek as judge while it is He who has revealed to you the గ్రంథం explained in detail?" And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your ప్రభువు in సత్యం, so never be among the సందేహంers.
6.115: And the word of your ప్రభువు has been fulfilled in సత్యం and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
6.116: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of అల్లాహ్. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
6.117: Indeed, your ప్రభువు is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
6.118: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of అల్లాహ్ has been mentioned, if you are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in His verses.
6.119: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of అల్లాహ్ has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled. And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your ప్రభువు - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
6.120: And leave what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.
6.121: And do not eat of that upon which the name of అల్లాహ్ has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].
6.122: And is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs that which they were doing.
6.123: And thus We have placed within every city the greatest of its criminals to conspire therein. But they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
6.124: And when a sign comes to them, they say, "Never will we విశ్వసిస్తారు until we are given like that which was given to the messengers of అల్లాహ్." అల్లాహ్ is most knowing of where He places His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before అల్లాహ్ and severe శిక్ష for what they used to conspire.
6.125: So whoever అల్లాహ్ wants to guide - He expands his breast to [contain] Islam; and whoever He wants to misguide - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does అల్లాహ్ place defilement upon those who do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.126: And this is the మార్గం of your ప్రభువు, [leading] straight. We have detailed the verses for a people who remember.
6.127: For them will be the Home of Peace with their ప్రభువు. And He will be their protecting friend because of what they used to do.
6.128: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day when He will gather them together [and say], "O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind." And their allies among mankind will say, "Our ప్రభువు, some of us made use of others, and we have [now] reached our term, which you appointed for us." He will say, "The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except for what అల్లాహ్ wills. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is Wise and Knowing."
6.129: And thus will We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others for what they used to earn.
6.130: "O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "We bear witness against ourselves"; and the worldly life had deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
6.131: That is because your ప్రభువు would not destroy the cities for wrongdoing while their people were unaware.
6.132: And for all are degrees from what they have done. And your ప్రభువు is not unaware of what they do.
6.133: And your ప్రభువు is the Free of need, the possessor of దయ. If He wills, he can do away with you and give విజయంion after you to whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
6.134: Indeed, what you are promised is coming, and you will not cause failure [to అల్లాహ్].
6.135: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; [for] indeed, I am working. And you are going to know who will have విజయంion in the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
6.136: And the polytheists assign to అల్లాహ్ from that which He created of crops and livestock a share and say, "This is for అల్లాహ్," by their claim, "and this is for our partners [associated with Him]." But what is for their "partners" does not reach అల్లాహ్, while what is for అల్లాహ్ - this reaches their "partners." Evil is that which they rule.
6.137: And likewise, to many of the polytheists their partners have made [to seem] pleasing the killing of their children in order to bring about their destruction and to cover them with confusion in their religion. And if అల్లాహ్ had willed, they would not have done so. So leave them and that which they invent.
6.138: And they say, "These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat from them except whom we will," by their claim. And there are those [camels] whose backs are forbidden [by them] and those upon which the name of అల్లాహ్ is not mentioned - [all of this] an invention of unసత్యం about Him. He will punish them for what they were inventing.
6.139: And they say, "What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein." He will punish them for their description. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
6.140: Those will have lost who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge and prohibited what అల్లాహ్ had provided for them, inventing unసత్యం about అల్లాహ్. They have gone astray and were not [rightly] guided.
6.141: And He it is who causes gardens to grow, [both] trellised and untrellised, and palm trees and crops of different [kinds of] food and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of [each of] its fruit when it yields and give its due [zakah] on the day of its harvest. And be not excessive. Indeed, He does not like those who commit excess.
6.142: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens] and those [too] small. Eat of what అల్లాహ్ has provided for you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
6.143: [They are] eight mates - of the sheep, two and of the goats, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you should be సత్యంful."
6.144: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when అల్లాహ్ charged you with this? Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about అల్లాహ్ to mislead the people by [something] other than knowledge? Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people."
6.145: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than అల్లాహ్. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your ప్రభువు is Forgiving and Merciful."
6.146: And to those who are Jews We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof; and of the cattle and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are సత్యంful.
6.147: So if they deny you, [O Muhammad], say, "Your ప్రభువు is the possessor of vast దయ; but His శిక్ష cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals."
6.148: Those who associated with అల్లాహ్ will say, "If అల్లాహ్ had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything." Likewise did those before deny until they tasted Our శిక్ష. Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying."
6.149: Say, "With అల్లాహ్ is the far-reaching argument. If He had willed, He would have guided you all."
6.151: Say, "Come, I will recite what your ప్రభువు has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which అల్లాహ్ has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."
6.152: And do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best until he reaches maturity. And give full measure and weight in justice. We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity. And when you testify, be just, even if [it concerns] a near relative. And the covenant of అల్లాహ్ fulfill. This has He instructed you that you may remember.
6.154: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, making complete [Our favor] upon the one who did good and as a detailed explanation of all things and as మార్గదర్శనం and దయ that perhaps in [the matter of] the meeting with their ప్రభువు they would విశ్వసిస్తారు.
6.155: And this [Qur'an] is a గ్రంథం We have revealed [which is] blessed, so follow it and fear అల్లాహ్ that you may receive దయ.
6.156: [We revealed it] lest you say, "The Scripture was only sent down to two groups before us, but we were of their study unaware,"
6.157: Or lest you say, "If only the Scripture had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they." So there has [now] come to you a clear evidence from your ప్రభువు and a మార్గదర్శనం and దయ. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of అల్లాహ్ and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses with the worst of శిక్ష for their having turned away.
6.158: Do they [then] wait for anything except that the angels should come to them or your ప్రభువు should come or that there come some of the signs of your ప్రభువు? The Day that some of the signs of your ప్రభువు will come no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not విశ్వసిస్తారుd before or had earned through its faith some good. Say, "Wait. Indeed, we [also] are waiting."
6.159: Indeed, those who have divided their religion and become sects - you, [O Muhammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to అల్లాహ్; then He will inform them about what they used to do.
6.160: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever comes with an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
6.162: Say, "Indeed, my నమాజ్, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
6.163: No partner has He. And this I have been commanded, and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims."
6.164: Say, "Is it other than అల్లాహ్ I should desire as a lord while He is the ప్రభువు of all things? And every soul earns not [blame] except against itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your ప్రభువు is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."
6.165: And it is He who has made you విజయంors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] that He may try you through what He has given you. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

7.2: [This is] a గ్రంథం revealed to you, [O Muhammad] - so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
7.3: Follow, [O mankind], what has been revealed to you from your ప్రభువు and do not follow other than Him any allies. Little do you remember.
7.4: And how many cities have We destroyed, and Our శిక్ష came to them at night or while they were sleeping at noon.
7.5: And their declaration when Our శిక్ష came to them was only that they said, "Indeed, we were wrongdoers!"
7.6: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers.
7.7: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were not [at all] absent.
7.8: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the సత్యం. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the విజయంful.
7.9: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.
7.10: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.
7.11: And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.
7.12: [అల్లాహ్] said, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" [Satan] said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
7.14: [Satan] said, "Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
7.15: [అల్లాహ్] said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved."
7.17: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."
7.20: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, "Your ప్రభువు did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal."
7.21: And he swore [by అల్లాహ్] to them, "Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."
7.23: They said, "Our ప్రభువు, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have దయ upon us, we will surely be among the losers."
7.24: [అల్లాహ్] said, "Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time."
7.25: He said, "Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth."
7.28: And when they commit an immorality, they say, "We found our fathers doing it, and అల్లాహ్ has ordered us to do it." Say, "Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not order immorality. Do you say about అల్లాహ్ that which you do not know?"
7.29: Say, [O Muhammad], "My ప్రభువు has ordered justice and that you maintain yourselves [in worship of Him] at every place [or time] of prostration, and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion." Just as He originated you, you will return [to life] -
7.30: A group [of you] He guided, and a group deserved [to be in] error. Indeed, they had taken the devils as allies instead of అల్లాహ్ while they thought that they were guided.
7.31: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.
7.32: Say, "Who has forbidden the adornment of అల్లాహ్ which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?" Say, "They are for those who విశ్వసిస్తారు during the worldly life [but] exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection." Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.
7.33: Say, "My ప్రభువు has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed - and sin, and oppression without right, and that you associate with అల్లాహ్ that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about అల్లాహ్ that which you do not know."
7.34: And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their time has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
7.35: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses, then whoever fears అల్లాహ్ and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
7.36: But the ones who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
7.37: And who is more unjust than one who invents about అల్లాహ్ a lie or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion of the decree until when Our messengers come to them to take them in death, they will say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides అల్లాహ్?" They will say, "They have departed from us," and will bear witness against themselves that they were disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
7.38: [అల్లాహ్] will say, "Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire." Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein, the last of them will say about the first of them "Our ప్రభువు, these had misled us, so give them a double శిక్ష of the Fire. He will say, "For each is double, but you do not know."
7.39: And the first of them will say to the last of them, "Then you had not any favor over us, so taste the శిక్ష for what you used to earn."
7.45: Who averted [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్ and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they were, concerning the Hereafter, disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
7.47: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire, they say, "Our ప్రభువు, do not place us with the wrongdoing people."
7.51: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded." So today We will forget them just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for having rejected Our verses.
7.52: And We had certainly brought them a గ్రంథం which We detailed by knowledge - as మార్గదర్శనం and దయ to a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు.
7.53: Do they await except its result? The Day its result comes those who had ignored it before will say, "The messengers of our ప్రభువు had come with the సత్యం, so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be sent back to do other than we used to do?" They will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
7.54: Indeed, your ప్రభువు is అల్లాహ్, who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] chasing it rapidly; and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
7.55: Call upon your ప్రభువు in humility and privately; indeed, He does not like transgressors.
7.56: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. And invoke Him in fear and aspiration. Indeed, the దయ of అల్లాహ్ is near to the doers of good.
7.57: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His దయ until, when they have carried heavy rainclouds, We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits. Thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may be reminded.
7.58: And the good land - its vegetation emerges by permission of its ప్రభువు; but that which is bad - nothing emerges except sparsely, with difficulty. Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.
7.59: We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the శిక్ష of a tremendous Day.
7.60: Said the eminent among his people, "Indeed, we see you in clear error."
7.61: [Noah] said, "O my people, there is not error in me, but I am a messenger from the ప్రభువు of the worlds."
7.62: I convey to you the messages of my ప్రభువు and advise you; and I know from అల్లాహ్ what you do not know.
7.63: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your ప్రభువు through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear అల్లాహ్ so you might receive దయ."
7.64: But they denied him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.
7.65: And to the 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?"
7.66: Said the eminent ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among his people, "Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars."
7.67: [Hud] said, "O my people, there is not foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the ప్రభువు of the worlds."
7.68: I convey to you the messages of my ప్రభువు, and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.
7.69: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your ప్రభువు through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you విజయంors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of అల్లాహ్ that you might succeed.
7.70: They said, "Have you come to us that we should worship అల్లాహ్ alone and leave what our fathers have worshipped? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the సత్యంful."
7.71: [Hud] said, "Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your ప్రభువు. Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which అల్లాహ్ has not sent down any authority? Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
7.72: So We saved him and those with him by దయ from Us. And We eliminated those who denied Our signs, and they were not [at all] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
7.73: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your ప్రభువు. This is the she-camel of అల్లాహ్ [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within అల్లాహ్ 's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful శిక్ష.
7.74: And remember when He made you విజయంors after the 'Aad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of అల్లాహ్ and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."
7.75: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd among them, "Do you [actually] know that Salih is sent from his ప్రభువు?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
7.76: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in that which you have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
7.77: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their ప్రభువు and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."
7.78: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
7.79: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my ప్రభువు and advised you, but you do not like advisors."
7.80: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?
7.81: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."
7.82: But the answer of his people was only that they said, "Evict them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."
7.83: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].
7.84: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.
7.85: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your ప్రభువు. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
7.87: And if there should be a group among you who has విశ్వసిస్తారుd in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not విశ్వసిస్తారుd, then be patient until అల్లాహ్ judges between us. And He is the best of judges."
7.88: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, "We will surely evict you, O Shu'ayb, and those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd with you from our city, or you must return to our religion." He said, "Even if we were unwilling?"
7.89: We would have invented against అల్లాహ్ a lie if we returned to your religion after అల్లాహ్ had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that అల్లాహ్, our ప్రభువు, should will. Our ప్రభువు has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon అల్లాహ్ we have relied. Our ప్రభువు, decide between us and our people in సత్యం, and You are the best of those who give decision."
7.90: Said the eminent ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among his people, "If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers."
7.91: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
7.92: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.
7.93: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my ప్రభువు and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"
7.94: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to అల్లాహ్].
7.95: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.
7.96: And if only the people of the cities had విశ్వసిస్తారుd and feared అల్లాహ్, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."
7.97: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our శిక్ష coming to them at night while they were asleep?
7.98: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our శిక్ష coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
7.99: Then did they feel secure from the plan of అల్లాహ్? But no one feels secure from the plan of అల్లాహ్ except the losing people.
7.100: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their హృదయాలు so they do not hear.
7.102: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.
7.103: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
7.104: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the ప్రభువు of the worlds
7.105: [Who is] obligated not to say about అల్లాహ్ except the సత్యం. I have come to you with clear evidence from your ప్రభువు, so send with me the Children of Israel."
7.106: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the సత్యంful."
7.107: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.
7.108: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.
7.109: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician
7.110: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"
7.111: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
7.112: Who will bring you every learned magician."
7.113: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."
7.114: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."
7.115: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."
7.116: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.
7.117: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.
7.118: So the సత్యం was established, and abolished was what they were doing.
7.119: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.
7.120: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to అల్లాహ్].
7.121: They said, "We have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in the ప్రభువు of the worlds,
7.122: The ప్రభువు of Moses and Aaron."
7.123: Said Pharaoh, "You విశ్వసిస్తారుd in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.
7.124: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."
7.125: They said, "Indeed, to our ప్రభువు we will return.
7.126: And you do not resent us except because we విశ్వసిస్తారుd in the signs of our ప్రభువు when they came to us. Our ప్రభువు, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."
7.127: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."
7.129: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your ప్రభువు will destroy your enemy and grant you విజయంion in the land and see how you will do."
7.130: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.
7.131: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with అల్లాహ్, but most of them do not know.
7.132: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in you."
7.133: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
7.134: And when the శిక్ష descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your ప్రభువు by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the శిక్ష from us, we will surely విశ్వసిస్తారు you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."
7.135: But when We removed the శిక్ష from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
7.136: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
7.137: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your ప్రభువు was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
7.138: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.
7.139: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."
7.140: He said, "Is it other than అల్లాహ్ I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"
7.141: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your ప్రభువు.
7.142: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his ప్రభువు was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
7.143: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his ప్రభువు spoke to him, he said, "My ప్రభువు, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [అల్లాహ్] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his ప్రభువు appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
7.144: [అల్లాహ్] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."
7.145: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."
7.147: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?
7.148: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
7.149: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our ప్రభువు does not have దయ upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."
7.150: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your ప్రభువు?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
7.151: [Moses] said, "My ప్రభువు, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your దయ, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."
7.152: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their ప్రభువు and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
7.153: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and విశ్వసిస్తారుd - indeed your ప్రభువు, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
7.154: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was మార్గదర్శనం and దయ for those who are fearful of their ప్రభువు.
7.155: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My ప్రభువు, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have దయ upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.
7.157: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the విజయంful.
7.159: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by సత్యం and by it establishes justice.
7.160: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
7.161: And [mention, O Muhammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
7.162: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a శిక్ష from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.
7.163: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
7.164: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom అల్లాహ్ is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe శిక్ష?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your ప్రభువు and perhaps they may fear Him."
7.165: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched శిక్ష, because they were defiantly disobeying.
7.166: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."
7.167: And [mention] when your ప్రభువు declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
7.169: And there followed them విజయంors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about అల్లాహ్ except the సత్యం, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear అల్లాహ్, so will you not use reason?
7.170: But those who hold fast to the గ్రంథం and establish నమాజ్ - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
7.171: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and అల్లాహ్ said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear అల్లాహ్."
7.172: And [mention] when your ప్రభువు took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your ప్రభువు?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
7.173: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with అల్లాహ్ before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
7.174: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.
7.175: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.
7.176: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
7.177: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.
