7.178: Whoever అల్లాహ్ guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.
7.180: And to అల్లాహ్ belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
7.181: And among those We created is a community which guides by సత్యం and thereby establishes justice.
7.182: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.
7.183: And I will give them time. Indeed, my plan is firm.
7.184: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.
7.185: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that అల్లాహ్ has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement hereafter will they విశ్వసిస్తారు?
7.186: Whoever అల్లాహ్ sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
7.187: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my ప్రభువు. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with అల్లాహ్, but most of the people do not know."
7.188: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what అల్లాహ్ has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు."
7.189: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke అల్లాహ్, their ప్రభువు, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."
7.190: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is అల్లాహ్ above what they associate with Him.
7.191: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?
7.192: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.
7.193: And if you [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] invite them to మార్గదర్శనం, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.
7.194: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides అల్లాహ్ are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be సత్యంful.
7.195: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.
7.197: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."
7.198: And if you invite them to మార్గదర్శనం, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.
7.199: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
7.201: Indeed, those who fear అల్లాహ్ - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.
7.202: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.
7.203: And when you, [O Muhammad], do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my ప్రభువు. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your ప్రభువు and మార్గదర్శనం and దయ for a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు."
7.204: So when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive దయ.
7.205: And remember your ప్రభువు within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
7.206: Indeed, those who are near your ప్రభువు are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.

8.1: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the bounties [of war]. Say, "The [decision concerning] bounties is for అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger." So fear అల్లాహ్ and amend that which is between you and obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, if you should be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
8.2: The విశ్వసిస్తారుrs are only those who, when అల్లాహ్ is mentioned, their హృదయాలు become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their ప్రభువు they rely -
8.3: The ones who establish నమాజ్, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
8.4: Those are the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, truly. For them are degrees [of high position] with their ప్రభువు and forgiveness and noble provision.
8.5: [It is] just as when your ప్రభువు brought you out of your home [for the battle of Badr] in సత్యం, while indeed, a party among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs were unwilling,
8.6: Arguing with you concerning the సత్యం after it had become clear, as if they were being driven toward death while they were looking on.
8.7: [Remember, O విశ్వసిస్తారుrs], when అల్లాహ్ promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But అల్లాహ్ intended to establish the సత్యం by His words and to eliminate the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs
8.8: That He should establish the సత్యం and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
8.9: [Remember] when you asked help of your ప్రభువు, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
8.10: And అల్లాహ్ made it not but good tidings and so that your హృదయాలు would be assured thereby. And victory is not but from అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
8.11: [Remember] when He overwhelmed you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil [suggestions] of Satan and to make steadfast your హృదయాలు and plant firmly thereby your feet.
8.12: [Remember] when your ప్రభువు inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. I will cast terror into the హృదయాలు of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
8.13: That is because they opposed అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. And whoever opposes అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty.
8.14: "That [is yours], so taste it." And indeed for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is the శిక్ష of the Fire.
8.15: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you meet those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
8.17: And you did not kill them, but it was అల్లాహ్ who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was అల్లాహ్ who threw that He might test the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs with a good test. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
8.18: That [is so], and [also] that అల్లాహ్ will weaken the plot of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
8.19: If you [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] seek the victory - the defeat has come to you. And if you desist [from hostilities], it is best for you; but if you return [to war], We will return, and never will you be availed by your [large] company at all, even if it should increase; and [that is] because అల్లాహ్ is with the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
8.20: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and do not turn from him while you hear [his order].
8.21: And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
8.22: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of అల్లాహ్ are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
8.23: Had అల్లాహ్ known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
8.24: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, respond to అల్లాహ్ and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that అల్లాహ్ intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
8.25: And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty.
8.26: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you, but He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things - that you might be grateful.
8.27: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not betray అల్లాహ్ and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
8.28: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial and that అల్లాహ్ has with Him a great reward.
8.29: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, if you fear అల్లాహ్, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.
8.30: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and అల్లాహ్ plans. And అల్లాహ్ is the best of planners.
8.31: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
8.32: And [remember] when they said, "O అల్లాహ్, if this should be the సత్యం from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful శిక్ష."
8.33: But అల్లాహ్ would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them, and అల్లాహ్ would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
8.35: And their నమాజ్ at the House was not except whistling and handclapping. So taste the శిక్ష for what you disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd.
8.38: Say to those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
8.39: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for అల్లాహ్. And if they cease - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of what they do.
8.40: But if they turn away - then know that అల్లాహ్ is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and Excellent is the helper.
8.41: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for అల్లాహ్ is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and in that which We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And అల్లాహ్, over all things, is competent.
8.42: [Remember] when you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was lower [in position] than you. If you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that అల్లాహ్ might accomplish a matter already destined - that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence; and indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
8.43: [Remember, O Muhammad], when అల్లాహ్ showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] would have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter [of whether to fight], but అల్లాహ్ saved [you from that]. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
8.44: And [remember] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you [appear] as few in their eyes so that అల్లాహ్ might accomplish a matter already destined. And to అల్లాహ్ are [all] matters returned.
8.45: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you encounter a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember అల్లాహ్ much that you may be విజయంful.
8.46: And obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage and [then] your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is with the patient.
8.47: And do not be like those who came forth from their homes insolently and to be seen by people and avert [them] from the way of అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is encompassing of what they do.
8.48: And [remember] when Satan made their deeds pleasing to them and said, "No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector." But when the two armies sighted each other, he turned on his heels and said, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed I fear అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty."
8.49: [Remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose హృదయాలు was disease said, "Their religion has deluded those [Muslims]." But whoever relies upon అల్లాహ్ - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
8.50: And if you could but see when the angels take the souls of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd... They are striking their faces and their backs and [saying], "Taste the శిక్ష of the Burning Fire.
8.51: That is for what your hands have put forth [of evil] and because అల్లాహ్ is not ever unjust to His servants."
8.52: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in the signs of అల్లాహ్, so అల్లాహ్ seized them for their sins. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Powerful and severe in penalty.
8.53: That is because అల్లాహ్ would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
8.54: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They denied the signs of their ప్రభువు, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all [of them] were wrongdoers.
8.55: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of అల్లాహ్ are those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, and they will not [ever] విశ్వసిస్తారు -
8.56: The ones with whom you made a treaty but then they break their pledge every time, and they do not fear అల్లాహ్.
8.57: So if you, [O Muhammad], gain dominance over them in war, disperse by [means of] them those behind them that perhaps they will be reminded.
8.58: If you [have reason to] fear from a people betrayal, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not like traitors.
8.59: And let not those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to అల్లాహ్].
8.60: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of అల్లాహ్ and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom అల్లాహ్ knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of అల్లాహ్ will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
8.61: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it [also] and rely upon అల్లాహ్. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.
8.62: But if they intend to deceive you - then sufficient for you is అల్లాహ్. It is He who supported you with His help and with the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs
8.63: And brought together their హృదయాలు. If you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have brought their హృదయాలు together; but అల్లాహ్ brought them together. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
8.64: O Prophet, sufficient for you is అల్లాహ్ and for whoever follows you of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
8.65: O Prophet, urge the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs to battle. If there are among you twenty [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd because they are a people who do not understand.
8.66: Now, అల్లాహ్ has lightened [the hardship] for you, and He knows that among you is weakness. So if there are from you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is with the steadfast.
8.67: It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [upon అల్లాహ్ 's enemies] in the land. Some Muslims desire the commodities of this world, but అల్లాహ్ desires [for you] the Hereafter. And అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
8.68: If not for a decree from అల్లాహ్ that preceded, you would have been touched for what you took by a great శిక్ష.
8.69: So consume what you have taken of war booty [as being] lawful and good, and fear అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
8.70: O Prophet, say to whoever is in your hands of the captives, "If అల్లాహ్ knows [any] good in your హృదయాలు, He will give you [something] better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful."
8.71: But if they intend to betray you - then they have already betrayed అల్లాహ్ before, and He empowered [you] over them. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
8.72: Indeed, those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd and emigrated and fought with their wealth and lives in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and those who gave shelter and aided - they are allies of one another. But those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd and did not emigrate - for you there is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. And if they seek help of you for the religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of what you do.
8.73: And those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd are allies of one another. If you do not do so, there will be fitnah on earth and great corruption.
8.74: But those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd and emigrated and fought in the cause of అల్లాహ్ and those who gave shelter and aided - it is they who are the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, truly. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
8.75: And those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd after [the initial emigration] and emigrated and fought with you - they are of you. But those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things.

9.1: [This is a declaration of] disassociation, from అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, to those with whom you had made a treaty among the polytheists.
9.2: So travel freely, [O disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs], throughout the land [during] four months but know that you cannot cause failure to అల్లాహ్ and that అల్లాహ్ will disgrace the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.3: And [it is] an announcement from అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger to the people on the day of the greater pilgrimage that అల్లాహ్ is disassociated from the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs, and [so is] His Messenger. So if you repent, that is best for you; but if you turn away - then know that you will not cause failure to అల్లాహ్. And give tidings to those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు of a painful శిక్ష.
9.5: And when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish నమాజ్, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
9.6: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of అల్లాహ్. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
9.8: How [can there be a treaty] while, if they gain dominance over you, they do not observe concerning you any pact of kinship or covenant of protection? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their హృదయాలు refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
9.9: They have exchanged the signs of అల్లాహ్ for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
9.10: They do not observe toward a విశ్వసిస్తారుr any pact of kinship or covenant of protection. And it is they who are the transgressors.
9.11: But if they repent, establish నమాజ్, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.
9.12: And if they break their oaths after their treaty and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, there are no oaths [sacred] to them; [fight them that] they might cease.
9.13: Would you not fight a people who broke their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But అల్లాహ్ has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.14: Fight them; అల్లాహ్ will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people
9.15: And remove the fury in the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs' హృదయాలు. And అల్లాహ్ turns in forgiveness to whom He wills; and అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.16: Do you think that you will be left [as you are] while అల్లాహ్ has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for His cause] and do not take other than అల్లాహ్, His Messenger and the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs as intimates? And అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.
9.17: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of అల్లాహ్ [while] witnessing against themselves with disbelief. [For] those, their deeds have become worthless, and in the Fire they will abide eternally.
9.19: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrim and the maintenance of al-Masjid al-Haram equal to [the deeds of] one who విశ్వసిస్తారుs in అల్లాహ్ and the Last Day and strives in the cause of అల్లాహ్? They are not equal in the sight of అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people.
9.20: The ones who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, emigrated and striven in the cause of అల్లాహ్ with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of అల్లాహ్. And it is those who are the attainers [of విజయం].
9.21: Their ప్రభువు gives them good tidings of దయ from Him and approval and of gardens for them wherein is enduring pleasure.
9.22: [They will be] abiding therein forever. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ has with Him a great reward.
9.23: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever does so among you - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
9.24: Say, [O Muhammad], "If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until అల్లాహ్ executes His command. And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the defiantly disobedient people."
9.25: అల్లాహ్ has already given you victory in many regions and [even] on the day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you at all, and the earth was confining for you with its vastness; then you turned back, fleeing.
9.26: Then అల్లాహ్ sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and sent down soldiers angels whom you did not see and punished those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd. And that is the recompense of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.27: Then అల్లాహ్ will accept repentance after that for whom He wills; and అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
9.28: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this, their [final] year. And if you fear privation, అల్లాహ్ will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.30: The Jews say, "Ezra is the son of అల్లాహ్ "; and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of అల్లాహ్." That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd [before them]. May అల్లాహ్ destroy them; how are they deluded?
9.31: They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides అల్లాహ్, and [also] the Messiah, the son of Mary. And they were not commanded except to worship one అల్లాహ్; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
9.32: They want to extinguish the light of అల్లాహ్ with their mouths, but అల్లాహ్ refuses except to perfect His light, although the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs dislike it.
9.33: It is He who has sent His Messenger with మార్గదర్శనం and the religion of సత్యం to manifest it over all religion, although they who associate others with అల్లాహ్ dislike it.
9.34: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, indeed many of the scholars and the monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of అల్లాహ్. And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the way of అల్లాహ్ - give them tidings of a painful శిక్ష.
9.37: Indeed, the postponing [of restriction within sacred months] is an increase in disbelief by which those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd are led [further] astray. They make it lawful one year and unlawful another year to correspond to the number made unlawful by అల్లాహ్ and [thus] make lawful what అల్లాహ్ has made unlawful. Made pleasing to them is the evil of their deeds; and అల్లాహ్ does not guide the disbelieving people.
9.38: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, what is [the matter] with you that, when you are told to go forth in the cause of అల్లాహ్, you adhere heavily to the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But what is the enjoyment of worldly life compared to the Hereafter except a [very] little.
9.39: If you do not go forth, He will punish you with a painful శిక్ష and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. And అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
9.40: If you do not aid the Prophet - అల్లాహ్ has already aided him when those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, "Do not grieve; indeed అల్లాహ్ is with us." And అల్లాహ్ sent down his tranquillity upon him and supported him with angels you did not see and made the word of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd the lowest, while the word of అల్లాహ్ - that is the highest. And అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
9.41: Go forth, whether light or heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of అల్లాహ్. That is better for you, if you only knew.
9.42: Had it been an easy gain and a moderate trip, the hypocrites would have followed you, but distant to them was the journey. And they will swear by అల్లాహ్, "If we were able, we would have gone forth with you," destroying themselves [through false oaths], and అల్లాహ్ knows that indeed they are liars.
9.43: May అల్లాహ్ pardon you, [O Muhammad]; why did you give them permission [to remain behind]? [You should not have] until it was evident to you who were సత్యంful and you knew [who were] the liars.
9.46: And if they had intended to go forth, they would have prepared for it [some] preparation. But అల్లాహ్ disliked their being sent, so He kept them back, and they were told, "Remain [behind] with those who remain."
9.47: Had they gone forth with you, they would not have increased you except in confusion, and they would have been active among you, seeking [to cause] you fitnah. And among you are avid listeners to them. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
9.48: They had already desired dissension before and had upset matters for you until the సత్యం came and the ordinance of అల్లాహ్ appeared, while they were averse.
9.50: If good befalls you, it distresses them; but if disaster strikes you, they say, "We took our matter [in hand] before," and turn away while they are rejoicing.
9.51: Say, "Never will we be struck except by what అల్లాహ్ has decreed for us; He is our protector." And upon అల్లాహ్ let the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs rely.
9.52: Say, "Do you await for us except one of the two best things while we await for you that అల్లాహ్ will afflict you with శిక్ష from Himself or at our hands? So wait; indeed we, along with you, are waiting."
9.53: Say, "Spend willingly or unwillingly; never will it be accepted from you. Indeed, you have been a defiantly disobedient people."
9.54: And what prevents their expenditures from being accepted from them but that they have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and in His Messenger and that they come not to నమాజ్ except while they are lazy and that they do not spend except while they are unwilling.
9.55: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. అల్లాహ్ only intends to punish them through them in worldly life and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.56: And they swear by అల్లాహ్ that they are from among you while they are not from among you; but they are a people who are afraid.
9.57: If they could find a refuge or some caves or any place to enter [and hide], they would turn to it while they run heedlessly.
9.58: And among them are some who criticize you concerning the [distribution of] charities. If they are given from them, they approve; but if they are not given from them, at once they become angry.
9.59: If only they had been satisfied with what అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger gave them and said, "Sufficient for us is అల్లాహ్; అల్లాహ్ will give us of His bounty, and [so will] His Messenger; indeed, we are desirous toward అల్లాహ్," [it would have been better for them].
9.60: Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah] and for bringing హృదయాలు together [for Islam] and for freeing captives [or slaves] and for those in debt and for the cause of అల్లాహ్ and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation [imposed] by అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.61: And among them are those who abuse the Prophet and say, "He is an ear." Say, "[It is] an ear of goodness for you that విశ్వసిస్తారుs in అల్లాహ్ and విశ్వసిస్తారుs the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and [is] a దయ to those who విశ్వసిస్తారు among you." And those who abuse the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ - for them is a painful శిక్ష.
9.62: They swear by అల్లాహ్ to you [Muslims] to satisfy you. But అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger are more worthy for them to satisfy, if they should be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.64: They hypocrites are apprehensive lest a surah be revealed about them, informing them of what is in their హృదయాలు. Say, "Mock [as you wish]; indeed, అల్లాహ్ will expose that which you fear."
9.65: And if you ask them, they will surely say, "We were only conversing and playing." Say, "Is it అల్లాహ్ and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?"
9.66: Make no excuse; you have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals.
9.67: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and close their hands. They have forgotten అల్లాహ్, so He has forgotten them [accordingly]. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient.
9.69: [You disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs are] like those before you; they were stronger than you in power and more abundant in wealth and children. They enjoyed their portion [of worldly enjoyment], and you have enjoyed your portion as those before you enjoyed their portion, and you have engaged [in vanities] like that in which they engaged. [It is] those whose deeds have become worthless in this world and in the Hereafter, and it is they who are the losers.
9.70: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And అల్లాహ్ would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
9.71: The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and establish నమాజ్ and give zakah and obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. Those - అల్లాహ్ will have దయ upon them. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
9.74: They swear by అల్లాహ్ that they did not say [anything against the Prophet] while they had said the word of disbelief and disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd after their [pretense of] Islam and planned that which they were not to attain. And they were not resentful except [for the fact] that అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger had enriched them of His bounty. So if they repent, it is better for them; but if they turn away, అల్లాహ్ will punish them with a painful శిక్ష in this world and the Hereafter. And there will not be for them on earth any protector or helper.
9.76: But when he gave them from His bounty, they were stingy with it and turned away while they refused.
9.77: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their హృదయాలు until the Day they will meet Him - because they failed అల్లాహ్ in what they promised Him and because they [habitually] used to lie.
9.78: Did they not know that అల్లాహ్ knows their secrets and their private conversations and that అల్లాహ్ is the Knower of the unseen?
9.79: Those who criticize the contributors among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs concerning [their] charities and [criticize] the ones who find nothing [to spend] except their effort, so they ridicule them - అల్లాహ్ will ridicule them, and they will have a painful శిక్ష.
9.80: Ask forgiveness for them, [O Muhammad], or do not ask forgiveness for them. If you should ask forgiveness for them seventy times - never will అల్లాహ్ forgive them. That is because they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, and అల్లాహ్ does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
9.82: So let them laugh a little and [then] weep much as recompense for what they used to earn.
9.83: If అల్లాహ్ should return you to a faction of them [after the expedition] and then they ask your permission to go out [to battle], say, "You will not go out with me, ever, and you will never fight with me an enemy. Indeed, you were satisfied with sitting [at home] the first time, so sit [now] with those who stay behind."
9.84: And do not pray [the funeral నమాజ్, O Muhammad], over any of them who has died - ever - or stand at his grave. Indeed, they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobedient.
9.85: And let not their wealth and their children impress you. అల్లాహ్ only intends to punish them through them in this world and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.87: They were satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and their హృదయాలు were sealed over, so they do not understand.
9.88: But the Messenger and those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him fought with their wealth and their lives. Those will have [all that is] good, and it is those who are the విజయంful.
9.89: అల్లాహ్ has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the great attainment.
9.90: And those with excuses among the bedouins came to be permitted [to remain], and they who had lied to అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger sat [at home]. There will strike those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among them a painful శిక్ష.
9.91: There is not upon the weak or upon the ill or upon those who do not find anything to spend any discomfort when they are sincere to అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. There is not upon the doers of good any cause [for blame]. And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
9.92: Nor [is there blame] upon those who, when they came to you that you might give them mounts, you said, "I can find nothing for you to ride upon." They turned back while their eyes overflowed with tears out of grief that they could not find something to spend [for the cause of అల్లాహ్].
9.93: The cause [for blame] is only upon those who ask permission of you while they are rich. They are satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and అల్లాహ్ has sealed over their హృదయాలు, so they do not know.
9.94: They will make excuses to you when you have returned to them. Say, "Make no excuse - never will we విశ్వసిస్తారు you. అల్లాహ్ has already informed us of your news. And అల్లాహ్ will observe your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger; then you will be taken back to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
9.96: They swear to you so that you might be satisfied with them. But if you should be satisfied with them - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is not satisfied with a defiantly disobedient people.
9.97: The bedouins are stronger in disbelief and hypocrisy and more likely not to know the limits of what [laws] అల్లాహ్ has revealed to His Messenger. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.98: And among the bedouins are some who consider what they spend as a loss and await for you turns of misfortune. Upon them will be a misfortune of evil. And అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
9.100: And the first forerunners [in the faith] among the Muhajireen and the Ansar and those who followed them with good conduct - అల్లాహ్ is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
9.101: And among those around you of the bedouins are hypocrites, and [also] from the people of Madinah. They have become accustomed to hypocrisy. You, [O Muhammad], do not know them, [but] We know them. We will punish them twice [in this world]; then they will be returned to a great శిక్ష.
9.103: Take, [O, Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase, and invoke [అల్లాహ్ 's blessings] upon them. Indeed, your invocations are reassurance for them. And అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
9.104: Do they not know that it is అల్లాహ్ who accepts repentance from His servants and receives charities and that it is అల్లాహ్ who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful?
9.105: And say, "Do [as you will], for అల్లాహ్ will see your deeds, and [so, will] His Messenger and the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
9.106: And [there are] others deferred until the command of అల్లాహ్ - whether He will punish them or whether He will forgive them. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.107: And [there are] those [hypocrites] who took for themselves a mosque for causing harm and disbelief and division among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and as a station for whoever had warred against అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger before. And they will surely swear, "We intended only the best." And అల్లాహ్ testifies that indeed they are liars.
9.110: Their building which they built will not cease to be a [cause of] skepticism in their హృదయాలు until their హృదయాలు are stopped. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
9.112: [Such విశ్వసిస్తారుrs are] the repentant, the worshippers, the praisers [of అల్లాహ్], the travelers [for His cause], those who bow and prostrate [in నమాజ్], those who enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and those who observe the limits [set by] అల్లాహ్. And give good tidings to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.114: And the request of forgiveness of Abraham for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became apparent to Abraham that his father was an enemy to అల్లాహ్, he disassociated himself from him. Indeed was Abraham compassionate and patient.
9.115: And అల్లాహ్ would not let a people stray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things.
9.116: Indeed, to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He gives life and causes death. And you have not besides అల్లాహ్ any protector or any helper.
9.117: అల్లాహ్ has already forgiven the Prophet and the Muhajireen and the Ansar who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the హృదయాలు of a party of them had almost inclined [to సందేహం], and then He forgave them. Indeed, He was to them Kind and Merciful.
9.118: And [He also forgave] the three who were left behind [and regretted their error] to the point that the earth closed in on them in spite of its vastness and their souls confined them and they were certain that there is no refuge from అల్లాహ్ except in Him. Then He turned to them so they could repent. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
9.119: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear అల్లాహ్ and be with those who are true.
9.121: Nor do they spend an expenditure, small or large, or cross a valley but that it is registered for them that అల్లాహ్ may reward them for the best of what they were doing.
9.122: And it is not for the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs to go forth [to battle] all at once. For there should separate from every division of them a group [remaining] to obtain understanding in the religion and warn their people when they return to them that they might be cautious.
9.124: And whenever a surah is revealed, there are among the hypocrites those who say, "Which of you has this increased faith?" As for those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd, it has increased them in faith, while they are rejoicing.
9.125: But as for those in whose హృదయాలు is disease, it has [only] increased them in evil [in addition] to their evil. And they will have died while they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
9.126: Do they not see that they are tried every year once or twice but then they do not repent nor do they remember?
9.127: And whenever a surah is revealed, they look at each other, [saying], "Does anyone see you?" and then they dismiss themselves. అల్లాహ్ has dismissed their హృదయాలు because they are a people who do not understand.
9.128: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs is kind and merciful.
9.129: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad], say, "Sufficient for me is అల్లాహ్; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the ప్రభువు of the Great Throne."

10.1: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the wise గ్రంథం
10.2: Have the people been amazed that We revealed [revelation] to a man from among them, [saying], "Warn mankind and give good tidings to those who విశ్వసిస్తారు that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their ప్రభువు"? [But] the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs say, "Indeed, this is an obvious magician."
10.3: Indeed, your ప్రభువు is అల్లాహ్, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne, arranging the matter [of His creation]. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?
10.5: It is He who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light and determined for it phases - that you may know the number of years and account [of time]. అల్లాహ్ has not created this except in సత్యం. He details the signs for a people who know
10.6: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day and [in] what అల్లాహ్ has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear అల్లాహ్
10.7: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure therein and those who are heedless of Our signs
10.8: For those their refuge will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
10.10: Their call therein will be, "Exalted are You, O అల్లాహ్," and their greeting therein will be, "Peace." And the last of their call will be, "Praise to అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds!"
10.11: And if అల్లాహ్ was to hasten for the people the evil [they invoke] as He hastens for them the good, their term would have been ended for them. But We leave the ones who do not expect the meeting with Us, in their transgression, wandering blindly
10.12: And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing; but when We remove from him his affliction, he continues [in disobedience] as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing
10.13: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to విశ్వసిస్తారు. Thus do We recompense the criminal people
10.14: Then We made you విజయంors in the land after them so that We may observe how you will do.
10.15: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my ప్రభువు, the శిక్ష of a tremendous Day."
10.16: Say, "If అల్లాహ్ had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you, for I had remained among you a lifetime before it. Then will you not reason?"
10.17: So who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about అల్లాహ్ or denies His signs? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed
10.18: And they worship other than అల్లాహ్ that which neither harms them nor benefits them, and they say, "These are our intercessors with అల్లాహ్ " Say, "Do you inform అల్లాహ్ of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him
10.19: And mankind was not but one community [united in religion], but [then] they differed. And if not for a word that preceded from your ప్రభువు, it would have been judged between them [immediately] concerning that over which they differ.
10.20: And they say, "Why is a sign not sent down to him from his ప్రభువు?" So say, "The unseen is only for అల్లాహ్ [to administer], so wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
10.21: And when We give the people a taste of దయ after adversity has touched them, at once they conspire against Our verses. Say, "అల్లాహ్ is swifter in strategy." Indeed, Our messengers record that which you conspire
10.22: It is He who enables you to travel on land and sea until, when you are in ships and they sail with them by a good wind and they rejoice therein, there comes a storm wind and the waves come upon them from everywhere and they assume that they are surrounded, supplicating అల్లాహ్, sincere to Him in religion, "If You should save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful."
10.23: But when He saves them, at once they commit injustice upon the earth without right. O mankind, your injustice is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.
10.24: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - [those] from which men and livestock eat - until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought.
10.27: But they who have earned [blame for] evil doings - the recompense of an evil deed is its equivalent, and humiliation will cover them. They will have from అల్లాహ్ no protector. It will be as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night - so dark [are they]. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
10.28: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together - then We will say to those who associated others with అల్లాహ్, "[Remain in] your place, you and your 'partners.' " Then We will separate them, and their "partners" will say, "You did not used to worship us,
10.29: And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as a witness between us and you that we were of your worship unaware."
10.30: There, [on that Day], every soul will be put to trial for what it did previously, and they will be returned to అల్లాహ్, their master, the Truth, and lost from them is whatever they used to invent.
10.31: Say, "Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who controls hearing and sight and who brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and who arranges [every] matter?" They will say, "అల్లాహ్," so say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
10.32: For that is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు, the Truth. And what can be beyond సత్యం except error? So how are you averted?
10.33: Thus the word of your ప్రభువు has come into effect upon those who defiantly disobeyed - that they will not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
10.34: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who begins creation and then repeats it?" Say, "అల్లాహ్ begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?"
10.35: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who guides to the సత్యం?" Say, "అల్లాహ్ guides to the సత్యం. So is He who guides to the సత్యం more worthy to be followed or he who guides not unless he is guided? Then what is [wrong] with you - how do you judge?"
10.36: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the సత్యం at all. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of what they do.
10.37: And it was not [possible] for this Qur'an to be produced by other than అల్లాహ్, but [it is] a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of the [former] Scripture, about which there is no సందేహం, from the ప్రభువు of the worlds.
10.38: Or do they say [about the Prophet], "He invented it?" Say, "Then bring forth a surah like it and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides అల్లాహ్, if you should be సత్యంful."
10.39: Rather, they have denied that which they encompass not in knowledge and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. Then observe how was the end of the wrongdoers.
10.41: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], then say, "For me are my deeds, and for you are your deeds. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do."
10.42: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you cause the deaf to hear, although they will not use reason?
10.43: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?
10.44: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who are wronging themselves.
10.45: And on the Day when He will gather them, [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and] they will know each other. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with అల్లాహ్ and were not guided
10.46: And whether We show you some of what We promise them, [O Muhammad], or We take you in death, to Us is their return; then, [either way], అల్లాహ్ is a witness concerning what they are doing
10.47: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged
10.48: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be సత్యంful?"
10.49: Say, "I possess not for myself any harm or benefit except what అల్లాహ్ should will. For every nation is a [specified] term. When their time has come, then they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it]."
10.50: Say, "Have you considered: if His శిక్ష should come to you by night or by day - for which [aspect] of it would the criminals be impatient?"
10.52: Then it will be said to those who had wronged, "Taste the శిక్ష of eternity; are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?"
10.53: And they ask information of you, [O Muhammad], "Is it true?" Say, "Yes, by my ప్రభువు. Indeed, it is సత్యం; and you will not cause failure [to అల్లాహ్]."
10.54: And if each soul that wronged had everything on earth, it would offer it in ransom. And they will confide regret when they see the శిక్ష; and they will be judged in justice, and they will not be wronged
10.55: Unquestionably, to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Unquestionably, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం, but most of them do not know
10.56: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned
10.57: O mankind, there has to come to you instruction from your ప్రభువు and healing for what is in the breasts and మార్గదర్శనం and దయ for the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
10.58: Say, "In the bounty of అల్లాహ్ and in His దయ - in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate."
10.59: Say, "Have you seen what అల్లాహ్ has sent down to you of provision of which you have made [some] lawful and [some] unlawful?" Say, "Has అల్లాహ్ permitted you [to do so], or do you invent [something] about అల్లాహ్?"
10.60: And what will be the supposition of those who invent falsehood about అల్లాహ్ on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is full of bounty to the people, but most of them are not grateful."
10.61: And, [O Muhammad], you are not [engaged] in any matter or recite any of the Qur'an and you [people] do not do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And not absent from your ప్రభువు is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.
10.62: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of అల్లాహ్ there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve
10.63: Those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd and were fearing అల్లాహ్
10.64: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words of అల్లాహ్. That is what is the great attainment.
10.65: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to అల్లాహ్ entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
10.66: Unquestionably, to అల్లాహ్ belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And those who invoke other than అల్లాహ్ do not [actually] follow [His] "partners." They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying
10.67: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein and the day, giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
10.68: They have said, "అల్లాహ్ has taken a son." Exalted is He; He is the [one] Free of need. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this [claim]. Do you say about అల్లాహ్ that which you do not know?
10.69: Say, "Indeed, those who invent falsehood about అల్లాహ్ will not succeed."
10.70: [For them is brief] enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return; then We will make them taste the severe శిక్ష because they used to disవిశ్వసిస్తారు
10.71: And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of అల్లాహ్ has become burdensome upon you - then I have relied upon అల్లాహ్. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.
10.72: And if you turn away [from my advice] then no payment have I asked of you. My reward is only from అల్లాహ్, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims."
10.73: And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them విజయంors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.
10.75: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people
10.76: So when there came to them the సత్యం from Us, they said, "Indeed, this is obvious magic."
10.77: Moses said, "Do you say [thus] about the సత్యం when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed."
10.78: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in you."
10.79: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."
10.80: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."
10.81: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not amend the work of corrupters.
10.82: And అల్లాహ్ will establish the సత్యం by His words, even if the criminals dislike it."
10.83: But no one విశ్వసిస్తారుd Moses, except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors
10.84: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims."
10.85: So they said, "Upon అల్లాహ్ do we rely. Our ప్రభువు, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people
10.86: And save us by Your దయ from the disbelieving people."
10.87: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah and establish నమాజ్ and give good tidings to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
10.88: And Moses said, "Our ప్రభువు, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our ప్రభువు, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our ప్రభువు, obliterate their wealth and harden their హృదయాలు so that they will not విశ్వసిస్తారు until they see the painful శిక్ష."
10.89: [అల్లాహ్] said, "Your supplication has been answered." So remain on a right course and follow not the way of those who do not know."
10.90: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I విశ్వసిస్తారు that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel విశ్వసిస్తారు, and I am of the Muslims."
10.91: Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?
10.92: So today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless
10.93: And We had certainty settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your ప్రభువు will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ
10.94: So if you are in సందేహం, [O Muhammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The సత్యం has certainly come to you from your ప్రభువు, so never be among the సందేహంers.
10.95: And never be of those who deny the signs of అల్లాహ్ and [thus] be among the losers.
10.96: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your ప్రభువు has come into effect will not విశ్వసిస్తారు,
10.97: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful శిక్ష.
10.98: Then has there not been a [single] city that విశ్వసిస్తారుd so its faith benefited it except the people of Jonah? When they విశ్వసిస్తారుd, We removed from them the శిక్ష of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment for a time.
10.99: And had your ప్రభువు willed, those on earth would have విశ్వసిస్తారుd - all of them entirely. Then, [O Muhammad], would you compel the people in order that they become విశ్వసిస్తారుrs?
10.100: And it is not for a soul to విశ్వసిస్తారు except by permission of అల్లాహ్, and He will place defilement upon those who will not use reason.
10.101: Say, "Observe what is in the heavens and earth." But of no avail will be signs or warners to a people who do not విశ్వసిస్తారు
10.102: So do they wait except for like [what occurred in] the days of those who passed on before them? Say, "Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
10.103: Then We will save our messengers and those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us that We save the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs
10.104: Say, [O Muhammad], "O people, if you are in సందేహం as to my religion - then I do not worship those which you worship besides అల్లాహ్; but I worship అల్లాహ్, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs
10.105: And [commanded], 'Direct your face toward the religion, inclining to సత్యం, and never be of those who associate others with అల్లాహ్;
10.106: And do not invoke besides అల్లాహ్ that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.'"
10.107: And if అల్లాహ్ should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful
10.108: Say, "O mankind, the సత్యం has come to you from your ప్రభువు, so whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager."
10.109: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and be patient until అల్లాహ్ will judge. And He is the best of judges.

11.1: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a గ్రంథం whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted.
11.2: [Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,"
11.3: And [saying], "Seek forgiveness of your ప్రభువు and repent to Him, [and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term and give every doer of favor his favor. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the శిక్ష of a great Day.
11.4: To అల్లాహ్ is your return, and He is over all things competent."
11.5: Unquestionably, they the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs turn away their breasts to hide themselves from Him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, అల్లాహ్ knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
11.6: And there is no creature on earth but that upon అల్లాహ్ is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.
11.7: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne had been upon water - that He might test you as to which of you is best in deed. But if you say, "Indeed, you are resurrected after death," those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు will surely say, "This is not but obvious magic."
11.8: And if We hold back from them the శిక్ష for a limited time, they will surely say, "What detains it?" Unquestionably, on the Day it comes to them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
11.9: And if We give man a taste of దయ from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
11.10: But if We give him a taste of favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, "Bad times have left me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -
11.12: Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you, or is your breast constrained by it because they say, "Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure or come with him an angel?" But you are only a warner. And అల్లాహ్ is Disposer of all things.
11.13: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Say, "Then bring ten surahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides అల్లాహ్, if you should be సత్యంful."
11.14: And if they do not respond to you - then know that the Qur'an was revealed with the knowledge of అల్లాహ్ and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?
11.15: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.
11.16: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.
11.18: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about అల్లాహ్? Those will be presented before their ప్రభువు, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their ప్రభువు." Unquestionably, the curse of అల్లాహ్ is upon the wrongdoers.
11.19: Who averted [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్ and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
11.20: Those were not causing failure [to అల్లాహ్] on earth, nor did they have besides అల్లాహ్ any protectors. For them the శిక్ష will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.
11.21: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
11.22: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.
11.24: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?
11.25: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner
11.26: That you not worship except అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I fear for you the శిక్ష of a painful day."
11.27: So the eminent among those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."
11.28: He said, "O my people have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my ప్రభువు while He has given me దయ from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
11.29: And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from అల్లాహ్. And I am not one to drive away those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. Indeed, they will meet their ప్రభువు, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
11.30: And O my people, who would protect me from అల్లాహ్ if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?
11.31: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of అల్లాహ్ or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that అల్లాహ్ will never grant them any good. అల్లాహ్ is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers."
11.32: They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the సత్యంful."
11.33: He said, "అల్లాహ్ will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure.
11.34: And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - If అల్లాహ్ should intend to put you in error. He is your ప్రభువు, and to Him you will be returned."
11.35: Or do they say [about Prophet Muhammad], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."
11.36: And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will విశ్వసిస్తారు from your people except those who have already విశ్వసిస్తారుd, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.
11.37: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned."
11.38: And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.
11.39: And you are going to know who will get a శిక్ష that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring శిక్ష [in the Hereafter]."
11.40: [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has విశ్వసిస్తారుd." But none had విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him, except a few.
11.42: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
11.43: [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of అల్లాహ్, except for whom He gives దయ." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.
11.44: And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people."
11.45: And Noah called to his ప్రభువు and said, "My ప్రభువు, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"
11.48: It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful శిక్ష."
11.50: And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].
11.51: O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?
11.52: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your ప్రభువు and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals."
11.53: They said, "O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. Nor are we విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in you.
11.54: We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "Indeed, I call అల్లాహ్ to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with అల్లాహ్
11.55: Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.
11.56: Indeed, I have relied upon అల్లాహ్, my ప్రభువు and your ప్రభువు. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my ప్రభువు is on a మార్గం [that is] straight."
11.57: But if they turn away, [say], "I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you. My ప్రభువు will give విజయంion to a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed my ప్రభువు is, over all things, Guardian."
11.58: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him, by దయ from Us; and We saved them from a harsh శిక్ష.
11.59: And that was 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their ప్రభువు and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.
11.60: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, 'Aad denied their ప్రభువు; then away with 'Aad, the people of Hud.
11.61: And to Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my ప్రభువు is near and responsive."
11.62: They said, "O Salih, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting సందేహం."
11.63: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my ప్రభువు and He has given me దయ from Himself, who would protect me from అల్లాహ్ if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss.
11.64: And O my people, this is the she-camel of అల్లాహ్ - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon అల్లాహ్ 's earth and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by an impending శిక్ష."
11.65: But they hamstrung her, so he said, "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied."
11.66: So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him, by దయ from Us, and [saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, it is your ప్రభువు who is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
11.67: And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
11.68: As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their ప్రభువు; then, away with Thamud.
11.69: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.
11.70: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he distrusted them and felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not. We have been sent to the people of Lot."
11.71: And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.
11.72: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"
11.73: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of అల్లాహ్? May the దయ of అల్లాహ్ and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."
11.74: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.
11.75: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to అల్లాహ్].
11.76: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your ప్రభువు has come, and indeed, there will reach them a శిక్ష that cannot be repelled."
11.77: And when Our messengers, [the angels], came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."
11.78: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear అల్లాహ్ and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"
11.79: They said, "You have already known that we have not concerning your daughters any claim, and indeed, you know what we want."
11.80: He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."
11.81: The angels said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your ప్రభువు; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
11.82: So when Our command came, We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of layered hard clay, [which were]
11.83: Marked from your ప్రభువు. And అల్లాహ్ 's శిక్ష is not from the wrongdoers [very] far.
11.84: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship అల్లాహ్; you have no deity other than Him. And do not decrease from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the శిక్ష of an all-encompassing Day.
11.85: And O my people, give full measure and weight in justice and do not deprive the people of their due and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.
11.86: What remains [lawful] from అల్లాహ్ is best for you, if you would be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. But I am not a guardian over you."
11.87: They said, "O Shu'ayb, does your నమాజ్ command you that we should leave what our fathers worship or not do with our wealth what we please? Indeed, you are the forbearing, the discerning!"
11.88: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my ప్రభువు and He has provided me with a good provision from Him...? And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you; I only intend reform as much as I am able. And my విజయం is not but through అల్లాహ్. Upon him I have relied, and to Him I return.
11.89: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not from you far away.
11.90: And ask forgiveness of your ప్రభువు and then repent to Him. Indeed, my ప్రభువు is Merciful and Affectionate."
11.91: They said, "O Shu'ayb, we do not understand much of what you say, and indeed, we consider you among us as weak. And if not for your family, we would have stoned you [to death]; and you are not to us one respected."
11.92: He said, "O my people, is my family more respected for power by you than అల్లాహ్? But you put Him behind your backs [in neglect]. Indeed, my ప్రభువు is encompassing of what you do.
11.93: And O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. You are going to know to whom will come a శిక్ష that will disgrace him and who is a liar. So watch; indeed, I am with you a watcher, [awaiting the outcome]."
11.94: And when Our command came, We saved Shu'ayb and those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him, by దయ from Us. And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
11.95: As if they had never prospered therein. Then, away with Madyan as Thamud was taken away.
11.96: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
11.97: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.
11.98: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection and lead them into the Fire; and wretched is the place to which they are led.
11.99: And they were followed in this [world] with a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. And wretched is the gift which is given.
11.100: That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].
11.101: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. And they were not availed at all by their gods which they invoked other than అల్లాహ్ when there came the command of your ప్రభువు. And they did not increase them in other than ruin.
11.102: And thus is the seizure of your ప్రభువు when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.
11.103: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the శిక్ష of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.
11.104: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.
11.105: The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.
11.106: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.
11.107: [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your ప్రభువు should will. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is an effecter of what He intends.
11.109: So do not be in సందేహం, [O Muhammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.
11.110: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your ప్రభువు, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting సందేహం.
11.111: And indeed, each [of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] - your ప్రభువు will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do.
11.112: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to అల్లాహ్], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
11.113: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than అల్లాహ్ any protectors; then you would not be helped.
11.114: And establish నమాజ్ at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.
11.115: And be patient, for indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.
