30.27: And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is [even] easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attribute in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
30.28: He presents to you an example from yourselves. Do you have among those whom your right hands possess any partners in what We have provided for you so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them as your fear of one another [within a partnership]? Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason.
30.29: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge. Then who can guide one whom అల్లాహ్ has sent astray? And for them there are no helpers.
30.30: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to సత్యం. [Adhere to] the fitrah of అల్లాహ్ upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of అల్లాహ్. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
30.31: [Adhere to it], turning in repentance to Him, and fear Him and establish నమాజ్ and do not be of those who associate others with అల్లాహ్
30.32: [Or] of those who have divided their religion and become sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has.
30.33: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their ప్రభువు, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste దయ from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their ప్రభువు,
30.34: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
30.35: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?
30.36: And when We let the people taste దయ, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.
30.37: Do they not see that అల్లాహ్ extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు.
30.38: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of అల్లాహ్, and it is they who will be the విజయంful.
30.39: And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with అల్లాహ్. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of అల్లాహ్ - those are the multipliers.
30.40: అల్లాహ్ is the one who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will give you life. Are there any of your "partners" who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
30.42: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were associators [of others with అల్లాహ్].
30.43: So direct your face toward the correct religion before a Day comes from అల్లాహ్ of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.
30.46: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His దయ and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.
30.47: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
30.48: It is అల్లాహ్ who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice
30.49: Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.
30.50: So observe the effects of the దయ of అల్లాహ్ - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
30.51: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
30.52: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.
30.54: అల్లాహ్ is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.
30.55: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.
30.56: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of అల్లాహ్ 's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know."
30.57: So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [అల్లాహ్].
30.58: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs will surely say, "You [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] are but falsifiers."
30.59: Thus does అల్లాహ్ seal the హృదయాలు of those who do not know.
30.60: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].

31.2: These are verses of the wise గ్రంథం,
31.3: As మార్గదర్శనం and దయ for the doers of good
31.4: Who establish నమాజ్ and give zakah, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].
31.5: Those are on [right] మార్గదర్శనం from their ప్రభువు, and it is those who are the విజయంful.
31.6: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of అల్లాహ్ without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating శిక్ష.
31.7: And when our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful శిక్ష.
31.9: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of అల్లాహ్ [which is] సత్యం. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
31.10: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.
31.11: This is the creation of అల్లాహ్. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.
31.12: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to అల్లాహ్." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
31.13: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with అల్లాహ్. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice."
31.14: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.
31.15: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
31.16: [And Luqman said], "O my son, indeed if wrong should be the weight of a mustard seed and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth, అల్లాహ్ will bring it forth. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Subtle and Acquainted.
31.17: O my son, establish నమాజ్, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
31.18: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.
31.19: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys."
31.20: Do you not see that అల్లాహ్ has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about అల్లాహ్ without knowledge or మార్గదర్శనం or an enlightening గ్రంథం [from Him].
31.21: And when it is said to them, "Follow what అల్లాహ్ has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the శిక్ష of the Blaze?
31.22: And whoever submits his face to అల్లాహ్ while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to అల్లాహ్ will be the outcome of [all] matters.
31.23: And whoever has disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of that within the breasts.
31.24: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive శిక్ష.
31.25: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, "అల్లాహ్." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to అల్లాహ్ "; but most of them do not know.
31.26: To అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
31.27: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of అల్లాహ్ would not be exhausted. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Wise.
31.28: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Seeing.
31.29: Do you not see that అల్లాహ్ causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that అల్లాహ్, with whatever you do, is Acquainted?
31.30: That is because అల్లాహ్ is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because అల్లాహ్ is the Most High, the Grand.
31.31: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of అల్లాహ్ that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
31.32: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate అల్లాహ్, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
31.33: O mankind, fear your ప్రభువు and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about అల్లాహ్ by the Deceiver.
31.34: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Acquainted.

32.2: [This is] the revelation of the గ్రంథం about which there is no సందేహం from the ప్రభువు of the worlds.
32.3: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Rather, it is the సత్యం from your ప్రభువు, [O Muhammad], that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you [so] perhaps they will be guided.
32.4: It is అల్లాహ్ who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days; then He established Himself above the Throne. You have not besides Him any protector or any intercessor; so will you not be reminded?
32.5: He arranges [each] matter from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a Day, the extent of which is a thousand years of those which you count.
32.6: That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
32.7: Who perfected everything which He created and began the creation of man from clay.
32.8: Then He made his posterity out of the extract of a liquid disdained.
32.9: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him from His [created] soul and made for you hearing and vision and హృదయాలు; little are you grateful.
32.10: And they say, "When we are lost within the earth, will we indeed be [recreated] in a new creation?" Rather, they are, in [the matter of] the meeting with their ప్రభువు, disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
32.11: Say, "The angel of death will take you who has been entrusted with you. Then to your ప్రభువు you will be returned."
32.14: So taste [శిక్ష] because you forgot the meeting of this, your Day; indeed, We have [accordingly] forgotten you. And taste the శిక్ష of eternity for what you used to do."
32.16: They arise from [their] beds; they supplicate their ప్రభువు in fear and aspiration, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
32.17: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes as reward for what they used to do.
32.18: Then is one who was a విశ్వసిస్తారుr like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.
32.20: But as for those who defiantly disobeyed, their refuge is the Fire. Every time they wish to emerge from it, they will be returned to it while it is said to them, "Taste the శిక్ష of the Fire which you used to deny."
32.21: And we will surely let them taste the nearer శిక్ష short of the greater శిక్ష that perhaps they will repent.
32.22: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his ప్రభువు; then he turns away from them? Indeed We, from the criminals, will take retribution.
32.23: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so do not be in సందేహం over his meeting. And we made the Torah మార్గదర్శనం for the Children of Israel.
32.24: And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and [when] they were certain of Our signs.
32.25: Indeed, your ప్రభువు will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
32.26: Has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them, [as] they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs; then do they not hear?
32.27: Have they not seen that We drive the water [in clouds] to barren land and bring forth thereby crops from which their livestock eat and [they] themselves? Then do they not see?
32.28: And they say, "When will be this conquest, if you should be సత్యంful?"
32.29: Say, [O Muhammad], "On the Day of Conquest the belief of those who had disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd will not benefit them, nor will they be reprieved."
32.30: So turn away from them and wait. Indeed, they are waiting.

33.1: O Prophet, fear అల్లాహ్ and do not obey the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs and the hypocrites. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Knowing and Wise.
33.2: And follow that which is revealed to you from your ప్రభువు. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
33.3: And rely upon అల్లాహ్; and sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Disposer of affairs.
33.4: అల్లాహ్ has not made for a man two హృదయాలు in his interior. And He has not made your wives whom you declare unlawful your mothers. And he has not made your adopted sons your [true] sons. That is [merely] your saying by your mouths, but అల్లాహ్ says the సత్యం, and He guides to the [right] way.
33.5: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of అల్లాహ్. But if you do not know their fathers - then they are [still] your brothers in religion and those entrusted to you. And there is no blame upon you for that in which you have erred but [only for] what your హృదయాలు intended. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.
33.6: The Prophet is more worthy of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs than themselves, and his wives are [in the position of] their mothers. And those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of అల్లాహ్ than the [other] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs and the emigrants, except that you may do to your close associates a kindness [through bequest]. That was in the గ్రంథం inscribed.
33.7: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant.
33.8: That He may question the సత్యంful about their సత్యం. And He has prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs a painful శిక్ష.
33.9: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you when armies came to [attack] you and We sent upon them a wind and armies [of angels] you did not see. And ever is అల్లాహ్, of what you do, Seeing.
33.10: [Remember] when they came at you from above you and from below you, and when eyes shifted [in fear], and హృదయాలు reached the throats and you assumed about అల్లాహ్ [various] assumptions.
33.11: There the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs were tested and shaken with a severe shaking.
33.12: And [remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose హృదయాలు is disease said, "అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger did not promise us except delusion,"
33.13: And when a faction of them said, "O people of Yathrib, there is no stability for you [here], so return [home]." And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, "Indeed, our houses are unprotected," while they were not exposed. They did not intend except to flee.
33.14: And if they had been entered upon from all its [surrounding] regions and fitnah had been demanded of them, they would have done it and not hesitated over it except briefly.
33.15: And they had already promised అల్లాహ్ before not to turn their backs and flee. And ever is the promise to అల్లాహ్ [that about which one will be] questioned.
33.16: Say, [O Muhammad], "Never will fleeing benefit you if you should flee from death or killing; and then [if you did], you would not be given enjoyment [of life] except for a little."
33.17: Say, "Who is it that can protect you from అల్లాహ్ if He intends for you an ill or intends for you a దయ?" And they will not find for themselves besides అల్లాహ్ any protector or any helper.
33.18: Already అల్లాహ్ knows the hinderers among you and those [hypocrites] who say to their brothers, "Come to us," and do not go to battle, except for a few,
33.19: Indisposed toward you. And when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes revolving like one being overcome by death. But when fear departs, they lash you with sharp tongues, indisposed toward [any] good. Those have not విశ్వసిస్తారుd, so అల్లాహ్ has rendered their deeds worthless, and ever is that, for అల్లాహ్, easy.
33.20: They think the companies have not [yet] withdrawn. And if the companies should come [again], they would wish they were in the desert among the bedouins, inquiring [from afar] about your news. And if they should be among you, they would not fight except for a little.
33.21: There has certainly been for you in the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in అల్లాహ్ and the Last Day and [who] remembers అల్లాహ్ often.
33.22: And when the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs saw the companies, they said, "This is what అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger had promised us, and అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger spoke the సత్యం." And it increased them only in faith and acceptance.
33.23: Among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs are men true to what they promised అల్లాహ్. Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death], and among them is he who awaits [his chance]. And they did not alter [the terms of their commitment] by any alteration -
33.24: That అల్లాహ్ may reward the సత్యంful for their సత్యం and punish the hypocrites if He wills or accept their repentance. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
33.25: And అల్లాహ్ repelled those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, in their rage, not having obtained any good. And sufficient was అల్లాహ్ for the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in battle, and ever is అల్లాహ్ Powerful and Exalted in Might.
33.26: And He brought down those who supported them among the People of the Scripture from their fortresses and cast terror into their హృదయాలు [so that] a party you killed, and you took captive a party.
33.27: And He caused you to inherit their land and their homes and their properties and a land which you have not trodden. And ever is అల్లాహ్, over all things, competent.
33.28: O Prophet, say to your wives, "If you should desire the worldly life and its adornment, then come, I will provide for you and give you a gracious release.
33.29: But if you should desire అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and the home of the Hereafter - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward."
33.30: O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you should commit a clear immorality - for her the శిక్ష would be doubled two fold, and ever is that, for అల్లాహ్, easy.
33.32: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among women. If you fear అల్లాహ్, then do not be soft in speech [to men], lest he in whose heart is disease should covet, but speak with appropriate speech.
33.33: And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance. And establish నమాజ్ and give zakah and obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. అల్లాహ్ intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin], O people of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you with [extensive] purification.
33.34: And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of అల్లాహ్ and wisdom. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is ever Subtle and Acquainted [with all things].
33.35: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the సత్యంful men and సత్యంful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember అల్లాహ్ often and the women who do so - for them అల్లాహ్ has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.
33.36: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.
33.37: And [remember, O Muhammad], when you said to the one on whom అల్లాహ్ bestowed favor and you bestowed favor, "Keep your wife and fear అల్లాహ్," while you concealed within yourself that which అల్లాహ్ is to disclose. And you feared the people, while అల్లాహ్ has more right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there not be upon the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs any discomfort concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they no longer have need of them. And ever is the command of అల్లాహ్ accomplished.
33.38: There is not to be upon the Prophet any discomfort concerning that which అల్లాహ్ has imposed upon him. [This is] the established way of అల్లాహ్ with those [prophets] who have passed on before. And ever is the command of అల్లాహ్ a destiny decreed.
33.39: [అల్లాహ్ praises] those who convey the messages of అల్లాహ్ and fear Him and do not fear anyone but అల్లాహ్. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Accountant.
33.40: Muhammad is not the father of [any] one of your men, but [he is] the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ and last of the prophets. And ever is అల్లాహ్, of all things, Knowing.
33.41: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, remember అల్లాహ్ with much remembrance
33.42: And exalt Him morning and afternoon.
33.43: It is He who confers blessing upon you, and His angels [ask Him to do so] that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, Merciful.
33.44: Their greeting the Day they meet Him will be, "Peace." And He has prepared for them a noble reward.
33.45: O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
33.46: And one who invites to అల్లాహ్, by His permission, and an illuminating lamp.
33.47: And give good tidings to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs that they will have from అల్లాహ్ great bounty.
33.48: And do not obey the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs and the hypocrites but do not harm them, and rely upon అల్లాహ్. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Disposer of affairs.
33.49: O You who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is not for you any waiting period to count concerning them. So provide for them and give them a gracious release.
33.50: O Prophet, indeed We have made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those your right hand possesses from what అల్లాహ్ has returned to you [of captives] and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her, [this is] only for you, excluding the [other] విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. We certainly know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess, [but this is for you] in order that there will be upon you no discomfort. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.
33.51: You, [O Muhammad], may put aside whom you will of them or take to yourself whom you will. And any that you desire of those [wives] from whom you had [temporarily] separated - there is no blame upon you [in returning her]. That is more suitable that they should be content and not grieve and that they should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And అల్లాహ్ knows what is in your హృదయాలు. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Knowing and Forbearing.
33.52: Not lawful to you, [O Muhammad], are [any additional] women after [this], nor [is it] for you to exchange them for [other] wives, even if their beauty were to please you, except what your right hand possesses. And ever is అల్లాహ్, over all things, an Observer.
33.53: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But అల్లాహ్ is not shy of the సత్యం. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your హృదయాలు and their హృదయాలు. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be in the sight of అల్లాహ్ an enormity.
33.54: Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, of all things, Knowing.
33.55: There is no blame upon women concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess. And fear అల్లాహ్. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is ever, over all things, Witness.
33.56: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, ask [అల్లాహ్ to confer] blessing upon him and ask [అల్లాహ్ to grant him] peace.
33.57: Indeed, those who abuse అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger - అల్లాహ్ has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating శిక్ష.
33.58: And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned have certainly born upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.
33.59: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. That is more suitable that they will be known and not be abused. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.
33.60: If the hypocrites and those in whose హృదయాలు is disease and those who spread rumors in al-Madinah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little.
33.61: Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.
33.62: [This is] the established way of అల్లాహ్ with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of అల్లాహ్ any change.
33.63: People ask you concerning the Hour. Say," Knowledge of it is only with అల్లాహ్. And what may make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near."
33.64: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ has cursed the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs and prepared for them a Blaze.
33.65: Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.
33.66: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed అల్లాహ్ and obeyed the Messenger."
33.67: And they will say, "Our ప్రభువు, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries, and they led us astray from the [right] way.
33.68: Our ప్రభువు, give them double the శిక్ష and curse them with a great curse."
33.69: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, be not like those who abused Moses; then అల్లాహ్ cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of అల్లాహ్, was distinguished.
33.70: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear అల్లాహ్ and speak words of appropriate justice.
33.71: He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.
33.72: Indeed, we offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.
33.73: [It was] so that అల్లాహ్ may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that అల్లాహ్ may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.

34.1: [All] praise is [due] to అల్లాహ్, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
34.2: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.
34.3: But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my ప్రభువు, it will surely come to you. [అల్లాహ్ is] the Knower of the unseen." Not absent from Him is an atom's weight within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear register -
34.5: But those who strive against Our verses [seeking] to cause failure - for them will be a painful శిక్ష of foul nature.
34.6: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your ప్రభువు is the సత్యం, and it guides to the మార్గం of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.
34.7: But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say, "Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you [that] when you have disintegrated in complete disintegration, you will [then] be [recreated] in a new creation?
34.9: Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to అల్లాహ్].
34.10: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,
34.12: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his ప్రభువు. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the శిక్ష of the Blaze.
34.13: They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers, statues, bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.
34.14: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating శిక్ష.
34.15: There was for [the tribe of] Saba' in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your ప్రభువు and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving ప్రభువు."
34.16: But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.
34.17: [By] that We repaid them because they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?
34.18: And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], "Travel between them by night or day in safety."
34.19: But [insolently] they said, "Our ప్రభువు, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
34.20: And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
34.21: And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who విశ్వసిస్తారుs in the Hereafter from who is thereof in సందేహం. And your ప్రభువు, over all things, is Guardian.
34.22: Say, [O Muhammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides అల్లాహ్." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.
34.23: And intercession does not benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [And those wait] until, when terror is removed from their హృదయాలు, they will say [to one another], "What has your ప్రభువు said?" They will say, "The సత్యం." And He is the Most High, the Grand.
34.24: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "అల్లాహ్. And indeed, we or you are either upon మార్గదర్శనం or in clear error."
34.25: Say, "You will not be asked about what we committed, and we will not be asked about what you do."
34.26: Say, "Our ప్రభువు will bring us together; then He will judge between us in సత్యం. And He is the Knowing Judge."
34.27: Say, "Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
34.28: And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.
34.29: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be సత్యంful?"
34.30: Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."
34.32: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from మార్గదర్శనం after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."
34.34: And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
34.35: And they said, "We are more [than the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."
34.36: Say, "Indeed, my ప్రభువు extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."
34.38: And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure - those will be brought into the శిక్ష [to remain].
34.39: Say, "Indeed, my ప్రభువు extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
34.40: And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"
34.41: They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O అల్లాహ్], are our benefactor not them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were విశ్వసిస్తారుrs in them."
34.42: But today you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the శిక్ష of the Fire, which you used to deny."
34.43: And when our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say of the సత్యం when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."
34.44: And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muhammad], any warner.
34.45: And those before them denied, and the people of Makkah have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But the former peoples denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.
34.46: Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for అల్లాహ్, [seeking సత్యం] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe శిక్ష.
34.47: Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from అల్లాహ్, and He is, over all things, Witness."
34.48: Say, "Indeed, my ప్రభువు projects the సత్యం. Knower of the unseen."
34.49: Say, "The సత్యం has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."
34.50: Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my ప్రభువు reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."
34.51: And if you could see when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.
34.53: And they had already disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in it before and would assault the unseen from a place far away.
34.54: And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting denial.

35.1: [All] praise is [due] to అల్లాహ్, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
35.2: Whatever అల్లాహ్ grants to people of దయ - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
35.3: O mankind, remember the favor of అల్లాహ్ upon you. Is there any creator other than అల్లాహ్ who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
35.4: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to అల్లాహ్ are returned [all] matters.
35.5: O mankind, indeed the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about అల్లాహ్ by the Deceiver.
35.6: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
35.8: Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, అల్లాహ్ sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of what they do.
35.9: And it is అల్లాహ్ who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.
35.11: And అల్లాహ్ created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for అల్లాహ్ is easy.
35.12: And not alike are the two bodies of water. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
35.13: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.
35.14: If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association. And none can inform you like [one] Acquainted [with all matters].
35.15: O mankind, you are those in need of అల్లాహ్, while అల్లాహ్ is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
35.16: If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.
35.17: And that is for అల్లాహ్ not difficult.
35.18: And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their ప్రభువు unseen and have established నమాజ్. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to అల్లాహ్ is the [final] destination.
35.19: Not equal are the blind and the seeing,
35.20: Nor are the darknesses and the light,
35.21: Nor are the shade and the heat,
35.22: And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.
35.23: You, [O Muhammad], are not but a warner.
35.24: Indeed, We have sent you with the సత్యం as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
35.25: And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.
35.26: Then I seized the ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
35.27: Do you not see that అల్లాహ్ sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.
35.28: And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear అల్లాహ్, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
35.29: Indeed, those who recite the గ్రంథం of అల్లాహ్ and establish నమాజ్ and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a profit that will never perish -
35.30: That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.
35.31: And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of the గ్రంథం is the సత్యం, confirming what was before it. Indeed, అల్లాహ్, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing.
35.32: Then we caused to inherit the గ్రంథం those We have chosen of Our servants; and among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of అల్లాహ్. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.
35.33: [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
35.34: And they will say, "Praise to అల్లాహ్, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our ప్రభువు is Forgiving and Appreciative -
35.35: He who has settled us in the home of duration out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."
35.38: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
35.39: It is He who has made you విజయంors upon the earth. And whoever disవిశ్వసిస్తారుs - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs does not increase them in the sight of their ప్రభువు except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs does not increase them except in loss.
35.40: Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides అల్లాహ్? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."
35.41: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.
35.42: And they swore by అల్లాహ్ their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion.
35.43: [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of అల్లాహ్ any change, and you will never find in the way of అల్లాహ్ any alteration.
35.44: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But అల్లాహ్ is not to be caused failure by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.
35.45: And if అల్లాహ్ were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed అల్లాహ్ has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.

36.3: Indeed you, [O Muhammad], are from among the messengers,
36.5: [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
36.6: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
36.7: Already the word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
36.8: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.
36.9: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
36.10: And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
36.11: You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.
36.12: Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.
36.13: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -
36.14: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
36.15: They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
36.16: They said, "Our ప్రభువు knows that we are messengers to you,
36.17: And we are not responsible except for clear notification."
36.18: They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful శిక్ష."
36.19: They said, "Your omen is with yourselves. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."
36.20: And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
36.21: Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
36.22: And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
36.23: Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
36.24: Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
36.25: Indeed, I have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in your ప్రభువు, so listen to me."
36.27: Of how my ప్రభువు has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."
36.28: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
36.29: It was not but one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.
36.30: How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
36.31: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them will not return?
36.32: And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.
36.33: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
36.34: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -
36.35: That they may eat of His fruit. And their hands have not produced it, so will they not be grateful?
36.36: Exalted is He who created all pairs - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.
36.37: And a sign for them is the night. We remove from it [the light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.
36.38: And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
36.39: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
36.40: It is not allowable for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.
36.41: And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers in a laden ship.
36.42: And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.
36.43: And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved
36.44: Except as a దయ from Us and provision for a time.
36.45: But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you; perhaps you will receive దయ... "
36.46: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their ప్రభువు except that they are from it turning away.
36.47: And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which అల్లాహ్ has provided for you," those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say to those who విశ్వసిస్తారు, "Should we feed one whom, if అల్లాహ్ had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."
36.48: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be సత్యంful?"
36.49: They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing.
36.50: And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.
36.51: And the Horn will be blown; and at once from the graves to their ప్రభువు they will hasten.
36.52: They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the సత్యం."
36.53: It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.
36.54: So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
36.56: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.
36.57: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]
36.58: [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful ప్రభువు.
36.59: [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.
36.60: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -
36.62: And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?
36.64: [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."
36.65: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
36.66: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the మార్గం, and how could they see?
36.67: And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.
36.68: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?
36.69: And We did not give Prophet Muhammad, knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an
36.70: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
36.71: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?
36.72: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
36.73: And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?
36.74: But they have taken besides అల్లాహ్ [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.
36.75: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.
36.76: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
36.77: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?
36.78: And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"
36.79: Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
36.80: [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.
36.81: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.
36.82: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
36.83: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

37.1: By those [angels] lined up in rows
37.3: And those who recite the message,
37.5: ప్రభువు of the heavens and the earth and that between them and ప్రభువు of the sunrises.
37.6: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
37.7: And as protection against every rebellious devil
37.8: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,
37.9: Repelled; and for them is a constant శిక్ష,
37.10: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
37.11: Then inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created men from sticky clay.
37.12: But you wonder, while they mock,
37.13: And when they are reminded, they remember not.
37.14: And when they see a sign, they ridicule
37.15: And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
37.16: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
37.18: Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."
37.19: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
37.20: They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
37.21: [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
37.22: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds, and what they used to worship
37.24: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
37.25: [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
37.26: But they, that Day, are in surrender.
37.27: And they will approach one another blaming each other.
37.28: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."
37.29: The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not విశ్వసిస్తారుrs,
37.30: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
37.31: So the word of our ప్రభువు has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [శిక్ష].
37.32: And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
37.33: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the శిక్ష.
37.34: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
37.35: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but అల్లాహ్," were arrogant
37.36: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
37.37: Rather, the Prophet has come with the సత్యం and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
37.38: Indeed, you [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] will be tasters of the painful శిక్ష,
37.39: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
37.40: But not the chosen servants of అల్లాహ్.
37.41: Those will have a provision determined -
37.42: Fruits; and they will be honored
37.45: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
37.46: White and delicious to the drinkers;
37.47: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
37.48: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,
37.49: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
37.50: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
37.51: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth]
37.52: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who విశ్వసిస్తారు
37.53: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
37.54: He will say, "Would you [care to] look?"
37.56: He will say, "By అల్లాహ్, you almost ruined me.
37.58: Then, are we not to die
37.59: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
37.60: Indeed, this is the great attainment.
37.61: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.
37.63: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
37.65: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.
37.66: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
37.67: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
37.69: Indeed they found their fathers astray.
37.70: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
37.71: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
37.72: And We had already sent among them warners.
37.73: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
37.74: But not the chosen servants of అల్లాహ్.
37.75: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
37.76: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
37.77: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
37.78: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
37.80: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
37.81: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
37.83: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
37.84: When he came to his ప్రభువు with a sound heart
37.85: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
37.86: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than అల్లాహ్ you desire?
37.87: Then what is your thought about the ప్రభువు of the worlds?"
37.88: And he cast a look at the stars
37.89: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
37.90: So they turned away from him, departing.
37.91: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?
37.92: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"
37.93: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
37.94: Then the people came toward him, hastening.
37.95: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
37.96: While అల్లాహ్ created you and that which you do?"
37.97: They said, "Construct for him a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."
37.98: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.
37.99: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my ప్రభువు; He will guide me.
37.101: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.
37.102: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if అల్లాహ్ wills, of the steadfast."
37.103: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,
37.105: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
37.106: Indeed, this was the clear trial.
37.107: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
37.108: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
37.110: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
37.111: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
37.113: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.
37.114: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
37.115: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
37.116: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
37.117: And We gave them the explicit Scripture,
37.119: And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
37.121: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
37.122: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
37.123: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
37.124: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear అల్లాహ్?
37.125: Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators -
37.126: అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు and the ప్రభువు of your first forefathers?"
37.127: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for శిక్ష],
37.128: Except the chosen servants of అల్లాహ్.
37.129: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
37.131: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
37.132: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
37.133: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
37.134: [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
37.135: Except his wife among those who remained [with the evildoers].
37.137: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
37.138: And at night. Then will you not use reason?
37.139: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
37.140: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
37.141: And he drew lots and was among the losers.
37.142: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.
37.143: And had he not been of those who exalt అల్లాహ్,
37.144: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.
37.145: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
37.146: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.
37.147: And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
37.148: And they విశ్వసిస్తారుd, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
37.149: So inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Does your ప్రభువు have daughters while they have sons?
37.150: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
37.151: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
37.152: " అల్లాహ్ has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
37.153: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
37.154: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
37.155: Then will you not be reminded?
37.156: Or do you have a clear authority?
37.157: Then produce your scripture, if you should be సత్యంful.
37.158: And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [శిక్ష].
37.159: Exalted is అల్లాహ్ above what they describe,
37.160: Except the chosen servants of అల్లాహ్ [who do not share in that sin].
37.161: So indeed, you [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] and whatever you worship,
37.162: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
37.164: [The angels say], "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.
37.165: And indeed, we are those who line up [for నమాజ్].
37.166: And indeed, we are those who exalt అల్లాహ్."
37.167: And indeed, the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs used to say,
37.168: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
37.169: We would have been the chosen servants of అల్లాహ్."
37.170: But they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in it, so they are going to know.
37.171: And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
37.172: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
37.173: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.
37.174: So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.
37.175: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
37.176: Then for Our శిక్ష are they impatient?
37.177: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
37.178: And leave them for a time.
37.179: And see, for they are going to see.
37.180: Exalted is your ప్రభువు, the ప్రభువు of might, above what they describe.
37.182: And praise to అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.

38.1: Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder...
38.2: But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు are in pride and dissension.
38.3: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.
38.4: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. And the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs say, "This is a magician and a liar.
38.5: Has he made the gods [only] one అల్లాహ్? Indeed, this is a curious thing."
38.6: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.
38.7: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.
38.8: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in సందేహం about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My శిక్ష.
38.9: Or do they have the depositories of the దయ of your ప్రభువు, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?
38.10: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.
38.11: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs].
38.12: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,
38.13: And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket. Those are the companies.
38.14: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.
38.15: And these [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.
38.16: And they say, "Our ప్రభువు, hasten for us our share [of the శిక్ష] before the Day of Account"
38.17: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to అల్లాహ్].
38.18: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [అల్లాహ్] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
38.19: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].
38.20: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.
38.21: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] నమాజ్ chamber -
38.22: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with సత్యం and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound మార్గం.
38.23: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."
38.25: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
38.26: [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a విజయంor upon the earth, so judge between the people in సత్యం and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of అల్లాహ్." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of అల్లాహ్ will have a severe శిక్ష for having forgotten the Day of Account.
38.27: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, so woe to those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు from the Fire.
38.29: [This is] a blessed గ్రంథం which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.
38.30: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to అల్లాహ్].
38.31: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.
38.32: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my ప్రభువు until the sun disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."
38.33: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking [their] legs and necks.
38.34: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body; then he returned.
38.35: He said, "My ప్రభువు, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."
38.36: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,
38.37: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver
38.38: And others bound together in shackles.
38.39: [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."
38.40: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
38.41: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his ప్రభువు, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."
38.42: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for] a cool bath and drink."
38.43: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as దయ from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.
38.44: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath." Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to అల్లాహ్].
38.45: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.
38.46: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].
38.47: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.
38.48: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
38.50: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.
38.51: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.
38.52: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.
38.54: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.
38.55: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -
38.57: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.
38.58: And other [శిక్షs] of its type [in various] kinds.
38.59: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."
38.60: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."
38.61: They will say, "Our ప్రభువు, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double శిక్ష in the Fire."
38.62: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?
38.63: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"
38.64: Indeed, that is సత్యం - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.
38.65: Say, [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except అల్లాహ్, the One, the Prevailing.
38.66: ప్రభువు of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."
38.69: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].
38.70: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."
38.71: [So mention] when your ప్రభువు said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.
38.72: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."
38.73: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.
38.74: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
38.75: [అల్లాహ్] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"
38.76: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
38.78: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."
38.79: He said, "My ప్రభువు, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
38.80: [అల్లాహ్] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
38.81: Until the Day of the time well-known."
38.82: [Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all
38.83: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
38.84: [అల్లాహ్] said, "The సత్యం [is My oath], and the సత్యం I say -
38.86: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment, and I am not of the pretentious
38.87: It is but a reminder to the worlds.
38.88: And you will surely know [the సత్యం of] its information after a time."

39.1: The revelation of the Qur'an is from అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
39.2: Indeed, We have sent down to you the గ్రంథం, [O Muhammad], in సత్యం. So worship అల్లాహ్, [being] sincere to Him in religion.
39.3: Unquestionably, for అల్లాహ్ is the pure religion. And those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to అల్లాహ్ in position." Indeed, అల్లాహ్ will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disవిశ్వసిస్తారుr.
39.4: If అల్లాహ్ had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is అల్లాహ్, the One, the Prevailing.
39.5: He created the heavens and earth in సత్యం. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.
39.6: He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses. That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?
39.7: If you disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your ప్రభువు is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
39.8: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his ప్రభువు, turning to Him [alone]; then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself, he forgets Him whom he called upon before, and he attributes to అల్లాహ్ equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."
39.9: Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in నమాజ్], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the దయ of his ప్రభువు, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.
39.10: Say, "O My servants who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear your ప్రభువు. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of అల్లాహ్ is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account."
39.11: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship అల్లాహ్, [being] sincere to Him in religion.
39.12: And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."
39.13: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my ప్రభువు, the శిక్ష of a tremendous Day."
39.14: Say, "అల్లాహ్ [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my religion,
39.15: So worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."
39.16: They will have canopies of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that అల్లాహ్ threatens His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.
39.17: But those who have avoided Taghut, lest they worship it, and turned back to అల్లాహ్ - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants
39.18: Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones అల్లాహ్ has guided, and those are people of understanding.
39.19: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of శిక్ష [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?
39.20: But those who have feared their ప్రభువు - for them are chambers, above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of అల్లాహ్. అల్లాహ్ does not fail in [His] promise.
39.21: Do you not see that అల్లాహ్ sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.
39.22: So is one whose breast అల్లాహ్ has expanded to [accept] Islam and he is upon a light from his ప్రభువు [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose హృదయాలు are hardened against the remembrance of అల్లాహ్. Those are in manifest error.
39.23: అల్లాహ్ has sent down the best statement: a consistent గ్రంథం wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their ప్రభువు; then their skins and their హృదయాలు relax at the remembrance of అల్లాహ్. That is the మార్గదర్శనం of అల్లాహ్ by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom అల్లాహ్ leaves astray - for him there is no guide.
39.24: Then is he who will shield with his face the worst of the శిక్ష on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn."
39.25: Those before them denied, and శిక్ష came upon them from where they did not perceive.
39.26: So అల్లాహ్ made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the శిక్ష of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
39.27: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.
39.30: Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.
39.31: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your ప్రభువు, will dispute.
39.34: They will have whatever they desire with their ప్రభువు. That is the reward of the doers of good -
39.35: That అల్లాహ్ may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.
39.36: Is not అల్లాహ్ sufficient for His Servant [Prophet Muhammad]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever అల్లాహ్ leaves astray - for him there is no guide.
39.37: And whoever అల్లాహ్ guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not అల్లాహ్ Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?
39.38: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "అల్లాహ్." Say, "Then have you considered what you invoke besides అల్లాహ్? If అల్లాహ్ intended me harm, are they removers of His harm; or if He intended me దయ, are they withholders of His దయ?" Say, "Sufficient for me is అల్లాహ్; upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."
39.39: Say, "O my people, work according to your position, [for] indeed, I am working; and you are going to know
39.40: To whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring శిక్ష."
39.41: Indeed, We sent down to you the గ్రంథం for the people in సత్యం. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.
