39.42: అల్లాహ్ takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
39.43: Or have they taken other than అల్లాహ్ as intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything, nor do they reason?"
39.44: Say, "To అల్లాహ్ belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."
39.46: Say, "O అల్లాహ్, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."
39.47: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the శిక్ష on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from అల్లాహ్ that which they had not taken into account.
39.48: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
39.49: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.
39.50: Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.
39.51: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be afflicted by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.
39.52: Do they not know that అల్లాహ్ extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who విశ్వసిస్తారు.
39.53: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the దయ of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."
39.54: And return [in repentance] to your ప్రభువు and submit to Him before the శిక్ష comes upon you; then you will not be helped.
39.55: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your ప్రభువు before the శిక్ష comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,
39.56: Lest a soul should say, "Oh [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to అల్లాహ్ and that I was among the mockers."
39.58: Or [lest] it say when it sees the శిక్ష, "If only I had another turn so I could be among the doers of good."
39.59: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
39.61: And అల్లాహ్ will save those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
39.62: అల్లాహ్ is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.
39.64: Say, [O Muhammad], "Is it other than అల్లాహ్ that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"
39.65: And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with అల్లాహ్, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers."
39.66: Rather, worship [only] అల్లాహ్ and be among the grateful.
39.67: They have not appraised అల్లాహ్ with true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
39.68: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom అల్లాహ్ wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.
39.69: And the earth will shine with the light of its ప్రభువు, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in సత్యం, and they will not be wronged.
39.70: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.
39.75: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [అల్లాహ్] with praise of their ప్రభువు. And it will be judged between them in సత్యం, and it will be said, "[All] praise to అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds."

40.2: The revelation of the గ్రంథం is from అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
40.3: The forgiver of sin, acceptor of repentance, severe in శిక్ష, owner of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the destination.
40.4: No one disputes concerning the signs of అల్లాహ్ except those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.
40.5: The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the సత్యం. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.
40.6: And thus has the word of your ప్రభువు come into effect upon those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd that they are companions of the Fire.
40.9: And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him దయ. And that is the great attainment."
40.11: They will say, "Our ప్రభువు, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So is there to an exit any way?"
40.12: [They will be told], "That is because, when అల్లాహ్ was called upon alone, you disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd; but if others were associated with Him, you విశ్వసిస్తారుd. So the judgement is with అల్లాహ్, the Most High, the Grand."
40.13: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky, provision. But none will remember except he who turns back [in repentance].
40.14: So invoke అల్లాహ్, [being] sincere to Him in religion, although the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs dislike it.
40.15: [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees, Owner of the Throne; He places the inspiration of His command upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting.
40.16: The Day they come forth nothing concerning them will be concealed from అల్లాహ్. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To అల్లాహ్, the One, the Prevailing.
40.17: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today! Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is swift in account.
40.18: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Approaching Day, when హృదయాలు are at the throats, filled [with distress]. For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.
40.19: He knows that which deceives the eyes and what the breasts conceal.
40.20: And అల్లాహ్ judges with సత్యం, while those they invoke besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
40.21: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but అల్లాహ్ seized them for their sins. And they had not from అల్లాహ్ any protector.
40.22: That was because their messengers were coming to them with clear proofs, but they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, so అల్లాహ్ seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in శిక్ష.
40.23: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
40.24: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun; but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."
40.25: And when he brought them the సత్యం from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him and keep their women alive." But the plan of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is not except in error.
40.26: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his ప్రభువు. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land."
40.28: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My ప్రభువు is అల్లాహ్' while he has brought you clear proofs from your ప్రభువు? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be సత్యంful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.
40.29: O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the శిక్ష of అల్లాహ్ if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."
40.30: And he who విశ్వసిస్తారుd said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies -
40.31: Like the custom of the people of Noah and of 'Aad and Thamud and those after them. And అల్లాహ్ wants no injustice for [His] servants.
40.32: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling -
40.33: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; there is not for you from అల్లాహ్ any protector. And whoever అల్లాహ్ leaves astray - there is not for him any guide.
40.34: And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you remained in సందేహం of that which he brought to you, until when he died, you said, 'Never will అల్లాహ్ send a messenger after him.' Thus does అల్లాహ్ leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."
40.35: Those who dispute concerning the signs of అల్లాహ్ without an authority having come to them - great is hatred [of them] in the sight of అల్లాహ్ and in the sight of those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. Thus does అల్లాహ్ seal over every heart [belonging to] an arrogant tyrant.
40.36: And Pharaoh said, "O Haman, construct for me a tower that I might reach the ways -
40.37: The ways into the heavens - so that I may look at the deity of Moses; but indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.
40.38: And he who విశ్వసిస్తారుd said, "O my people, follow me, I will guide you to the way of right conduct.
40.39: O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.
40.41: And O my people, how is it that I invite you to salvation while you invite me to the Fire?
40.43: Assuredly, that to which you invite me has no [response to a] supplication in this world or in the Hereafter; and indeed, our return is to అల్లాహ్, and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.
40.44: And you will remember what I [now] say to you, and I entrust my affair to అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of [His] servants."
40.45: So అల్లాహ్ protected him from the evils they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of శిక్ష -
40.46: The Fire, they are exposed to it morning and evening. And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], "Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest శిక్ష."
40.47: And [mention] when they will argue within the Fire, and the weak will say to those who had been arrogant, "Indeed, we were [only] your followers, so will you relieve us of a share of the Fire?"
40.48: Those who had been arrogant will say, "Indeed, all [of us] are in it. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ has judged between the servants."
40.50: They will say, "Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply, "Then supplicate [yourselves], but the supplication of the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is not except in error."
40.51: Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who విశ్వసిస్తారు during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -
40.52: The Day their excuse will not benefit the wrongdoers, and they will have the curse, and they will have the worst home.
40.53: And We had certainly given Moses మార్గదర్శనం, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture
40.54: As మార్గదర్శనం and a reminder for those of understanding.
40.55: So be patient, [O Muhammad]. Indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [అల్లాహ్] with praise of your ప్రభువు in the evening and the morning.
40.57: The creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.
40.59: Indeed, the Hour is coming - no సందేహం about it - but most of the people do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
40.61: It is అల్లాహ్ who made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day giving sight. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people are not grateful.
40.62: That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు, Creator of all things; there is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
40.63: Thus were those [before you] deluded who were rejecting the signs of అల్లాహ్.
40.64: It is అల్లాహ్ who made for you the earth a place of settlement and the sky a ceiling and formed you and perfected your forms and provided you with good things. That is అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు; then blessed is అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
40.65: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, [being] sincere to Him in religion. [All] praise is [due] to అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
40.66: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides అల్లాహ్ once the clear proofs have come to me from my ప్రభువు, and I have been commanded to submit to the ప్రభువు of the worlds."
40.67: It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot; then He brings you out as a child; then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity, then [further] that you become elders. And among you is he who is taken in death before [that], so that you reach a specified term; and perhaps you will use reason.
40.68: He it is who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, "Be," and it is.
40.69: Do you not consider those who dispute concerning the signs of అల్లాహ్ - how are they averted?
40.70: Those who deny the గ్రంథం and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know,
40.71: When the shackles are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged
40.72: In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame].
40.73: Then it will be said to them, "Where is that which you used to associate [with Him in worship]
40.74: Other than అల్లాహ్?" They will say, "They have departed from us; rather, we did not used to invoke previously anything." Thus does అల్లాహ్ put astray the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
40.75: [The angels will say], "That was because you used to exult upon the earth without right and you used to behave insolently.
40.77: So be patient, [O Muhammad]; indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We take you in death, it is to Us they will be returned.
40.78: And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of అల్లాహ్. So when the command of అల్లాహ్ comes, it will be concluded in సత్యం, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].
40.79: It is అల్లాహ్ who made for you the grazing animals upon which you ride, and some of them you eat.
40.80: And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts; and upon them and upon ships you are carried.
40.81: And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of అల్లాహ్ do you deny?
40.82: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.
40.83: And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
40.85: But never did their faith benefit them once they saw Our శిక్ష. [It is] the established way of అల్లాహ్ which has preceded among His servants. And the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs thereupon lost [all].

41.2: [This is] a revelation from the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful -
41.3: A గ్రంథం whose verses have been detailed, an Arabic Qur'an for a people who know,
41.4: As a giver of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear.
41.5: And they say, "Our హృదయాలు are within coverings from that to which you invite us, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a partition, so work; indeed, we are working."
41.6: Say, O [Muhammad], "I am only a man like you to whom it has been revealed that your god is but one అల్లాహ్; so take a straight course to Him and seek His forgiveness." And woe to those who associate others with అల్లాహ్ -
41.7: Those who do not give zakah, and in the Hereafter they are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
41.10: And He placed on the earth firmly set mountains over its surface, and He blessed it and determined therein its [creatures'] sustenance in four days without distinction - for [the information] of those who ask.
41.11: Then He directed Himself to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come [into being], willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We have come willingly."
41.12: And He completed them as seven heavens within two days and inspired in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps and as protection. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
41.13: But if they turn away, then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] 'Aad and Thamud.
41.14: [That occurred] when the messengers had come to them before them and after them, [saying], "Worship not except అల్లాహ్." They said, "If our ప్రభువు had willed, He would have sent down the angels, so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent, are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
41.15: As for 'Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, "Who is greater than us in strength?" Did they not consider that అల్లాహ్ who created them was greater than them in strength? But they were rejecting Our signs.
41.16: So We sent upon them a screaming wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the శిక్ష of disgrace in the worldly life; but the శిక్ష of the Hereafter is more disgracing, and they will not be helped.
41.17: And as for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over మార్గదర్శనం, so the thunderbolt of humiliating శిక్ష seized them for what they used to earn.
41.18: And We saved those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd and used to fear అల్లాహ్.
41.19: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day when the enemies of అల్లాహ్ will be gathered to the Fire while they are [driven] assembled in rows,
41.20: Until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them of what they used to do.
41.21: And they will say to their skins, "Why have you testified against us?" They will say, "We were made to speak by అల్లాహ్, who has made everything speak; and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.
41.22: And you were not covering yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that అల్లాహ్ does not know much of what you do.
41.23: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your ప్రభువు. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers."
41.24: So [even] if they are patient, the Fire is a residence for them; and if they ask to appease [అల్లాహ్], they will not be of those who are allowed to appease.
41.25: And We appointed for them companions who made attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them [of sin], and the word has come into effect upon them among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.
41.26: And those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say, "Do not listen to this Qur'an and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome."
41.27: But We will surely cause those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు to taste a severe శిక్ష, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they had been doing.
41.28: That is the recompense of the enemies of అల్లాహ్ - the Fire. For them therein is the home of eternity as recompense for what they, of Our verses, were rejecting.
41.29: And those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd will [then] say, "Our ప్రభువు, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men [so] we may put them under our feet that they will be among the lowest."
41.31: We [angels] were your allies in worldly life and [are so] in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request [or wish]
41.32: As accommodation from a [ప్రభువు who is] Forgiving and Merciful."
41.34: And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.
41.35: But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].
41.37: And of His signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostate to అల్లాహ్, who created them, if it should be Him that you worship.
41.38: But if they are arrogant - then those who are near your ప్రభువు exalt Him by night and by day, and they do not become weary.
41.39: And of His signs is that you see the earth stilled, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and grows. Indeed, He who has given it life is the Giver of Life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.
41.40: Indeed, those who inject deviation into Our verses are not concealed from Us. So, is he who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
41.42: Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it; [it is] a revelation from a [ప్రభువు who is] Wise and Praiseworthy.
41.43: Nothing is said to you, [O Muhammad], except what was already said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is a possessor of forgiveness and a possessor of painful penalty.
41.44: And if We had made it a non-Arabic Qur'an, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail [in our language]? Is it a foreign [recitation] and an Arab [messenger]?" Say, "It is, for those who విశ్వసిస్తారు, a మార్గదర్శనం and cure." And those who do not విశ్వసిస్తారు - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.
41.45: And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your ప్రభువు, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting సందేహం.
41.47: To him [alone] is attributed knowledge of the Hour. And fruits emerge not from their coverings nor does a female conceive or give birth except with His knowledge. And the Day He will call to them, "Where are My 'partners'?" they will say, "We announce to You that there is [no longer] among us any witness [to that]."
41.48: And lost from them will be those they were invoking before, and they will be certain that they have no place of escape.
41.49: Man is not weary of supplication for good [things], but if evil touches him, he is hopeless and despairing.
41.50: And if We let him taste దయ from Us after an adversity which has touched him, he will surely say, "This is [due] to me, and I do not think the Hour will occur; and [even] if I should be returned to my ప్రభువు, indeed, for me there will be with Him the best." But We will surely inform those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd about what they did, and We will surely make them taste a massive శిక్ష.
41.51: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.
41.52: Say, "Have you considered: if the Qur'an is from అల్లాహ్ and you disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in it, who would be more astray than one who is in extreme dissension?"
41.53: We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the సత్యం. But is it not sufficient concerning your ప్రభువు that He is, over all things, a Witness?
41.54: Unquestionably, they are in సందేహం about the meeting with their ప్రభువు. Unquestionably He is, of all things, encompassing.

42.3: Thus has He revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and to those before you - అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
42.4: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.
42.5: The heavens almost break from above them, and the angels exalt [అల్లాహ్] with praise of their ప్రభువు and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is అల్లాహ్ who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
42.6: And those who take as allies other than Him - అల్లాహ్ is [yet] Guardian over them; and you, [O Muhammad], are not over them a manager.
42.8: And if అల్లాహ్ willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills into His దయ. And the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.
42.9: Or have they taken protectors [or allies] besides him? But అల్లాహ్ - He is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
42.10: And in anything over which you disagree - its ruling is [to be referred] to అల్లాహ్. [Say], "That is అల్లాహ్, my ప్రభువు; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back."
42.11: [He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
42.12: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is, of all things, Knowing.
42.13: He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with అల్లాహ్ is that to which you invite them. అల్లాహ్ chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].
42.14: And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word that preceded from your ప్రభువు [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are, concerning it, in disquieting సందేహం.
42.15: So to that [religion of అల్లాహ్] invite, [O Muhammad], and remain on a right course as you are commanded and do not follow their inclinations but say, "I have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in what అల్లాహ్ has revealed of the Qur'an, and I have been commanded to do justice among you. అల్లాహ్ is our ప్రభువు and your ప్రభువు. For us are our deeds, and for you your deeds. There is no [need for] argument between us and you. అల్లాహ్ will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination."
42.16: And those who argue concerning అల్లాహ్ after He has been responded to - their argument is invalid with their ప్రభువు, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe శిక్ష.
42.17: It is అల్లాహ్ who has sent down the గ్రంథం in సత్యం and [also] the balance. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.
42.19: అల్లాహ్ is Subtle with His servants; He gives provisions to whom He wills. And He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
42.20: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.
42.21: Or have they other deities who have ordained for them a religion to which అల్లాహ్ has not consented? But if not for the decisive word, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful శిక్ష.
42.24: Or do they say, "He has invented about అల్లాహ్ a lie"? But if అల్లాహ్ willed, He could seal over your heart. And అల్లాహ్ eliminates falsehood and establishes the సత్యం by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
42.25: And it is He who accepts repentance from his servants and pardons misdeeds, and He knows what you do.
42.27: And if అల్లాహ్ had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed He is, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
42.28: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His దయ. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.
42.29: And of his signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He, for gathering them when He wills, is competent.
42.30: And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.
42.31: And you will not cause failure [to అల్లాహ్] upon the earth. And you have not besides అల్లాహ్ any protector or helper.
42.32: And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.
42.33: If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
42.34: Or He could destroy them for what they earned; but He pardons much.
42.35: And [that is so] those who dispute concerning Our signs may know that for them there is no place of escape.
42.36: So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with అల్లాహ్ is better and more lasting for those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd and upon their ప్రభువు rely
42.37: And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive,
42.38: And those who have responded to their lord and established నమాజ్ and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
42.39: And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves,
42.40: And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from అల్లాహ్. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.
42.41: And whoever avenges himself after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].
42.42: The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful శిక్ష.
42.43: And whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
42.44: And he whom అల్లాహ్ sends astray - for him there is no protector beyond Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the శిక్ష, saying, "Is there for return [to the former world] any way?"
42.45: And you will see them being exposed to the Fire, humbled from humiliation, looking from [behind] a covert glance. And those who had విశ్వసిస్తారుd will say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring శిక్ష."
42.46: And there will not be for them any allies to aid them other than అల్లాహ్. And whoever అల్లాహ్ sends astray - for him there is no way.
42.47: Respond to your ప్రభువు before a Day comes from అల్లాహ్ of which there is no repelling. No refuge will you have that day, nor for you will there be any denial.
42.48: But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste దయ from us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.
42.49: To అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what he wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.
42.50: Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.
42.51: And it is not for any human being that అల్లాహ్ should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.
42.53: The మార్గం of అల్లాహ్, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to అల్లాహ్ do [all] matters evolve.

43.3: Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.
43.4: And indeed it is, in the Mother of the గ్రంథం with Us, exalted and full of wisdom.
43.5: Then should We turn the message away, disregarding you, because you are a transgressing people?
43.6: And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples,
43.7: But there would not come to them a prophet except that they used to ridicule him.
43.8: And We destroyed greater than them in [striking] power, and the example of the former peoples has preceded.
43.9: And if you should ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "They were created by the Exalted in Might, the Knowing."
43.10: [The one] who has made for you the earth a bed and made for you upon it roads that you might be guided
43.11: And who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth -
43.12: And who created the species, all of them, and has made for you of ships and animals those which you mount.
43.13: That you may settle yourselves upon their backs and then remember the favor of your ప్రభువు when you have settled upon them and say. "Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it.
43.14: And indeed we, to our ప్రభువు, will [surely] return."
43.15: But they have attributed to Him from His servants a portion. Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.
43.16: Or has He taken, out of what He has created, daughters and chosen you for [having] sons?
43.17: And when one of them is given good tidings of that which he attributes to the Most Merciful in comparison, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
43.18: So is one brought up in ornaments while being during conflict unevident [attributed to అల్లాహ్]?
43.19: And they have made the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.
43.20: And they said, "If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have of that no knowledge. They are not but falsifying.
43.21: Or have We given them a book before the Qur'an to which they are adhering?
43.22: Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided."
43.23: And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."
43.24: [Each warner] said, "Even if I brought you better మార్గదర్శనం than that [religion] upon which you found your fathers?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
43.25: So we took retribution from them; then see how was the end of the deniers.
43.26: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship
43.27: Except for He who created me; and indeed, He will guide me."
43.28: And he made it a word remaining among his descendants that they might return [to it].
43.29: However, I gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers until there came to them the సత్యం and a clear Messenger.
43.30: But when the సత్యం came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed we are, concerning it, disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
43.31: And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"
43.32: Do they distribute the దయ of your ప్రభువు? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the దయ of your ప్రభువు is better than whatever they accumulate.
43.34: And for their houses - doors and couches [of silver] upon which to recline
43.36: And whoever is blinded from remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.
43.37: And indeed, the devils avert them from the way [of మార్గదర్శనం] while they think that they are [rightly] guided
43.38: Until, when he comes to Us [at Judgement], he says [to his companion], "Oh, I wish there was between me and you the distance between the east and west - how wretched a companion."
43.39: And never will it benefit you that Day, when you have wronged, that you are [all] sharing in the శిక్ష.
43.40: Then will you make the deaf hear, [O Muhammad], or guide the blind or he who is in clear error?
43.41: And whether [or not] We take you away [in death], indeed, We will take retribution upon them.
43.42: Or whether [or not] We show you that which We have promised them, indeed, We are Perfect in Ability.
43.44: And indeed, it is a remembrance for you and your people, and you [all] are going to be questioned.
43.45: And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers; have We made besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?
43.46: And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the ప్రభువు of the worlds."
43.47: But when he brought them Our signs, at once they laughed at them.
43.48: And We showed them not a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return [to faith].
43.49: And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your ప్రభువు by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."
43.50: But when We removed from them the affliction, at once they broke their word.
43.51: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?
43.52: Or am I [not] better than this one who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?
43.53: Then why have there not been placed upon him bracelets of gold or come with him the angels in conjunction?"
43.54: So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of అల్లాహ్].
43.55: And when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.
43.56: And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.
43.57: And when the son of Mary was presented as an example, immediately your people laughed aloud.
43.58: And they said, "Are your gods better, or is he?" They did not present the comparison except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a people prone to dispute.
43.59: Jesus was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.
43.60: And if We willed, We could have made [instead] of you angels succeeding [one another] on the earth.
43.62: And never let Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
43.63: And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear అల్లాహ్ and obey me.
43.65: But the denominations from among them differed [and separated], so woe to those who have wronged from the శిక్ష of a painful Day.
43.66: Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?
43.68: [To whom అల్లాహ్ will say], "O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve,
43.69: [You] who విశ్వసిస్తారుd in Our verses and were Muslims.
43.71: Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.
43.73: For you therein is much fruit from which you will eat.
43.75: It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.
43.76: And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.
43.77: And they will call, "O Malik, let your ప్రభువు put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."
43.78: We had certainly brought you the సత్యం, but most of you, to the సత్యం, were averse.
43.79: Or have they devised [some] affair? But indeed, We are devising [a plan].
43.80: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers are with them recording.
43.81: Say, [O Muhammad], "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of [his] worshippers."
43.82: Exalted is the ప్రభువు of the heavens and the earth, ప్రభువు of the Throne, above what they describe.
43.83: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised.
43.84: And it is అల్లాహ్ who is [the only] deity in the heaven, and on the earth [the only] deity. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.
43.85: And blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them and with whom is knowledge of the Hour and to whom you will be returned.
43.86: And those they invoke besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the సత్యం [can benefit], and they know.
43.87: And if you asked them who created them, they would surely say, "అల్లాహ్." So how are they deluded?
43.88: And [అల్లాహ్ acknowledges] his saying, "O my ప్రభువు, indeed these are a people who do not విశ్వసిస్తారు."
43.89: So turn aside from them and say, "Peace." But they are going to know.

44.3: Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night. Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].
44.4: On that night is made distinct every precise matter -
44.5: [Every] matter [proceeding] from Us. Indeed, We were to send [a messenger]
44.6: As దయ from your ప్రభువు. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
44.7: ప్రభువు of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you would be certain.
44.8: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your ప్రభువు and the ప్రభువు of your first forefathers.
44.9: But they are in సందేహం, amusing themselves.
44.10: Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke.
44.11: Covering the people; this is a painful torment.
44.12: [They will say], "Our ప్రభువు, remove from us the torment; indeed, we are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs."
44.13: How will there be for them a reminder [at that time]? And there had come to them a clear Messenger.
44.14: Then they turned away from him and said, "[He was] taught [and is] a madman."
44.15: Indeed, We will remove the torment for a little. Indeed, you [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs] will return [to disbelief].
44.16: The Day We will strike with the greatest assault, indeed, We will take retribution.
44.17: And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger,
44.18: [Saying], "Render to me the servants of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"
44.19: And [saying], "Be not haughty with అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I have come to you with clear authority.
44.20: And indeed, I have sought refuge in my ప్రభువు and your ప్రభువు, lest you stone me.
44.21: But if you do not విశ్వసిస్తారు me, then leave me alone."
44.22: And [finally] he called to his ప్రభువు that these were a criminal people.
44.23: [అల్లాహ్ said], "Then set out with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.
44.24: And leave the sea in stillness. Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."
44.25: How much they left behind of gardens and springs
44.27: And comfort wherein they were amused.
44.28: Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.
44.29: And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.
44.30: And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment -
44.31: From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.
44.32: And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.
44.33: And We gave them of signs that in which there was a clear trial.
44.35: "There is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
44.36: Then bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be సత్యంful."
44.37: Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.
44.38: And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.
44.39: We did not create them except in సత్యం, but most of them do not know.
44.40: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all -
44.41: The Day when no relation will avail a relation at all, nor will they be helped -
44.42: Except those [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] on whom అల్లాహ్ has దయ. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
44.45: Like murky oil, it boils within bellies
44.46: Like the boiling of scalding water.
44.48: Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water."
44.49: [It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble!
44.50: Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."
44.53: Wearing [garments of] fine silk and brocade, facing each other.
44.54: Thus. And We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
44.55: They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.
44.57: As bounty from your ప్రభువు. That is what is the great attainment.
44.58: And indeed, We have eased the Qur'an in your tongue that they might be reminded.
44.59: So watch, [O Muhammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].

45.2: The revelation of the గ్రంథం is from అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
45.3: Indeed, within the heavens and earth are signs for the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
45.4: And in the creation of yourselves and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for people who are certain [in faith].
45.5: And [in] the alternation of night and day and [in] what అల్లాహ్ sends down from the sky of provision and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and [in His] directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason.
45.6: These are the verses of అల్లాహ్ which We recite to you in సత్యం. Then in what statement after అల్లాహ్ and His verses will they విశ్వసిస్తారు?
45.8: Who hears the verses of అల్లాహ్ recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful శిక్ష.
45.9: And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating శిక్ష.
45.11: This [Qur'an] is మార్గదర్శనం. And those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in the verses of their ప్రభువు will have a painful శిక్ష of foul nature.
45.12: It is అల్లాహ్ who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
45.13: And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
45.14: Say, [O Muhammad], to those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd that they [should] forgive those who expect not the days of అల్లాహ్ so that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn.
45.15: Whoever does a good deed - it is for himself; and whoever does evil - it is against the self. Then to your ప్రభువు you will be returned.
45.16: And We did certainly give the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and preferred them over the worlds.
45.17: And We gave them clear proofs of the matter [of religion]. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your ప్రభువు will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
45.18: Then We put you, [O Muhammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.
45.20: This [Qur'an] is enlightenment for mankind and మార్గదర్శనం and దయ for a people who are certain [in faith].
45.22: And అల్లాహ్ created the heavens and earth in సత్యం and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
45.23: Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and అల్లాహ్ has sent him astray due to knowledge and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after అల్లాహ్? Then will you not be reminded?
45.24: And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.
45.25: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, "Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be సత్యంful."
45.26: Say, "అల్లాహ్ causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no సందేహం, but most of the people do not know."
45.27: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And the Day the Hour appears - that Day the falsifiers will lose.
45.28: And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], "Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.
45.29: This, Our record, speaks about you in సత్యం. Indeed, We were having transcribed whatever you used to do."
45.31: But as for those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a people of criminals?
45.32: And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం and the Hour [is coming] - no సందేహం about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.' "
45.33: And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
45.34: And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.
45.35: That is because you took the verses of అల్లాహ్ in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [అల్లాహ్].
45.36: Then, to అల్లాహ్ belongs [all] praise - ప్రభువు of the heavens and ప్రభువు of the earth, ప్రభువు of the worlds.
45.37: And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

46.2: The revelation of the గ్రంథం is from అల్లాహ్, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
46.3: We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in సత్యం and [for] a specified term. But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, from that of which they are warned, are turning away.
46.4: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides అల్లాహ్? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be సత్యంful."
46.5: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides అల్లాహ్ those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they, of their invocation, are unaware.
46.6: And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.
46.7: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say of the సత్యం when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."
46.8: Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from అల్లాహ్ at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving the Merciful."
46.9: Say, "I am not something original among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."
46.10: Say, "Have you considered: if the Qur'an was from అల్లాహ్, and you disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar and విశ్వసిస్తారుd while you were arrogant...?" Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people.
46.11: And those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు say of those who విశ్వసిస్తారు, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood."
46.12: And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a దయ. And this is a confirming గ్రంథం in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.
46.13: Indeed, those who have said, "Our ప్రభువు is అల్లాహ్," and then remained on a right course - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
46.17: But one who says to his parents, "Uff to you; do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations before me have already passed on [into oblivion]?" while they call to అల్లాహ్ for help [and to their son], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of అల్లాహ్ is సత్యం." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former people" -
46.18: Those are the ones upon whom the word has come into effect, [who will be] among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.
46.19: And for all there are degrees [of reward and శిక్ష] for what they have done, and [it is] so that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.
46.20: And the Day those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the శిక్ష of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient."
46.21: And mention, [O Muhammad], the brother of 'Aad, when he warned his people in the [region of] al-Ahqaf - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], "Do not worship except అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I fear for you the శిక్ష of a terrible day."
46.22: They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the సత్యంful."
46.23: He said, "Knowledge [of its time] is only with అల్లాహ్, and I convey to you that with which I was sent; but I see you [to be] a people behaving ignorantly."
46.24: And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain!" Rather, it is that for which you were impatient: a wind, within it a painful శిక్ష,
46.25: Destroying everything by command of its ప్రభువు. And they became so that nothing was seen [of them] except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
46.26: And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and హృదయాలు. But their hearing and vision and హృదయాలు availed them not from anything [of the శిక్ష] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of అల్లాహ్; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
46.27: And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs [or verses] that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].
46.28: Then why did those they took besides అల్లాహ్ as deities by which to approach [Him] not aid them? But they had strayed from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.
46.29: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.
46.32: But he who does not respond to the Caller of అల్లాహ్ will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."
46.33: Do they not see that అల్లాహ్, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.
46.34: And the Day those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the సత్యం?" They will say, "Yes, by our ప్రభువు." He will say, "Then taste the శిక్ష because you used to disవిశ్వసిస్తారు."
46.35: So be patient, [O Muhammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

47.1: Those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు and avert [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్ - He will waste their deeds.
47.3: That is because those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు follow falsehood, and those who విశ్వసిస్తారు follow the సత్యం from their ప్రభువు. Thus does అల్లాహ్ present to the people their comparisons.
47.4: So when you meet those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if అల్లాహ్ had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of అల్లాహ్ - never will He waste their deeds.
47.5: He will guide them and amend their condition
47.7: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, if you support అల్లాహ్, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
47.8: But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.
47.9: That is because they disliked what అల్లాహ్ revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
47.10: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? అల్లాహ్ destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is something comparable.
47.11: That is because అల్లాహ్ is the protector of those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd and because the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs have no protector.
47.13: And how many a city was stronger than your city [Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.
47.14: So is he who is on clear evidence from his ప్రభువు like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?
47.16: And among them, [O Muhammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom అల్లాహ్ has sealed over their హృదయాలు and who have followed their [own] desires.
47.18: Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then what good to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?
47.19: So know, [O Muhammad], that there is no deity except అల్లాహ్ and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And అల్లాహ్ knows of your movement and your resting place.
47.20: Those who విశ్వసిస్తారు say, "Why has a surah not been sent down? But when a precise surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose హృదయాలు is hypocrisy looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them [would have been]
47.21: Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to అల్లాహ్, it would have been better for them.
47.22: So would you perhaps, if you turned away, cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?
47.23: Those [who do so] are the ones that అల్లాహ్ has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.
47.24: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an, or are there locks upon [their] హృదయాలు?
47.25: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after మార్గదర్శనం had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.
47.26: That is because they said to those who disliked what అల్లాహ్ sent down, "We will obey you in part of the matter." And అల్లాహ్ knows what they conceal.
47.27: Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
47.28: That is because they followed what angered అల్లాహ్ and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
47.29: Or do those in whose హృదయాలు is disease think that అల్లాహ్ would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?
47.30: And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And అల్లాహ్ knows your deeds.
47.31: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of అల్లాహ్] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.
47.32: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and averted [people] from the మార్గం of అల్లాహ్ and opposed the Messenger after మార్గదర్శనం had become clear to them - never will they harm అల్లాహ్ at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.
47.33: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, obey అల్లాహ్ and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.
47.34: Indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and averted [people] from the మార్గం of అల్లాహ్ and then died while they were disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs - never will అల్లాహ్ forgive them.
47.35: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and అల్లాహ్ is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.
47.36: [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you విశ్వసిస్తారు and fear అల్లాహ్, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.
47.37: If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your unwillingness.
47.38: Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of అల్లాహ్ - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and అల్లాహ్ is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

48.1: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muhammad], a clear conquest
48.3: And [that] అల్లాహ్ may aid you with a mighty victory.
48.4: It is He who sent down tranquillity into the హృదయాలు of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to అల్లాహ్ belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is అల్లాహ్ Knowing and Wise.
48.5: [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of అల్లాహ్, a great attainment -
48.7: And to అల్లాహ్ belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Exalted in Might and Wise.
48.8: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner
48.10: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to అల్లాహ్. The hand of అల్లాహ్ is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised అల్లాహ్ - He will give him a great reward.
48.11: Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their హృదయాలు. Say, "Then who could prevent అల్లాహ్ at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is అల్లాహ్, with what you do, Acquainted.
48.12: But you thought that the Messenger and the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your హృదయాలు. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."
48.13: And whoever has not విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs a Blaze.
48.14: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Forgiving and Merciful.
48.15: Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of అల్లాహ్. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did అల్లాహ్ say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.
48.16: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit. So if you obey, అల్లాహ్ will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful శిక్ష."
48.17: There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful శిక్ష.
48.18: Certainly was అల్లాహ్ pleased with the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their హృదయాలు, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest
48.19: And much war booty which they will take. And ever is అల్లాహ్ Exalted in Might and Wise.
48.21: And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which అల్లాహ్ has already encompassed. And ever is అల్లాహ్, over all things, competent.
48.22: And if those [Makkans] who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.
48.23: [This is] the established way of అల్లాహ్ which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of అల్లాహ్ any change.
48.24: And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is అల్లాహ్ of what you do, Seeing.
48.25: They are the ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that అల్లాహ్ might admit to His దయ whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among them with painful శిక్ష
48.27: Certainly has అల్లాహ్ showed to His Messenger the vision in సత్యం. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if అల్లాహ్ wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].
48.28: It is He who sent His Messenger with మార్గదర్శనం and the religion of సత్యం to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is అల్లాహ్ as Witness.

49.1: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not put [yourselves] before అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger but fear అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Knowing.
49.2: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
49.4: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muhammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.
49.5: And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
49.6: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.
49.7: And know that among you is the Messenger of అల్లాహ్. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but అల్లాహ్ has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your హృదయాలు and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.
49.8: [It is] as bounty from అల్లాహ్ and favor. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
49.9: And if two factions among the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of అల్లాహ్. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves those who act justly.
49.10: The విశ్వసిస్తారుrs are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear అల్లాహ్ that you may receive దయ.
49.11: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
49.12: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear అల్లాహ్; indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
49.14: The bedouins say, "We have విశ్వసిస్తారుd." Say, "You have not [yet] విశ్వసిస్తారుd; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your హృదయాలు. And if you obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful."
49.15: The విశ్వసిస్తారుrs are only the ones who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger and then సందేహం not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of అల్లాహ్. It is those who are the సత్యంful.
49.16: Say, "Would you acquaint అల్లాహ్ with your religion while అల్లాహ్ knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things?"
49.17: They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islam. Say, "Do not consider your Islam a favor to me. Rather, అల్లాహ్ has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be సత్యంful."
49.18: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And అల్లాహ్ is Seeing of what you do.

50.2: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs say, "This is an amazing thing.
50.3: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant return."
50.4: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.
50.5: But they denied the సత్యం when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.
50.6: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?
50.7: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,
50.8: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to అల్లాహ్].
50.9: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest
50.10: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -
50.11: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.
50.12: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud
50.13: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot
50.14: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.
50.15: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.
50.16: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein
50.17: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.
50.18: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
50.19: And the intoxication of death will bring the సత్యం; that is what you were trying to avoid.
50.20: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
50.21: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.
50.22: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."
50.23: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."
50.25: Preventer of good, aggressor, and సందేహంer,
50.26: Who made [as equal] with అల్లాహ్ another deity; then throw him into the severe శిక్ష."
50.27: His [devil] companion will say, "Our ప్రభువు, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."
50.28: [అల్లాహ్] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.
50.29: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."
50.32: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to అల్లాహ్] and keeper [of His covenant]
50.33: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].
50.34: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."
50.35: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.
50.36: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?
50.37: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].
50.38: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.
50.39: So be patient, [O Muhammad], over what they say and exalt [అల్లాహ్] with praise of your ప్రభువు before the rising of the sun and before its setting,
50.40: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.
50.41: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -
50.42: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in సత్యం. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
50.43: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination
50.44: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
50.45: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.

51.2: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]
51.5: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
51.6: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.
51.8: Indeed, you are in differing speech.
51.9: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.
51.11: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
51.12: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
51.13: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire
51.14: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
51.16: Accepting what their ప్రభువు has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
51.17: They used to sleep but little of the night,
51.18: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,
51.19: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.
51.20: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]
51.21: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?
51.22: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.
51.23: Then by the ప్రభువు of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is సత్యం - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
51.24: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -
51.25: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.
51.26: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf
51.27: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"
51.28: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.
51.29: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"
51.30: They said, "Thus has said your ప్రభువు; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
51.31: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
51.32: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals
51.33: To send down upon them stones of clay,
51.34: Marked in the presence of your ప్రభువు for the transgressors."
51.35: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
51.36: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.
51.37: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful శిక్ష.
51.38: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.
51.39: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."
51.40: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.
51.41: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.
51.42: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
51.43: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
51.44: But they were insolent toward the command of their ప్రభువు, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
51.45: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.
51.46: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.
51.47: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.
51.48: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.
51.49: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.
51.50: So flee to అల్లాహ్. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51.51: And do not make [as equal] with అల్లాహ్ another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51.52: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
51.53: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
51.54: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.
51.55: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
51.56: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
51.57: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
51.58: Indeed, it is అల్లాహ్ who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.
51.59: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of శిక్ష] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.
51.60: And woe to those who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd from their Day which they are promised.

52.7: Indeed, the శిక్ష of your ప్రభువు will occur.
52.8: Of it there is no preventer.
52.9: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion
52.10: And the mountains will pass on, departing -
52.11: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,
52.12: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
52.14: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
