52.15: Then is this magic, or do you not see?
52.16: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."
52.19: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
52.20: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
52.21: And those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.
52.22: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.
52.23: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
52.24: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.
52.25: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
52.26: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing అల్లాహ్].
52.27: So అల్లాహ్ conferred favor upon us and protected us from the శిక్ష of the Scorching Fire.
52.28: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."
52.29: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your ప్రభువు, a soothsayer or a madman.
52.30: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"
52.31: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."
52.32: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?
52.33: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not విశ్వసిస్తారు.
52.34: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be సత్యంful.
52.35: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
52.36: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.
52.37: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your ప్రభువు? Or are they the controllers [of them]?
52.38: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority.
52.39: Or has He daughters while you have sons?
52.40: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
52.41: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
52.42: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - they are the object of a plan.
52.43: Or have they a deity other than అల్లాహ్? Exalted is అల్లాహ్ above whatever they associate with Him.
52.44: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."
52.45: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -
52.46: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.
52.47: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a శిక్ష before that, but most of them do not know.
52.48: And be patient, [O Muhammad], for the decision of your ప్రభువు, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [అల్లాహ్] with praise of your ప్రభువు when you arise.
52.49: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.

53.1: By the star when it descends,
53.2: Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
53.3: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
53.4: It is not but a revelation revealed,
53.5: Taught to him by one intense in strength -
53.6: One of soundness. And he rose to [his] true form
53.7: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.
53.9: And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.
53.10: And he revealed to His Servant what he revealed.
53.11: The heart did not lie [about] what it saw.
53.12: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?
53.13: And he certainly saw him in another descent
53.14: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -
53.15: Near it is the Garden of Refuge -
53.16: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].
53.17: The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].
53.18: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his ప్రభువు.
53.19: So have you considered al-Lat and al-'Uzza?
53.20: And Manat, the third - the other one?
53.21: Is the male for you and for Him the female?
53.22: That, then, is an unjust division.
53.23: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which అల్లాహ్ has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their ప్రభువు మార్గదర్శనం.
53.24: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
53.25: Rather, to అల్లాహ్ belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
53.26: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after అల్లాహ్ has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
53.28: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the సత్యం at all.
53.29: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.
53.30: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.
53.31: And to అల్లాహ్ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -
53.32: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your ప్రభువు is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
53.33: Have you seen the one who turned away
53.34: And gave a little and [then] refrained?
53.35: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?
53.36: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses
53.38: That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another
53.39: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
53.40: And that his effort is going to be seen -
53.41: Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense
53.42: And that to your ప్రభువు is the finality
53.43: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep
53.44: And that it is He who causes death and gives life
53.45: And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -
53.46: From a sperm-drop when it is emitted
53.47: And that [incumbent] upon Him is the next creation
53.48: And that it is He who enriches and suffices
53.49: And that it is He who is the ప్రభువు of Sirius
53.50: And that He destroyed the first [people of] 'Aad
53.51: And Thamud - and He did not spare [them] -
53.52: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.
53.53: And the overturned towns He hurled down
53.54: And covered them by that which He covered.
53.55: Then which of the favors of your ప్రభువు do you సందేహం?
53.56: This [Prophet] is a warner like the former warners.
53.58: Of it, [from those] besides అల్లాహ్, there is no remover.
53.59: Then at this statement do you wonder?
53.60: And you laugh and do not weep
53.62: So prostrate to అల్లాహ్ and worship [Him].

54.1: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].
54.2: And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."
54.3: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.
54.4: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence -
54.5: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
54.6: So leave them, [O Muhammad]. The Day the Caller calls to something forbidding,
54.7: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
54.8: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs will say, "This is a difficult Day."
54.9: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.
54.10: So he invoked his ప్రభువు, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."
54.11: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down
54.12: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.
54.13: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
54.14: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.
54.15: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
54.16: And how [severe] were My శిక్ష and warning.
54.17: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.18: 'Aad denied; and how [severe] were My శిక్ష and warning.
54.19: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
54.20: Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.
54.21: And how [severe] were My శిక్ష and warning.
54.22: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.24: And said, "Is it one human being among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.
54.25: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
54.26: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.
54.27: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.
54.28: And inform them that the water is shared between them, each [day of] drink attended [by turn].
54.29: But they called their companion, and he dared and hamstrung [her].
54.30: And how [severe] were My శిక్ష and warning.
54.31: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
54.32: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.33: The people of Lot denied the warning.
54.34: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn
54.35: As favor from us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
54.36: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.
54.37: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My శిక్ష and warning."
54.38: And there came upon them by morning an abiding శిక్ష.
54.39: So taste My శిక్ష and warning.
54.40: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.41: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.
54.42: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
54.43: Are your disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scripture?
54.44: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
54.45: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].
54.46: But the Hour is their appointment [for due శిక్ష], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
54.47: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.
54.48: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."
54.49: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
54.50: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
54.51: And We have already destroyed your kinds, so is there any who will remember?
54.52: And everything they did is in written records.
54.53: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.
54.55: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.

55.5: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
55.6: And the stars and trees prostrate.
55.7: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
55.8: That you not transgress within the balance.
55.9: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
55.10: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.
55.11: Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]
55.12: And grain having husks and scented plants.
55.13: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.14: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.
55.15: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
55.16: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.17: [He is] ప్రభువు of the two sunrises and ప్రభువు of the two sunsets.
55.18: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.19: He released the two seas, meeting [side by side];
55.20: Between them is a barrier [so] neither of them transgresses.
55.21: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.22: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
55.23: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.24: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
55.25: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.26: Everyone upon the earth will perish,
55.27: And there will remain the Face of your ప్రభువు, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
55.28: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.29: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is bringing about a matter.
55.30: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.31: We will attend to you, O prominent beings.
55.32: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.33: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from అల్లాహ్].
55.34: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.35: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke, and you will not defend yourselves.
55.36: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.37: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil -
55.38: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.39: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.
55.40: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.41: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
55.42: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.44: They will go around between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].
55.45: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.46: But for he who has feared the position of his ప్రభువు are two gardens -
55.47: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.49: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.50: In both of them are two springs, flowing.
55.51: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.52: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
55.53: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.54: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.
55.55: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.56: In them are women limiting [their] glances, untouched before them by man or jinni -
55.57: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.58: As if they were rubies and coral.
55.59: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.60: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?
55.61: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.62: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -
55.63: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.65: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.66: In both of them are two springs, spouting.
55.67: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.68: In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.
55.69: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.70: In them are good and beautiful women -
55.71: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.73: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.74: Untouched before them by man or jinni -
55.75: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny? -
55.76: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
55.77: So which of the favors of your ప్రభువు would you deny?
55.78: Blessed is the name of your ప్రభువు, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

56.2: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
56.3: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].
56.4: When the earth is shaken with convulsion
56.5: And the mountains are broken down, crumbling
56.8: Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
56.9: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
56.11: Those are the ones brought near [to అల్లాహ్]
56.13: A [large] company of the former peoples
56.14: And a few of the later peoples,
56.16: Reclining on them, facing each other.
56.17: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal
56.18: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
56.19: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -
56.20: And fruit of what they select
56.21: And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.
56.22: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
56.24: As reward for what they used to do.
56.25: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
56.27: The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
56.28: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed
56.37: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,
56.38: For the companions of the right [who are]
56.39: A company of the former peoples
56.40: And a company of the later peoples.
56.41: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
56.42: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water
56.43: And a shade of black smoke,
56.45: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
56.46: And they used to persist in the great violation,
56.47: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
56.49: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, the former and the later peoples
56.50: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."
56.51: Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,
56.52: Will be eating from trees of zaqqum
56.53: And filling with it your bellies
56.54: And drinking on top of it from scalding water
56.55: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
56.56: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.
56.57: We have created you, so why do you not విశ్వసిస్తారు?
56.58: Have you seen that which you emit?
56.59: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?
56.60: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone
56.61: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.
56.62: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?
56.63: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?
56.64: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?
56.65: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,
56.68: And have you seen the water that you drink?
56.69: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?
56.70: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?
56.71: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?
56.72: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?
56.73: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,
56.74: So exalt the name of your ప్రభువు, the Most Great.
56.75: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,
56.76: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.
56.77: Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an
56.79: None touch it except the purified.
56.80: [It is] a revelation from the ప్రభువు of the worlds.
56.81: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent
56.82: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?
56.83: Then why, when the soul at death reaches the throat
56.84: And you are at that time looking on -
56.85: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
56.86: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
56.87: Bring it back, if you should be సత్యంful?
56.88: And if the deceased was of those brought near to అల్లాహ్,
56.89: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
56.90: And if he was of the companions of the right,
56.91: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
56.92: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
56.93: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
56.95: Indeed, this is the true certainty,
56.96: So exalt the name of your ప్రభువు, the Most Great.

57.1: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts అల్లాహ్, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
57.2: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
57.3: He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is, of all things, Knowing.
57.4: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And అల్లాహ్, of what you do, is Seeing.
57.5: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to అల్లాహ్ are returned [all] matters.
57.6: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and he is Knowing of that within the breasts.
57.9: It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muhammad] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, అల్లాహ్ is to you Kind and Merciful.
57.10: And why do you not spend in the cause of అల్లాహ్ while to అల్లాహ్ belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all అల్లాహ్ has promised the best [reward]. And అల్లాహ్, with what you do, is Acquainted.
57.11: Who is it that would loan అల్లాహ్ a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
57.12: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
57.13: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing దయ, but on the outside of it is torment.
57.14: The hypocrites will call to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves and awaited [misfortune for us] and సందేహంed, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of అల్లాహ్. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning అల్లాహ్.
57.15: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.
57.16: Has the time not come for those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd that their హృదయాలు should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of అల్లాహ్ and what has come down of the సత్యం? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their హృదయాలు hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.
57.17: Know that అల్లాహ్ gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.
57.18: Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned అల్లాహ్ a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.
57.20: Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe శిక్ష and forgiveness from అల్లాహ్ and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.
57.21: Race toward forgiveness from your ప్రభువు and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd in అల్లాహ్ and His messengers. That is the bounty of అల్లాహ్ which He gives to whom He wills, and అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.
57.22: No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for అల్లాహ్, is easy -
57.23: In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And అల్లాహ్ does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -
57.24: [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
57.25: We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that అల్లాహ్ may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
57.26: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
57.27: Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the హృదయాలు of those who followed him compassion and దయ and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of అల్లాహ్. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who విశ్వసిస్తారుd among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
57.29: [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of అల్లాహ్ and that [all] bounty is in the hand of అల్లాహ్; He gives it to whom He wills. And అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.

58.1: Certainly has అల్లాహ్ heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ hears your dialogue; indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Hearing and Seeing.
58.2: Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Pardoning and Forgiving.
58.3: And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.
58.4: And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to విశ్వసిస్తారు [completely] in అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] అల్లాహ్. And for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is a painful శిక్ష.
58.5: Indeed, those who oppose అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs is a humiliating శిక్ష.
58.6: On the Day when అల్లాహ్ will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. అల్లాహ్ had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and అల్లాహ్ is, over all things, Witness.
58.7: Have you not considered that అల్లాహ్ knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There is in no private conversation three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed అల్లాహ్ is, of all things, Knowing.
58.10: Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, but he will not harm them at all except by permission of అల్లాహ్. And upon అల్లాహ్ let the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs rely.
58.11: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; అల్లాహ్ will make space for you. And when you are told, "Arise," then arise; అల్లాహ్ will raise those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.
58.12: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
58.13: Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and అల్లాహ్ has forgiven you, then [at least] establish నమాజ్ and give zakah and obey అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. And అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.
58.14: Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom అల్లాహ్ has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to unసత్యం while they know [they are lying].
58.15: అల్లాహ్ has prepared for them a severe శిక్ష. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
58.16: They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్, and for them is a humiliating శిక్ష.
58.17: Never will their wealth or their children avail them against అల్లాహ్ at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally
58.18: On the Day అల్లాహ్ will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
58.19: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of అల్లాహ్. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
58.20: Indeed, the ones who oppose అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.
58.21: అల్లాహ్ has written, "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

59.1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts అల్లాహ్, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
59.2: It is He who expelled the ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from అల్లాహ్; but [the decree of] అల్లాహ్ came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their హృదయాలు [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs. So take warning, O people of vision.
59.3: And if not that అల్లాహ్ had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the శిక్ష of the Fire.
59.4: That is because they opposed అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger. And whoever opposes అల్లాహ్ - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty.
59.5: Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of అల్లాహ్ and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.
59.6: And what అల్లాహ్ restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels, but అల్లాహ్ gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent.
59.7: And what అల్లాహ్ restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for అల్లాహ్ and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear అల్లాహ్; indeed, అల్లాహ్ is severe in penalty.
59.8: For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from అల్లాహ్ and [His] approval and supporting అల్లాహ్ and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the సత్యంful.
59.9: And [also for] those who were settled in al-Madinah and [adopted] the faith before them. They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the విజయంful.
59.10: And [there is a share for] those who came after them, saying, "Our ప్రభువు, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our హృదయాలు [any] resentment toward those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. Our ప్రభువు, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."
59.11: Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But అల్లాహ్ testifies that they are liars.
59.12: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.
59.13: You [విశ్వసిస్తారుrs] are more fearful within their breasts than అల్లాహ్. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
59.14: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their హృదయాలు are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
59.15: [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful శిక్ష.
59.16: [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disవిశ్వసిస్తారు." But when he disవిశ్వసిస్తారుs, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear అల్లాహ్, ప్రభువు of the worlds."
59.17: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrong-doers.
59.18: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, fear అల్లాహ్. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.
59.19: And be not like those who forgot అల్లాహ్, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
59.21: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from fear of అల్లాహ్. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
59.22: He is అల్లాహ్, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
59.23: He is అల్లాహ్, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is అల్లాహ్ above whatever they associate with Him.
59.24: He is అల్లాహ్, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

60.2: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disవిశ్వసిస్తారు.
60.3: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And అల్లాహ్, of what you do, is Seeing.
60.5: Our ప్రభువు, make us not [objects of] torment for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs and forgive us, our ప్రభువు. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
60.6: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in అల్లాహ్ and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
60.7: Perhaps అల్లాహ్ will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And అల్లాహ్ is competent, and అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
60.9: అల్లాహ్ only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
60.10: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. అల్లాహ్ is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, then do not return them to the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of అల్లాహ్; He judges between you. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing and Wise.
60.11: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear అల్లాహ్, in whom you are విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
60.12: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with అల్లాహ్, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
60.13: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, do not make allies of a people with whom అల్లాహ్ has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.

61.1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts అల్లాహ్, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
61.2: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, why do you say what you do not do?
61.3: Great is hatred in the sight of అల్లాహ్ that you say what you do not do.
61.4: Indeed, అల్లాహ్ loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
61.5: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of అల్లాహ్ to you?" And when they deviated, అల్లాహ్ caused their హృదయాలు to deviate. And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
61.6: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of అల్లాహ్ to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
61.7: And who is more unjust than one who invents about అల్లాహ్ unసత్యం while he is being invited to Islam. And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people.
61.8: They want to extinguish the light of అల్లాహ్ with their mouths, but అల్లాహ్ will perfect His light, although the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs dislike it.
61.9: It is He who sent His Messenger with మార్గదర్శనం and the religion of సత్యం to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with అల్లాహ్ dislike it.
61.10: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful శిక్ష?
61.12: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.
61.13: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from అల్లాహ్ and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
61.14: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, be supporters of అల్లాహ్, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for అల్లాహ్?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of అల్లాహ్." And a faction of the Children of Israel విశ్వసిస్తారుd and a faction disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd. So We supported those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd against their enemy, and they became dominant.

62.1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting అల్లాహ్, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
62.2: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the గ్రంథం and wisdom - although they were before in clear error -
62.3: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
62.4: That is the bounty of అల్లాహ్, which He gives to whom He wills, and అల్లాహ్ is the possessor of great bounty.
62.5: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of అల్లాహ్. And అల్లాహ్ does not guide the wrongdoing people.
62.6: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of అల్లాహ్, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be సత్యంful."
62.7: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
62.8: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
62.9: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, when [the adhan] is called for the నమాజ్ on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of అల్లాహ్ and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
62.10: And when the నమాజ్ has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of అల్లాహ్, and remember అల్లాహ్ often that you may succeed.
62.11: But when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muhammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with అల్లాహ్ is better than diversion and than a transaction, and అల్లాహ్ is the best of providers."

63.1: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of అల్లాహ్." And అల్లాహ్ knows that you are His Messenger, and అల్లాహ్ testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
63.2: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
63.3: That is because they విశ్వసిస్తారుd, and then they disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd; so their హృదయాలు were sealed over, and they do not understand.
63.4: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May అల్లాహ్ destroy them; how are they deluded?
63.5: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
63.6: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will అల్లాహ్ forgive them. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
63.7: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of అల్లాహ్ until they disband." And to అల్లాహ్ belongs the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
63.8: They say, "If we return to al-Madinah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to అల్లాహ్ belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs, but the hypocrites do not know.
63.9: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of అల్లాహ్. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
63.11: But never will అల్లాహ్ delay a soul when its time has come. And అల్లాహ్ is Acquainted with what you do.

64.1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting అల్లాహ్. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
64.2: It is He who created you, and among you is the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుr, and among you is the విశ్వసిస్తారుr. And అల్లాహ్, of what you do, is Seeing.
64.3: He created the heavens and earth in సత్యం and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
64.4: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of that within the breasts.
64.5: Has there not come to you the news of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful శిక్ష.
64.6: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and turned away. And అల్లాహ్ dispensed [with them]; and అల్లాహ్ is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
64.7: Those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my ప్రభువు, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for అల్లాహ్, is easy."
64.10: But the ones who disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
64.11: No disaster strikes except by permission of అల్లాహ్. And whoever విశ్వసిస్తారుs in అల్లాహ్ - He will guide his heart. And అల్లాహ్ is Knowing of all things.
64.12: And obey అల్లాహ్ and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
64.13: అల్లాహ్ - there is no deity except Him. And upon అల్లాహ్ let the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs rely.
64.14: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
64.15: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and అల్లాహ్ has with Him a great reward.
64.16: So fear అల్లాహ్ as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of అల్లాహ్]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the విజయంful.
64.17: If you loan అల్లాహ్ a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And అల్లాహ్ is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
64.18: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

65.1: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear అల్లాహ్, your ప్రభువు. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] అల్లాహ్. And whoever transgresses the limits of అల్లాహ్ has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps అల్లాహ్ will bring about after that a [different] matter.
65.3: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon అల్లాహ్ - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ will accomplish His purpose. అల్లాహ్ has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.
65.4: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you సందేహం, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears అల్లాహ్ - He will make for him of his matter ease.
65.5: That is the command of అల్లాహ్, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears అల్లాహ్ - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.
65.6: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for the father another woman.
65.7: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what అల్లాహ్ has given him. అల్లాహ్ does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. అల్లాహ్ will bring about, after hardship, ease.
65.8: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its ప్రభువు and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible శిక్ష.
65.9: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.
65.10: అల్లాహ్ has prepared for them a severe శిక్ష; so fear అల్లాహ్, O you of understanding who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd. అల్లాహ్ has sent down to you the Qur'an.
65.12: It is అల్లాహ్ who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that అల్లాహ్ is over all things competent and that అల్లాహ్ has encompassed all things in knowledge.

66.1: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what అల్లాహ్ has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.
66.2: అల్లాహ్ has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And అల్లాహ్ is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
66.3: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and అల్లాహ్ showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted."
66.5: Perhaps his ప్రభువు, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to అల్లాహ్], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.
66.6: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey అల్లాహ్ in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
66.7: O you who have disవిశ్వసిస్తారుd, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
66.8: O you who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd, repent to అల్లాహ్ with sincere repentance. Perhaps your ప్రభువు will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when అల్లాహ్ will not disgrace the Prophet and those who విశ్వసిస్తారుd with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our ప్రభువు, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
66.12: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she విశ్వసిస్తారుd in the words of her ప్రభువు and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.

67.1: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
67.2: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
67.3: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
67.4: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
67.5: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the శిక్ష of the Blaze.
67.7: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
67.8: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
67.9: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'అల్లాహ్ has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
67.10: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
67.11: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
67.12: Indeed, those who fear their ప్రభువు unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
67.13: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
67.14: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
67.15: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
67.16: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
67.17: Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
67.18: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
67.19: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
67.20: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs are not but in delusion.
67.21: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
67.23: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and హృదయాలు; little are you grateful."
67.24: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
67.25: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be సత్యంful?"
67.26: Say, "The knowledge is only with అల్లాహ్, and I am only a clear warner."
67.27: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."
67.28: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether అల్లాహ్ should cause my death and those with me or have దయ upon us, who can protect the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs from a painful శిక్ష?"
67.29: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
67.30: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

68.1: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
68.2: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your ప్రభువు, a madman.
68.3: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
68.4: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
68.5: So you will see and they will see
68.6: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
68.7: Indeed, your ప్రభువు is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
68.8: Then do not obey the deniers.
68.9: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
68.10: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
68.11: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
68.12: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
68.13: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
68.14: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
68.15: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
68.16: We will brand him upon the snout.
68.17: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
68.19: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your ప్రభువు while they were asleep.
68.20: And it became as though reaped.
68.21: And they called one another at morning,
68.22: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
68.23: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
68.24: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
68.25: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
68.26: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
68.28: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [అల్లాహ్]?' "
68.29: They said, "Exalted is our ప్రభువు! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
68.30: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
68.31: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
68.32: Perhaps our ప్రభువు will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our ప్రభువు desirous."
68.33: Such is the శిక్ష [of this world]. And the శిక్ష of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
68.35: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
68.36: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
68.37: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
68.38: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
68.39: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
68.40: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
68.41: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be సత్యంful.
68.42: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs will not be able,
68.43: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
68.44: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to శిక్ష] from where they do not know.
68.45: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
68.46: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
68.47: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
68.48: Then be patient for the decision of your ప్రభువు, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
68.49: If not that a favor from his ప్రభువు overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
68.51: And indeed, those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
68.52: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.

69.3: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
69.4: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
69.5: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
69.6: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
69.7: Which అల్లాహ్ imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in విజయంion, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
69.8: Then do you see of them any remains?
69.9: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
69.10: And they disobeyed the messenger of their ప్రభువు, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
69.11: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
69.12: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
69.13: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
69.14: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -
69.15: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
69.16: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.
69.17: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your ప్రభువు above them, that Day, eight [of them].
69.18: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
69.19: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
69.20: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
69.21: So he will be in a pleasant life -
69.23: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
69.24: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
69.25: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
69.26: And had not known what is my account.
69.27: I wish my death had been the decisive one.
69.28: My wealth has not availed me.
69.29: Gone from me is my authority."
69.30: [అల్లాహ్ will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
69.32: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
69.34: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
69.35: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
69.36: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
69.37: None will eat it except the sinners.
69.38: So I swear by what you see
69.39: And what you do not see
69.40: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
69.41: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you విశ్వసిస్తారు.
69.42: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
69.43: [It is] a revelation from the ప్రభువు of the worlds.
69.44: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
69.45: We would have seized him by the right hand;
69.46: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.
69.47: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
69.49: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
69.50: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs.
69.51: And indeed, it is the సత్యం of certainty.
69.52: So exalt the name of your ప్రభువు, the Most Great.

70.1: A supplicant asked for a శిక్ష bound to happen
70.2: To the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs; of it there is no preventer.
70.3: [It is] from అల్లాహ్, owner of the ways of ascent.
70.4: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
70.5: So be patient with gracious patience.
70.8: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,
70.9: And the mountains will be like wool,
70.10: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
70.11: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the శిక్ష of that Day by his children
70.12: And his wife and his brother
70.13: And his nearest kindred who shelter him
70.14: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
70.17: It invites he who turned his back [on సత్యం] and went away [from obedience]
70.21: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
70.23: Those who are constant in their నమాజ్
70.24: And those within whose wealth is a known right
70.25: For the petitioner and the deprived -
70.27: And those who are fearful of the శిక్ష of their ప్రభువు -
70.28: Indeed, the శిక్ష of their ప్రభువు is not that from which one is safe -
70.29: And those who guard their private parts
70.30: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
70.31: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
70.32: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
70.33: And those who are in their testimonies upright
70.34: And those who [carefully] maintain their నమాజ్:
70.35: They will be in gardens, honored.
70.36: So what is [the matter] with those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],
70.37: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?
70.38: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
70.39: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.
70.40: So I swear by the ప్రభువు of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able
70.41: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
70.42: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
70.43: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
70.44: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.

71.1: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful శిక్ష."
71.2: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,
71.3: [Saying], 'Worship అల్లాహ్, fear Him and obey me.
71.4: అల్లాహ్ will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] అల్లాహ్, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "
71.5: He said, "My ప్రభువు, indeed I invited my people [to సత్యం] night and day.
71.6: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.
71.7: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
71.9: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
71.10: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your ప్రభువు. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
71.11: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
71.12: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
71.13: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to అల్లాహ్ [due] grandeur
71.14: While He has created you in stages?
71.15: Do you not consider how అల్లాహ్ has created seven heavens in layers
71.16: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
71.17: And అల్లాహ్ has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
71.18: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
71.19: And అల్లాహ్ has made for you the earth an expanse
71.20: That you may follow therein roads of passage.' "
71.21: Noah said, "My ప్రభువు, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
71.22: And they conspired an immense conspiracy.
71.23: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.
71.24: And already they have misled many. And, [my ప్రభువు], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
71.25: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides అల్లాహ్ [any] helpers.
71.26: And Noah said, "My ప్రభువు, do not leave upon the earth from among the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs an inhabitant.
71.27: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disవిశ్వసిస్తారుr.
71.28: My ప్రభువు, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a విశ్వసిస్తారుr and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."

72.1: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.
72.2: It guides to the right course, and we have విశ్వసిస్తారుd in it. And we will never associate with our ప్రభువు anyone.
72.3: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our ప్రభువు; He has not taken a wife or a son
72.4: And that our foolish one has been saying about అల్లాహ్ an excessive transgression.
72.5: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about అల్లాహ్ a lie.
72.6: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.
72.7: And they had thought, as you thought, that అల్లాహ్ would never send anyone [as a messenger].
72.8: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
72.9: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
72.10: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their ప్రభువు intends for them a right course.
72.12: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to అల్లాహ్ upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
72.13: And when we heard the మార్గదర్శనం, we విశ్వసిస్తారుd in it. And whoever విశ్వసిస్తారుs in his ప్రభువు will not fear deprivation or burden.
72.14: And among us are Muslims [in submission to అల్లాహ్], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
72.16: And [అల్లాహ్ revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision
72.17: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his ప్రభువు He will put into arduous శిక్ష.
72.18: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for అల్లాహ్, so do not invoke with అల్లాహ్ anyone.
72.19: And that when the Servant of అల్లాహ్ stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."
72.20: Say, [O Muhammad], "I only invoke my ప్రభువు and do not associate with Him anyone."
72.21: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
72.22: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from అల్లాహ్ anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
72.24: [The disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
72.25: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my ప్రభువు will grant for it a [long] period."
72.26: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
72.27: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers
72.28: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their ప్రభువు; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.

73.1: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],
73.2: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
73.3: Half of it - or subtract from it a little
73.4: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.
73.5: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.
73.6: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.
73.7: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
73.8: And remember the name of your ప్రభువు and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
73.9: [He is] the ప్రభువు of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.
73.10: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
73.11: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
73.12: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire
73.13: And food that chokes and a painful శిక్ష -
73.14: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
73.15: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
73.16: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
73.17: Then how can you fear, if you disవిశ్వసిస్తారు, a Day that will make the children white- haired?
73.18: The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled.
73.19: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his ప్రభువు a way.
73.20: Indeed, your ప్రభువు knows, [O Muhammad], that you stand [in నమాజ్] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And అల్లాహ్ determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of అల్లాహ్ and others fighting for the cause of అల్లాహ్. So recite what is easy from it and establish నమాజ్ and give zakah and loan అల్లాహ్ a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with అల్లాహ్. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of అల్లాహ్. Indeed, అల్లాహ్ is Forgiving and Merciful.

74.1: O you who covers himself [with a garment],
74.6: And do not confer favor to acquire more
74.7: But for your ప్రభువు be patient.
74.8: And when the trumpet is blown,
74.9: That Day will be a difficult day
74.11: Leave Me with the one I created alone
74.12: And to whom I granted extensive wealth
74.14: And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
74.15: Then he desires that I should add more.
74.16: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
74.17: I will cover him with arduous torment.
74.19: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
74.20: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
74.23: Then he turned back and was arrogant
74.24: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
74.25: This is not but the word of a human being."
74.26: I will drive him into Saqar.
74.27: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
74.28: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
74.31: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disవిశ్వసిస్తారు - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have విశ్వసిస్తారుd will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the విశ్వసిస్తారుrs will not సందేహం and that those in whose హృదయాలు is hypocrisy and the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs will say, "What does అల్లాహ్ intend by this as an example?" Thus does అల్లాహ్ leave astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your ప్రభువు except Him. And mention of the Fire is not but a reminder to humanity.
74.33: And [by] the night when it departs
74.34: And [by] the morning when it brightens,
74.35: Indeed, the Fire is of the greatest [afflictions]
74.37: To whoever wills among you to proceed or stay behind.
74.38: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained
74.39: Except the companions of the right,
74.40: [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
74.42: [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
74.43: They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
74.44: Nor did we used to feed the poor.
74.45: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
74.46: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
74.47: Until there came to us the certainty."
74.48: So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
74.49: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
74.50: As if they were alarmed donkeys
74.52: Rather, every person among them desires that he would be given scriptures spread about.
74.53: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
74.54: No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder
74.55: Then whoever wills will remember it.
74.56: And they will not remember except that అల్లాహ్ wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.

75.1: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
75.2: And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].
75.3: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
75.4: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
75.5: But man desires to continue in sin.
75.6: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
75.9: And the sun and the moon are joined,
75.10: Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
75.12: To your ప్రభువు, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
75.13: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead and kept back.
75.14: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,
75.15: Even if he presents his excuses.
75.16: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.
75.17: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
75.18: So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
75.19: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
75.20: No! But you love the immediate
75.22: [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
75.24: And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
75.25: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
75.26: No! When the soul has reached the collar bones
75.27: And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
75.28: And the dying one is certain that it is the [time of] separation
75.29: And the leg is wound about the leg,
75.30: To your ప్రభువు, that Day, will be the procession.
75.31: And the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుr had not విశ్వసిస్తారుd, nor had he prayed.
75.32: But [instead], he denied and turned away.
75.33: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
75.35: Then woe to you, and woe!
75.36: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
75.37: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
75.38: Then he was a clinging clot, and [అల్లాహ్] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
75.39: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
75.40: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?

76.1: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
76.2: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
76.3: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
76.4: Indeed, We have prepared for the disవిశ్వసిస్తారుrs chains and shackles and a blaze.
76.7: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
76.8: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
76.9: [Saying], "We feed you only for the countenance of అల్లాహ్. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
76.10: Indeed, We fear from our ప్రభువు a Day austere and distressful."
76.11: So అల్లాహ్ will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
76.13: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
76.14: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
76.15: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
76.16: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
76.17: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
76.19: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
76.21: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their ప్రభువు will give them a purifying drink.
76.22: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
76.23: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.
76.24: So be patient for the decision of your ప్రభువు and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disవిశ్వసిస్తారుr].
76.25: And mention the name of your ప్రభువు [in నమాజ్] morning and evening
76.26: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.
